TunableTuple.name: no_content
TunableTuple.description: Do not animate or stage in this interaction.

TunableVariant.name: allow_holster
TunableVariant.description:
If enabled, specify an override as to whether or not this interaction allows holstering. If left unspecified, then only staging interactions will allow holstering.
For example: a one-shot interaction where the Grim Reaper dooms a Sim disallows carry. Normally, the Grim Reaper would be unable to holster his scythe. We override holstering to be allowed such that the scythe can indeed be holstered.

Tunable.name: override
Tunable.description: Whether or not holstering is explicitly allowed or not.

TunableVariant.name: allow_with_unholsterable_object
TunableVariant.description:
If enabled, specify an override to the default behavior for this interaction when carrying an object that is tuned to be unholsterable (e.g. a toddler or a puppy).
By default: * Mixer interactions have this set to True. So, unless overridden, a mixer is allowed to execute normally when carrying an unholsterable object. The Sim will continue the carry and execute the mixer. If unchecked, the Sim will put the object down before running the mixer.
* Super interactions have this set to False. So, unless overridden, a super interaction is not allowed to execute (or will cancel the carry) when carrying an unholsterable object.
e.g. * Warm Hands at Fireplace. This is a super interaction. When carrying a toddler, for example, we want to the Sim to execute the interaction and mask the animation. So we override this value and set it to True.
* Tell Joke about Fashion. This is a mixer interaction whose animation does not read if unable to use the hands. We override this so Sims put down toddlers before running it.

Tunable.name: override
Tunable.description: Whether or not this interaction is allowed to execute when carrying an incompatible, unholsterable object.

TunableVariant.name: route_to_location
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this will force the Sim to route to a particular set of constraints. This will occur between the animation's begin and end states.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: An element that will route a Sim to a particular location when it runs.

TunableList.name: route_constraints
TunableList.description: A list of constraints and the participant they are relative to that the Sim will route to fulfill when this element runs.

TunableList.name: constraints
TunableList.description: Constraints relative to the relative participant.

TunableVariant.description: A constraint that must be fulfilled in order to interact with this object.

TunableTuple.name: circle
TunableTuple.description: The relative circle geometry required for a sim/posture to use the object.

Tunable.name: enables_height_scoring
Tunable.description: If enabled, this constraint will score goals using the height of the surface. The higher the goal the cheaper it is.

Tunable.name: ideal_radius
Tunable.description: Ideal distance for this circle constraint, points closer to the ideal distance will score higher.

Tunable.name: ideal_radius_width
Tunable.description: This creates a band around the ideal_radius that also costs 0 instead of rising in cost. ex: If you have a circle of radius 5, with an ideal_radius of 2.5, and a ideal_radius_width of 0.5, all goals in the radius 2 to radius 3 range will score optimially.

Tunable.name: multi_surface
Tunable.description:
If enabled, this constraint will be considered for multiple surfaces.
Example: You want a circle constraint that can be both inside and outside of a pool.

Tunable.name: radial_cost_weight
Tunable.description: The importance of the radial cost function. = 0: Not used > 1: Important on surfaces > 2: Important on grass

Tunable.name: radius
Tunable.description: Circle radius

Tunable.name: require_los
Tunable.description:
If checked, the Sim will require line of sight to the actor. Positions where a Sim can't see the actor (e.g. there's a wall in the way) won't be valid.
NOTE: This will NOT work on a constraint that is not used to generate routing goals such as broadcasters and reactions, use a Line Of Sight Constraint instead. This will work on constraints used to keep Sims in an interaction.

TunableTuple.name: cone
TunableTuple.description: The relative cone geometry required for a sim/posture to use the object.

Tunable.name: angle
Tunable.description: The cone angle in degrees.

Tunable.name: angular_cost_weight
Tunable.description: The importance of the angular cost function. = 0: Not used > 1: Important on surfaces > 2: Important on grass

Tunable.name: enables_height_scoring
Tunable.description: If enabled, this constraint will score goals using the height of the surface. The higher the goal the cheaper it is.

Tunable.name: ideal_angle
Tunable.description: The angular extents of an ideal region as a fraction of angle.

Tunable.name: ideal_radius_max
Tunable.description: The radial upper bound of an ideal region as a fraction of the difference between max_radius and min_radius.

Tunable.name: ideal_radius_min
Tunable.description: The radial lower bound of an ideal region as a fraction of the difference between max_radius and min_radius.

Tunable.name: max_radius
Tunable.description: The maximum cone radius.

Tunable.name: min_radius
Tunable.description: The minimum cone radius.

Tunable.name: multi_surface
Tunable.description:
If enabled, this constraint will be considered for multiple surfaces.
Example: You want a circle constraint that can be both inside and outside of a pool.

Tunable.name: offset
Tunable.description:
An offset (rotation) in degrees.
By default the cone will face the forward vector of the object. Use an offset to rotate the cone to face a different direction.

Tunable.name: radial_cost_weight
Tunable.description: The importance of the radial cost function. = 0: Not used > 1: Important on surfaces > 2: Important on grass

Tunable.name: require_los
Tunable.description:
If checked, the Sim will require line of sight to the actor. Positions where a Sim can't see the actor (e.g. there's a wall in the way) won't be valid.
NOTE: This will NOT work on a constraint that is not used to generate routing goals such as broadcasters and reactions, use a Line Of Sight Constraint instead. This will work on constraints used to keep Sims in an interaction.

TunableTuple.name: current_position
TunableTuple.description: A constraint that is a small circle around the actor Sim's current position. For interactions, regardless of what the tuned constraint actor is, the Actor participant is always used as the target for the generated circle.

Tunable.name: ignore_on_object_routing_surface
Tunable.description: If checked, we will ignore this constraint on the object routing surface. This should be used when we are only tuning this constraint for performance reasons in order to be compatible with stair landings or other object routing surface areas that are not in the sim quadtree- which don't support geometric constraints.

Tunable.name: radius
Tunable.description: The maximum radius around the center point.

TunableTuple.name: facing
TunableTuple.description: Existential tunable that requires the sim to face the object.

Tunable.name: inner_radius
Tunable.description: A radius around the center of the constraint that defines an area in which the Sim's facing is unrestricted.

Tunable.name: range
Tunable.description: The size of the angle-range that sims should use when determining facing constraints.

TunableVariant.name: subroot_index
TunableVariant.description: An optional subroot to use for facing.

TunableTuple.name: line_of_sight
TunableTuple.description: Existential tunable that creates a line of sight constraint.

Tunable.name: multi_surface
Tunable.description:
If enabled, this constraint will be considered for multiple surfaces.
Example: You want a circle constraint that can be both inside and outside of a pool.

TunableVariant.name: temporary_los
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, a Line of Sight component will be temporarily created when constraints are needed. This should be used if the affordance requires LOS on an object that doesn't have an LOS component (i.e. a Sim needs to see another Sim WooHoo to play the jealousy reactions but Sims don't have LoS components.)

Tunable.name: boundary_epsilon
Tunable.description: The LOS origin is allowed to be outside of the boundary by this amount.

Tunable.name: facing_offset
Tunable.description: The LOS origin is offset from the object origin by this amount (mainly to avoid intersecting walls).

Tunable.name: map_divisions
Tunable.description: The number of points around the object to check collision from. More points means higher accuracy.

Tunable.name: max_line_of_sight_radius
Tunable.description: The maximum possible distance from this object than an interaction can reach.

Tunable.name: simplification_ratio
Tunable.description: A factor determining how much to combine edges in the line of sight polygon.

TunableTuple.name: ocean_loc
TunableTuple.description: The circle geometry relative to the nearest ocean locator.

Tunable.description: If enabled, this constraint will score goals using the height of the surface. The higher the goal the cheaper it is.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Ideal radius data.

Tunable.name: radius
Tunable.description: The constraint's relative ideal radius. A value of 1 would mean the ideal location is on the outskirt of the constraint; values towards 0 approach the constraint's center.

Tunable.name: width
Tunable.description: This creates a band around the ideal_radius that also scores to 1 instead of starting to fall off to 0 in scoring. ex: If you have a circle of radius 5, with an ideal_radius of 2.5, and a ideal_radius_width of 0.5, any goals in the radius 2 to radius 3 range will all score optimially.

Tunable.name: relative_radius
Tunable.description: The constraint's radius relative to the size of the object. This is a simple multiplier applied to the area generated by the object's footprint

TunableEnum.name: spawn_point_request_reason
TunableEnum.description: The reason why we want the spawn point. Certain spawn points are only available for specific reasons, such as specific spawn points for leaving or for spawning at.

TunableVariant.name: tags
TunableVariant.description: A constraint that represents all of the spawn locations on the lot.

Tunable.name: use_lot_id
Tunable.description: If checked then we will use the current lot id to limit spawn points that are linked to lots to the current lot. Otherwise we will get spawn points of the given type that are potenially not linked to the current lot.

TunableVariant.name: backup_tags
TunableVariant.description: A constraint that represents primary spawn points with backup secondary ones.

TunableEnum.name: spawn_point_request_reason
TunableEnum.description: The reason why we want the spawn point. Certain spawn points are only available for specific reasons, such as specific spawn points for leaving or for spawning at.

TunableVariant.name: spawn_point_tags

TunableTuple.description: Tags are pulled via the associated career interaction for a university course.

TunableTuple.name: university_course_slot_participant
TunableTuple.description: Tags are pulled via the specified participant holding the id of a university course.

TunableEnum.name: participant

TunableTuple.name: university_course_slot_reference
TunableTuple.description: Tags are pulled via the specified university course slot.

Tunable.name: _course_slot
Tunable.description: Course slot from which to pull the spawn point tags.

Tunable.name: use_lot_id_for_backup
Tunable.description: If checked then we will use the current lot id to limit spawn points that are linked to lots to the current lot if we fall back to the backup tags.

TunableTuple.name: terrain_material
TunableTuple.description: A water depth constraint which defines only the terrain materials required.

TunableVariant.name: terrain_tags
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, a set of allowed terrain tags. At least one tag must match the terrain under each vertex of the footprint of the supplied object.

TunableTuple.name: water_depth
TunableTuple.description: A water depth constraint which defines only the ocean water depth required.

TunableVariant.name: max_water_depth
TunableVariant.description: (float) If provided, each vertex of the test polygon along with its centroid will be tested to determine whether the ocean water at the test location is at most this deep. Values <= 0 indicate placement in ocean is invalid.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Value of the max water depth allowed.

TunableVariant.name: min_water_depth
TunableVariant.description: (float) If provided, each vertex of the test polygon along with its centroid will be tested to determine whether the ocean water at the test location is at least this deep. Values <= 0 indicate placement on land is valid.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Value of the min water depth allowed.

TunableTuple.name: water_depth_interval
TunableTuple.description: A water depth constraint which defines only the ocean water depth required.

TunableEnum.name: interval
TunableEnum.description: Test if a Sim should be walking, wading or swimming based on the water height offset at a target location and the Sim's wading interval data.

TunableEnum.name: relative_participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant tuned here will have this constraint applied to them.

TunableList.name: basic_extras
TunableList.description: Additional elements to run around the basic content of the interaction.

TunableTuple.description: Adds a sim to the active household.

TunableVariant.description: If enabled, add additional text to the dialog

Tunable.description: A localized string that may use tokens.

Tunable.name: anonymous_target_sim
Tunable.description: If this dialog is using a target sim id to give a conversation type view and this is checked, then the target sim icon will instead be replaced by an anonymous caller.

TunableVariant.name: aspirations_and_trait_assignment
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, we will show the aspiration and trait assignment portion of the dialog.

Tunable.name: immediate_audio
Tunable.description:
If checked, this audio will be triggered immediately, nothing will block.
ex. Earbuds audio will be played immediately while the Sim is routing or animating.

TunableVariant.name: joint_name_hash
TunableVariant.description: Specify if the audio is attached to a slot and, if so, which slot. Otherwise the audio will be attached to the object's origin.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The name of the slot this audio is attached to.

Tunable.name: play_on_active_sim_only
Tunable.description:
If enabled, and audio target is Sim, the audio will only be played on selected Sim. Otherwise it will be played regardless Sim is selected or not.
If audio target is Object, always set this to False. Otherwise the audio will never be played.
ex. This will be useful for Earbuds where we want to hear the music only when the Sim is selected.

TunableVariant.name: background_audio
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, play background audio while the dialog is open.

Tunable.name: enabled

TunableEnum.name: target

TunableVariant.name: timing
TunableVariant.description: Determines the exact timing of the behavior, either at the beginning of an interaction, the end, or when an xevt occurs in an animation played as part of the interaction.

TunableTuple.name: at_beginning
TunableTuple.description: The behavior should occur at the very beginning of the interaction. It will not be tightly synchronized visually with animation. This isn't a very common use case and would most likely be used in an immediate interaction or to change hidden state that is used for bookkeeping rather than visual appearance.

TunableVariant.name: offset_time
TunableVariant.description:
If enabled, the interaction will wait this amount of time after the beginning before running the element.
Only use this if absolutely necessary. Better alternatives include using xevts, time based conditional action with loot ops, and using outcomes.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The interaction will wait this amount of time after the beginning before running the element

TunableTuple.name: at_end
TunableTuple.description: The behavior should occur at the end of the interaction. It will not be tightly synchronized visually with animation. An example might be an object that gets dirty every time a Sim uses it (so using a commodity change is overkill) but no precise synchronization with animation is desired, as might be the case with vomiting in the toilet.

TunableTuple.name: on_xevt
TunableTuple.description:
The behavior should occur synchronized visually with an xevt in an animation played as part of the interaction. If for some reason such an event doesn't occur, the behavior will occur at the end of the interaction unless supports failsafe is False.
This is by far the most common use case, as when a Sim flushes a toilet and the water level should change when the actual flush animation and effects fire.

Tunable.name: supports_failsafe
Tunable.description: If checked and the x-event does not fire, the basic extra will still run at the end of the interaction as a fail-safe.

TunableTuple.name: add_to_travel_group
TunableTuple.description: Adds a Sim to a participant's travel group.

Tunable.name: include_household_travel_group
Tunable.description: If checked, the travel group that any sims in the travel group participant's household will be used in the event that the travel group participant is not actually on vacation. (e.g. Sim adding himself to his households travel group)

TunableTuple.name: success_chance
TunableTuple.description: The percentage chance that this action will be applied.

Tunable.name: base_chance
Tunable.description: The basic chance of success.

TunableList.name: multipliers
TunableList.description: A list of multipliers to apply to base_chance.

Tunable.name: multiplier
Tunable.description: The multiplier to apply to base_chance if the associated tests pass.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A series of tests that must pass in order for multiplier to be applied.

TunableEnum.name: target_to_add
TunableEnum.description: The participant we want to add to the travel group.

TunableVariant.name: timing
TunableVariant.description: Determines the exact timing of the behavior, either at the beginning of an interaction, the end, or when an xevt occurs in an animation played as part of the interaction.

If enabled, the interaction will wait this amount of time after the beginning before running the element.
Only use this if absolutely necessary. Better alternatives include using xevts, time based conditional action with loot ops, and using outcomes.

This is by far the most common use case, as when a Sim flushes a toilet and the water level should change when the actual flush animation and effects fire.

TunableEnum.name: travel_group_participant

TunableTuple.name: adventure
TunableTuple.description: A series of individual moments linked together in a game-like fashion.

TunableList.name: _adventure_moments
TunableList.description: The individual adventure moments for this adventure. Every moment used in the adventure must be defined here. For instance, if there is an adventure moment that triggers another adventure moment, the latter must also be defined in this list.

TunableVariant.name: aventure_moment
TunableVariant.description: This may be tuned in place here using 'literal' or as a reference to a AdventureMoment tuning snippet.

TunableTuple.name: literal
TunableTuple.description: A phase of an adventure. Adventure moments may present some information in a dialog form and for a choice to be made regarding how the overall adventure will branch.

TunableList.name: _finish_actions
TunableList.description: A list of choices that can be made by the player to determine branching for the adventure. They will be displayed as buttons in the UI. If no dialog is displayed, then the first available finish action will be selected. If this list is empty, the adventure ends.

TunableList.name: action_results
TunableList.description: A list of possible results that can occur if this finish action is selected. Action results can award loot, display notifications, and control the branching of the adventure by selecting the next adventure moment to run.

TunableList.name: continuation
TunableList.description: A continuation to push when running finish actions.

TunableTuple.description: A continuation entry.

TunableEnum.name: actor
TunableEnum.description: The Sim on which the affordance is pushed.

Tunable.name: affordance
Tunable.description: The affordance to push as a continuation on the specified actor Sim.

TunableVariant.name: carry_target
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, specify a carry target for this continuation.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: The participant the affordance will set as a carry target.

TunableVariant.name: inventory_carry_target
TunableVariant.description: Item in inventory (of continuations actor) to use as carry target for continuation if carry target is None

Tunable.name: definition
Tunable.description: The base definition to look for inside inventory. Objects that redirect (like counters) will match if base definition is the same.

Tunable.name: definition
Tunable.description: The exact object definition to look for inside inventory.

TunableTuple.name: object_with_tag
TunableTuple.description: This option tests crafted item's tags against a list of possible tags

TunableList.name: tag_set
TunableList.description: The tag of objects we want to test ownership of

TunableEnum.description: What tag to test for

TunableEnum.name: test_type
TunableEnum.description: How to test the tags in the tag set against the objects on the lot.

Tunable.name: preserve_preferred_object
Tunable.description:
If checked, the pushed interaction's preferred objects are determined by the current preferred objects.
If unchecked, the transition sequence would not award bonuses to any specific part.

Tunable.name: preserve_target_part
Tunable.description: If checked, the pushed interaction will use the same target part if applicable. Defaults to false because typically we will want to let the transition select which part to use.

Tunable.name: si_affordance_override
Tunable.description: When the tuned affordance is a mixer for a different SI, use this to specify the mixer's appropriate SI. This is useful for pushing socials.

TunableEnum.name: target
TunableEnum.description: The participant the affordance will target.

TunableList.name: events_to_send
TunableList.description: A list of events to send.

TunableEnum.description: events types to send

TunableList.name: loot_actions
TunableList.description: List of Loot actions that are awarded if this action result is selected.

TunableList.name: next_moments
TunableList.description: A list of adventure moment keys. One of these keys will be selected to determine which adventure moment is selected next. If the list is empty, the adventure ends here. Any of the keys tuned here will have to be tuned in the _adventure_moments tunable for the owning adventure.

TunableVariant.name: notification
TunableVariant.description: If set, this notification will be displayed.

TunableVariant.name: enabled
TunableVariant.description: This may be tuned in place here using 'literal' or as a reference to a Notification tuning snippet.

TunableTuple.name: literal
TunableTuple.description: A dialog that is displayed as a notification.

TunableVariant.name: additional_texts
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, add additional text to the dialog

Tunable.description: A localized string that may use tokens.

Tunable.name: anonymous_target_sim
Tunable.description: If this dialog is using a target sim id to give a conversation type view and this is checked, then the target sim icon will instead be replaced by an anonymous caller.

TunableVariant.name: audio_sting
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, play an audio sting when the dialog is shown.

Tunable.name: audio
Tunable.description: The sound to play.

Tunable.name: immediate_audio
Tunable.description:
If checked, this audio will be triggered immediately, nothing will block.
ex. Earbuds audio will be played immediately while the Sim is routing or animating.

TunableVariant.name: joint_name_hash
TunableVariant.description: Specify if the audio is attached to a slot and, if so, which slot. Otherwise the audio will be attached to the object's origin.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The name of the slot this audio is attached to.

Tunable.name: play_on_active_sim_only
Tunable.description:
If enabled, and audio target is Sim, the audio will only be played on selected Sim. Otherwise it will be played regardless Sim is selected or not.
If audio target is Object, always set this to False. Otherwise the audio will never be played.
ex. This will be useful for Earbuds where we want to hear the music only when the Sim is selected.

TunableVariant.name: background_audio
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, play background audio while the dialog is open.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The background audio event string.

ex. Earbuds audio will be played immediately while the Sim is routing or animating.

Tunable.name: play_on_active_sim_only

If enabled, and audio target is Sim, the audio will only be played on selected Sim. Otherwise it will be played regardless Sim is selected or not.
If audio target is Object, always set this to False. Otherwise the audio will never be played.
ex. This will be useful for Earbuds where we want to hear the music only when the Sim is selected.

TunableTuple.name: money_amount

TunableTuple.name: object_marketplace

TunableVariant.name: object_marketplace_data

TunableEnum.name: obj_property

TunableTuple.name: participant_count

TunableTuple.name: from_gardening
TunableTuple.description: The generated objects are those gardening objects that are within the specified distance from the tuned participant.

TunableTuple.description: Return all harvestables, i.e. all fruits/flowers parented to plants.

TunableTuple.name: plants
TunableTuple.description: Return all plants.

TunableEnum.name: participant

TunableEnum.name: participant

TunableVariant.name: formatter

TunableTuple.name: bullet_list
TunableTuple.description: The token is a string, which is a formatted bullet point list. Objects are grouped by definition. The text for each item must be specified.

Tunable.name: bullet_text
Tunable.description: The text for the bullet entry. The string is provided the following tokens, in this order: 0 An object representitive of the group 1 The number of objects in the group

TunableTuple.name: single
TunableTuple.description: The token is a single object name. If multiple participants are returned, an arbitrary one is used. That is, unless the mismatch key is specified. In that case, the string is used unless all of the participants' definitions match.

TunableVariant.name: mismatch_name
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this is the object name to use when using a multi- object participant yielding definitions with different names.

Tunable.name: enabled

TunableVariant.name: scholarship_letter_component_data

TunableTuple.name: street
TunableTuple.description: Using the Street Selector tuning, provide a token localization appropriate street selection.

TunableVariant.description: Select what street to test.

TunableTuple.name: via_street_participant

TunableVariant.name: via_zone_source
TunableVariant.description: Select the street to use by specifying a Zone Source.

TunableTuple.name: use_current_zone

TunableTuple.name: use_participant_home_zone
TunableTuple.description: Get a participant's home zone. Can be None if they don't have one.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: Test against the participant's home zone. Townies' home zone will be None.

TunableTuple.name: use_pick_info
TunableTuple.description: Get the zone of the lot the user clicked on.

TunableTuple.name: use_picked_zone_ids
TunableTuple.description: Get the zone from the interaction's picked_zone_ids participant. Usually comes from a picker.

TunableVariant.name: street_data

TunableVariant.name: timeout_duration
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, override the timeout duration for this dialog in game time.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The time, in sim minutes, that this dialog should time out.

TunableVariant.name: title
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this dialog will include title text.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The dialog's title.

TunableList.name: ui_responses
TunableList.description: A list of buttons that are mapped to UI commands.

TunableTuple.description: A dialog response.

TunableVariant.name: response_command
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, specifies a command to be called by the client.

TunableVariant.name: enabled
TunableVariant.description: This may be tuned in place here using 'literal' or as a reference to a UIResponseCommand tuning snippet.

TunableTuple.name: literal
TunableTuple.description: A UI Response that sends a server command.

TunableList.name: arguments
TunableList.description: The arguments for this command. Arguments will be added after the command.

TunableVariant.description: An argument being passed to the command.

TunableTuple.name: boolean
TunableTuple.description: A boolean value.

TunableTuple.name: floating_point
TunableTuple.description: A floating point number.

TunableTuple.name: integer
TunableTuple.description: An integer number.

TunableTuple.name: participant_id
TunableTuple.description: UI Response argument that will resolve the participant specified.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant to resolve for this response argument. The value sent will be the id of the specified participant. If more than one participant is found, it will only send the id of the first participant found.

TunableTuple.name: special_command_data
TunableTuple.description: This will use the data passed into the show_dialog() function. This must be supported with GPE work, so only use this if you have talked to a GPE.

TunableTuple.name: string
TunableTuple.description: A string.

Tunable.name: command
Tunable.description: The command.

Tunable.name: reference
Tunable.description: A reference to a UIResponseCommand tuning snippet.

Tunable.name: text
Tunable.description: The prompt's text.

TunableEnum.name: ui_request
TunableEnum.description: This prompt's associated UI action.

TunableList.name: weight_modifiers
TunableList.description: A list of modifiers that affect the probability that this action result will be chosen. These are exposed in the form (test, multiplier). If the test passes, then the multiplier is applied to the running total. The default multiplier is 1. To increase the likelihood of this action result being chosen, tune multiplier greater than 1. To decrease the likelihood of this action result being chose, tune multipliers lower than 1. If you want to exclude this action result from consideration, tune a multiplier of 0.

TunableTuple.description: A pair of test and weight multiplier. If the test passes, the associated weight multiplier is applied. If no test is specified, the multiplier is always applied.

TunableVariant.name: test
TunableVariant.description: The test that has to pass for this weight multiplier to be applied. The information available to this test is the same information available to the interaction owning this adventure.

TunableTuple.name: active_routing_objects
TunableTuple.description: Tests the number of active routing objects of a given category against a tuned threshold.

TunableEnum.name: tracking_category
TunableEnum.description: Category to test against. Test returns TRUE if the number of active routing objects of this type is below the tuned maximum.

TunableTuple.name: age_up_test
TunableTuple.description: A tunable test that a Sim has the ability to perform an age up interaction

TunableEnum.name: who
TunableEnum.description: Who or what to apply this test to.

TunableTuple.name: appropriateness
TunableTuple.description: A test to determine if a specific affordance is appropriate for a Sim.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The subject of this situation data test.

TunableTuple.name: at_work
TunableTuple.description: Tests if the subject is currently at work.

TunableVariant.name: active_work_restriction
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, if this is set the test will only pass if the Sim is at an active event. If not set, the test will instead only pass if the Sim is not at an active event.

Tunable.name: is_at_work
Tunable.description: Check to return True if any of the subjects are at work.

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: Who or what to apply this test to.

TunableTuple.name: autonomy_scoring_preference
TunableTuple.description: A tunable factory that checks whether or not the target object of an affordance is the Sim's preferred scoring object.

TunableVariant.name: any_sim
TunableVariant.description:
If enabled, will return whether the object has any "Use Only" preference set for the specified tag. Will not be sim specific, and thus only works for "use only" preference type. Does NOT rely on interaction to determine preference type.
Value is the tag to test for.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: Tag to determine which preference type to use.

Tunable.name: require
Tunable.description: The Sim's preference is required to be True or required to be False.

TunableTuple.name: bills
TunableTuple.description: Require the participant's bill status to match the specified conditions.
Tuple containing an AdditionalBillSource and its required delinquency state. EX: This interaction requires that the Maid_Service bill source not be delinquent.

Tunable.name: is_delinquent
Tunable.description: Whether this AdditionalBillSource is required to be delinquent or not delinquent.

TunableTuple.description: Tuple containing a utility and its required delinquency state.

Tunable.name: is_delinquent
Tunable.description: Whether this utility is required to be delinquent or not delinquent.

TunableVariant.name: is_repo_man_due
TunableVariant.description: If enabled we will only pass this test if the bill is delinquent enough to require the repo man to show up.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Check if the repo man is due to collect bad bills or not.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The subject whose household is the object of this delinquency test.

TunableVariant.name: payment_due
TunableVariant.description: Whether or not the participant is required to have a bill payment due.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Whether or not the participant is required to have a bill payment due.

Tunable.name: is_due
Tunable.description: Whether this bill's payment is required to be due or not due.

TunableVariant.name: utility_consumption_threshold
TunableVariant.description: Tests to see if the bill's net consumption of utilities passes the threshold. Only tested if the bill's payment is currently due (and is required to be due).

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Minimum amount needed to pass this test (if bill is due).

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The value of a threshold.

Tunable.name: test_participant_owned_households
Tunable.description: If checked, this test will check the delinquency states of all the participant's households. If unchecked, this test will check the delinquency states of the owning household of the active lot.

TunableTuple.name: birthday_test
TunableTuple.description: Test to see if it is the sim's birthday. A sim's birthday is the tuned time period in which they are eligible for aging up.

Tunable.name: days_until_birthday
Tunable.description: Check if days-until-sim's-birthday is inside this range. Set this to 0 if we want to check if today is sim's birthday.

Tunable.name: invert
Tunable.description: If true, invert the result of this test.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant against which to run this birthday test.

TunableTuple.name: bucks_perks_test
TunableTuple.description: A test to check whether or not a household or sim has a specific Bucks Perk unlocked.

Tunable.name: bucks_perk
Tunable.description: The specific Perk to check against.

Tunable.name: invert
Tunable.description: If checked, the results of the test will be inverted. The truth table is as follows for sim with the perk: test_if_unlocked is true and invert is false: True test_if_unlocked is true and invert is true: False test_if_unlocked is false and invert is false: False test_if_unlocked is false and invert is true: True

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant whose household will be checked for the specified Perk If being used outside of an interaction, any Sim participant types are not valid. Consider using object in these circumstances.

TunableVariant.name: requires_same_club
TunableVariant.description:
When enabled it requires that the tuned target be in the associated club with the participant.
For example, this can be used to require that the participant and target be in the club associated with the secret handshake interaction and that the correct perk for that handshake is unlocked.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: The participant that must also have the perk unlocked in a bucks tracker that they share in common with the tuned participant.

Tunable.name: test_if_unlocked
Tunable.description: If checked, this test will check to see if the specified Perk is unlocked. If unchecked, this test will check to see if the specified Perk is locked.

TunableTuple.name: bucks_test
TunableTuple.description: Test if the participant(s) has acquired a certain amount of bucks.

TunableEnum.name: bucks_type
TunableEnum.description: Bucks type that will be tested against the value threshold.

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: Who or what to test against.

TunableTuple.name: value_threshold
TunableTuple.description: Bucks amount required to pass

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The value of a threshold.

TunableTuple.name: buff
TunableTuple.description: Test whether or not a participant has or doesn't have specific buffs.

Tunable.name: apply_whitelist_on_individual_basis
Tunable.description: If checked, will require that each target has at least one whitelisted buff. If unchecked, will require only a single target to have at least one whitelisted trait.

TunableList.name: blacklist
TunableList.description: The Sim must not have any buff in this list to pass the test.

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: Who or what to apply this test to.

TunableVariant.name: whitelist
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, participant will test for buff's on the whitelist.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: The participant must have at least one buff in this list to pass the test.

TunableTuple.name: business_allows_new_customers
TunableTuple.description: A test to see if the current business is allowing new customers or not.

Tunable.name: customers_allowed
Tunable.description:
If checked this will test if new customers are currently allowed to show up on a business lot.
If unchecked this will test if new customers are not allowed to show up currently.

TunableTuple.name: business_settings
TunableTuple.description:
A test to see if the current business meets certain criteria.
If no tests are set, this simply checks if there is a business in the current zone.

TunableVariant.name: quality_setting
TunableVariant.description: A test to see if the current business has certain settings set by the owner.

TunableTuple.name: test
TunableTuple.description: Use of this white/black list will check whether or not the current on-lot business is set to certain quality settings.

TunableVariant.name: blacklist
TunableVariant.description: When an item is tested against this white/black list, it is only allowed if it is not in the blacklist. If no blacklist is specified, no items are disallowed.

TunableTuple.name: specify
TunableTuple.description: A tunable blacklist.

TunableList.name: blacklist
TunableList.description: Blacklisted items.

TunableEnum.description: Business Quality Type from business settings.

TunableVariant.name: threshold
TunableVariant.description: Tunable option for how many items must be in the blacklist for the blacklist to fail when testing a collection of items. By default, only one object needs to be in the list.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: When testing a collection of items, the number of items in that collection that are in the blacklist must pass this threshold test for the blacklist to disallow them all.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

TunableVariant.name: whitelist
TunableVariant.description: When an item is tested against this white/black list, it is only allowed if it is in the whitelist. If no whitelist is specified, all items are allowed.

TunableTuple.name: specify
TunableTuple.description: A tunable whitelist.

TunableVariant.name: threshold
TunableVariant.description: Tunable option for how many items must be in the whitelist for the whitelist to pass when testing a collection of items. By default, only one object needs to be in the list.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: When testing a collection of items, the number of items in that collection that are in the whitelist must pass this threshold test for the whitelist to allow them all.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

TunableList.name: whitelist
TunableList.description: Whitelisted items.

TunableEnum.description: Business Quality Type from business settings.

TunableVariant.name: star_rating
TunableVariant.description: A test to see if the current business is within a star rating range.

TunableTuple.name: test
TunableTuple.description: If the business's star rating is within this range, this test passes.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

TunableTuple.name: can_create_user_facing_situation
TunableTuple.description: A tunable factory that tests if a new user facing situation can be started. By default, if another user facing situation is running this test will return false.

Tunable.name: allow_non_prestige_is_exempt
Tunable.description: If checked, this test will return True if all the situations that are running allow non-prestige events to be started.

Tunable.name: negate
Tunable.description: If checked then this test will pass if the milestone is not complete otherwise it will pass if it's been earned.

TunableTuple.name: can_see_object
TunableTuple.description: A tunable factory that checks whether or not the target object can be seen by the sim.

TunableTuple.name: career_assignment_test
TunableTuple.description: Tests if the subject currently has a career assignment active.

Tunable.name: negate
Tunable.description: If checked, test will pass if the Sim is not on an assignment.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: Who or what to apply this test to.

TunableVariant.name: test_type
TunableVariant.description:
Type of assignment test we want to run.
in_assignment will return True if the Sim is on any type of asignment for its current career.
in_specific_assignment will return True only if the current active assignment matches the assignment specified.

Tunable.name: assignment
Tunable.description: Aspiration that needs to be completed for satisfying the daily assignment.

TunableTuple.name: career_gig_test
TunableTuple.description: Tests if the subject has a scheduled career gig.

Tunable.name: career
Tunable.description: The career to test for gigs

Tunable.name: negate
Tunable.description: If checked, test will pass if the Sim does not have the gigs.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: Who or what to apply this test to.

TunableVariant.name: test_type
TunableVariant.description: The test to perform. Can check either a specific list of gigs or if any gig is currently scheduled.

TunableTuple.name: any_gig
TunableTuple.description: Return True if any gig is scheduled for the career.

TunableTuple.name: specific_gigs
TunableTuple.description: Return True if any of the tuned gigs is scheduled for the career.

TunableVariant.name: active_objective
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this objective is also required to be active on any of the tuned Gigs.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The objective that needs to be active on the gig.

TunableList.name: gigs
TunableList.description: A list of gigs. If any tuned gig is the sim's current gig, this test will return True.

Tunable.description: Aspiration that needs to be completed for satisfying the daily assignment.

TunableTuple.name: career_test
TunableTuple.description:
Tunable test for what careers a Sim has.
subjects: A ParticipantType used for choosing whom to run the test on. test_type: A variant of the different tunable tests that handle testing for careers.

Tunable.name: negate
Tunable.description: If this is true then it will negate the result of the test type. For instance if this is true and the test would return true for whether or not a sim has a particular career False will be returned instead.

TunableEnum.name: subjects
TunableEnum.description: The participant to run the career test on.

TunableTuple.name: attended_first_day
TunableTuple.description: Test for whether or not the Sim has gone to work at all for the career.

Tunable.name: career
Tunable.description: The career to see if the Sim has gone to work for.

TunableVariant.name: tooltip
TunableVariant.description: Reason of failure.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Reason of failure.

TunableTuple.name: can_join_career
TunableTuple.description: A test for whether a sim can join a tunable number threshold of the tuned careers. This requires that the career be valid for the sim and that the sim not already be in the career.

TunableTuple.name: careers_to_consider
TunableTuple.description: The set of careers to consider and the threshold for passing.

TunableVariant.name: blacklist
TunableVariant.description: When an item is tested against this white/black list, it is only allowed if it is not in the blacklist. If no blacklist is specified, no items are disallowed.

TunableTuple.name: specify
TunableTuple.description: A tunable blacklist.

TunableList.name: blacklist
TunableList.description: Blacklisted items.

TunableVariant.name: threshold
TunableVariant.description: Tunable option for how many items must be in the blacklist for the blacklist to fail when testing a collection of items. By default, only one object needs to be in the list.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: When testing a collection of items, the number of items in that collection that are in the blacklist must pass this threshold test for the blacklist to disallow them all.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

TunableVariant.name: whitelist
TunableVariant.description: When an item is tested against this white/black list, it is only allowed if it is in the whitelist. If no whitelist is specified, all items are allowed.

TunableTuple.name: specify
TunableTuple.description: A tunable whitelist.

TunableVariant.name: threshold
TunableVariant.description: Tunable option for how many items must be in the whitelist for the whitelist to pass when testing a collection of items. By default, only one object needs to be in the list.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: When testing a collection of items, the number of items in that collection that are in the whitelist must pass this threshold test for the whitelist to allow them all.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

TunableList.name: whitelist
TunableList.description: Whitelisted items.

TunableTuple.name: career_level
TunableTuple.description: Test to see if the participants have a career at the specified level.

Tunable.name: career_level
Tunable.description: A reference to career level tuning that each subject must have in at least one career in order for this test to pass.

TunableTuple.name: career_reference
TunableTuple.description: A test for whether or not the specified subjects have the specified career, career user level, or both.

Tunable.name: allow_invisible_careers
Tunable.description: If checked, this test will also allow non-visible careers (such as Odd Jobs) to tested against.

TunableList.name: blacklist
TunableList.description: Should be called "Ignore List". Set of careers that will be ignored on the Sim. If the Sim only had these careers, it would be like having no careers.

TunableVariant.name: career
TunableVariant.description: The career to test for on the Sim. When set by itself it will pass if the subject simply has this career. When set with user level it will only pass if the subjects user level passes the threshold test.

TunableVariant.name: user_level
TunableVariant.description:
Threshold test for the current user value of a career. If user_level is set without career then it will pass if any of their careers pass the threshold test. If set along with career then it will only pass if the specified career passes the threshold test for user level.
The min and max for the user level are inclusive. So the Sim can have any career level that meets the following equation and it will pass.
min <= current career level <= max.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description:
Threshold test for the current user value of a career. If user_level is set without career then it will pass if any of their careers pass the threshold test. If set along with career then it will only pass if the specified career passes the threshold test for user level.
The min and max for the user level are inclusive. So the Sim can have any career level that meets the following equation and it will pass.
min <= current career level <= max.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

TunableTuple.description: Test for whether the specified subjects have a career currently on the track specified.

Tunable.name: career_track
Tunable.description: A reference to the career track that each subject must have in at least one career in order for this test to pass.

TunableVariant.name: user_level
TunableVariant.description: Interval test for the current user value of a career. Career track must also be specified for this check to work properly.

TunableTuple.description: Test used to see if multiple participants have a career in common.

TunableTuple.name: career_level
TunableTuple.description: Test to see if the participants have a career at the specified level.

Tunable.name: career_level
Tunable.description: A reference to career level tuning that each subject must have in at least one career in order for this test to pass.

TunableTuple.name: career_reference
TunableTuple.description: A test for whether or not the specified subjects have the specified career, career user level, or both.

Tunable.name: allow_invisible_careers
Tunable.description: If checked, this test will also allow non-visible careers (such as Odd Jobs) to tested against.

TunableList.name: blacklist
TunableList.description: Should be called "Ignore List". Set of careers that will be ignored on the Sim. If the Sim only had these careers, it would be like having no careers.

TunableVariant.name: career
TunableVariant.description: The career to test for on the Sim. When set by itself it will pass if the subject simply has this career. When set with user level it will only pass if the subjects user level passes the threshold test.

TunableVariant.name: user_level
TunableVariant.description:
Threshold test for the current user value of a career. If user_level is set without career then it will pass if any of their careers pass the threshold test. If set along with career then it will only pass if the specified career passes the threshold test for user level.
The min and max for the user level are inclusive. So the Sim can have any career level that meets the following equation and it will pass.
min <= current career level <= max.

Threshold test for the current user value of a career. If user_level is set without career then it will pass if any of their careers pass the threshold test. If set along with career then it will only pass if the specified career passes the threshold test for user level.
The min and max for the user level are inclusive. So the Sim can have any career level that meets the following equation and it will pass.
min <= current career level <= max.

The career to test the next start time of.

Tunable.name: check_all_careers
Tunable.description: If checked then we will check all careers rather than just the one defined in the career tunable. The test will fail if any career fails.

TunableTuple.name: hours_till_work
TunableTuple.description: Threshold test for how long 'till the "next" start time. It will test up to one hour past the start time, at which point it will test against the next start time.

TunableVariant.description: If enabled, require the associated Club to either have a Gathering going on or not.

TunableEnum.name: subject

TunableVariant.name: subject_club_gathering_status
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, require the tuned "subject" to either be or not be in a Club Gathering for the associated Club.

TunableVariant.name: enabled
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, require the tuned "subject" to either be or not be in a Club Gathering for the associated Club.

TunableVariant.name: target_club_gathering_status
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, require the tuned "target" to either be or not be in a Club Gathering for the associated Club.

TunableTuple.name: club_test
TunableTuple.description:
A tunable factory that tests against Clubs.
For use only with ClubSuperInteractions and ClubMixerInteractions.

TunableVariant.name: affordance_rule
TunableVariant.description: If set, then the affordance being tested (should one exist) must satisfy this rule requirement.

TunableVariant.name: enabled
TunableVariant.description: The rule requirement that the affordance must satisfy.

TunableVariant.name: club
TunableVariant.description: Define the Club to run this test against.

TunableVariant.name: club_status
TunableVariant.description: In enabled, require the tuned "subject" to either be or not be a member of this interaction's associated Club.

TunableVariant.name: enabled
TunableVariant.description: In enabled, require the tuned "subject" to either be or not be a member of this interaction's associated Club.

TunableVariant.name: invite_only
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, require the associated Club to either be invite only or be open to everyone.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: If enabled, require the associated Club to either be invite only or be open to everyone.

Tunable.name: pass_if_any_clubs_pass
Tunable.description: If checked then this test will pass if any of the clubs match the requirements otherwise we require all clubs to meet the requirements.

TunableVariant.name: recent_member_status
TunableVariant.description: If specified, the Sim must satisfy recent member status requirements.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Whether or not the Sim must be a recent member of the Club in order to pass this test.

TunableVariant.name: require_common_club
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, then there must be a common Club that both the subject Sim and this specified Sim are in. If the club type is set to "Use Club from Resolver", then both Sims must be in that Club. If the club type is set to "Use Any Club", then there must be one club both the subject Sim and this Sim are in.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: The Sim to test against for a common Club. If a multi-Sim participant is specified, the union of their clubs is considered, i.e. the test passes if at least one Sim satisfies the requirements.

TunableVariant.name: required_sim_count
TunableVariant.description: If enabled then this test will only pass if the group has a number of members that passes the tuned threshold.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: The member requirement for this test to pass.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The value of a threshold.

TunableVariant.name: room_for_new_members
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, require the associated Club to either have room for new members or not have room for new members.

TunableVariant.name: enabled
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, require the associated Club to either have room for new members or not have room for new members.

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: The subject whose Club status to check.

TunableVariant.name: subject_can_join_more_clubs
TunableVariant.description:
If enabled, require the tuned "subject" to be allowed to join more Clubs or not.
The maximum number of Clubs per Sim is set in club_tuning.ClubTunables in the "MAX_CLUBS_PER_SIM" tunable.

TunableVariant.name: enabled
TunableVariant.description:
If enabled, require the tuned "subject" to be allowed to join more Clubs or not.
The maximum number of Clubs per Sim is set in club_tuning.ClubTunables in the "MAX_CLUBS_PER_SIM" tunable.

TunableVariant.name: subject_passes_membership_criteria
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, require the tuned "subject" to either pass this associated Club's membership criteria or not pass the membership criteria.

TunableVariant.name: enabled
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, require the tuned "subject" to either pass this associated Club's membership criteria or not pass the membership criteria.

TunableVariant.name: subject_relationship_with_leader
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the tuned subject is required to have a specific relationship with the leader. If the subject and the leader match, the test fails.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Gate availability by a relationship status.

Tunable.name: invert_num_relations
Tunable.description: If checked then we will check that your Num Relations is less than or equal to the value rather than the other way around.

TunableList.name: match_all
TunableList.description: All of these relationship bits must match to fail the test.

TunableList.name: match_any
TunableList.description: If any of these relationship bits match the test will fail.

TunableTuple.name: relationship_score_interval
TunableTuple.description: The range that the relationship score must be within in order for this test to pass.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

TunableList.name: match_all
TunableList.description: All of these relationship bits must be present to pass the test.

TunableList.name: match_any
TunableList.description: Any of these relationship bits will pass the test.

TunableEnum.name: test_event
TunableEnum.description: The event that we want to trigger this instance of the tuned test on.

TunableVariant.name: test_incest
TunableVariant.description: Test for incest status. Test passes if this matches the two Sim's incest status.

Tunable.name: track
Tunable.description: If set, the test will use the relationship score between sims for this track. If unset, the track defaults to the global module tunable REL_INSPECTOR_TRACK.

TunableTuple.name: collection_test
TunableTuple.description: Tests for a provided amount of a given collection type.

TunableEnum.name: collection_type
TunableEnum.description: The collection we are checking on. If collection type is unidentified then we will look through all collections.

Tunable.name: complete_collection
Tunable.description: Setting this to True (checked) will override the threshold and check for collection completed

TunableVariant.name: specific_items
TunableVariant.description: If enabled then the collection threshold test will check for specific items within the collection. When enabled both the Collection Type and Complete Collection tuning will be ignored.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: List of allowed objects within a collection that we want to check.

Tunable.description: Object reference to each collectible object.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: Threshold for which the Sim experiences motive failure

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The value of the threshold that the collection is compared against.

TunableEnum.name: who
TunableEnum.description: Who or what to apply this test to

TunableTuple.name: commodity_advertised
TunableTuple.description:
Require the current lot to have some interaction advertising the specified commodities.
example: You might not want the interaction to clean dishes to show up if there are no sinks around. The "wash dishes" interaction on sinks advertises a "Wash_Dishes" static commodity, so we can get this behavior by having the "Clean Up" interaction on dishes test out if that static commodity is not being advertised.

Tunable.name: allow_targeted_objects
Tunable.description: If enabled, objects targeted (ParticipantType.Object) by the interaction are allowed to pass this test. Typically, for cleaning up dishes, we disallow targeted objects because we don't want you to run the affordance on dishes you are carrying.

Tunable.name: check_affordance_suppression
Tunable.description: If checked, suppressed affordances will not be considered.

TunableList.name: commodities
TunableList.description: A list of commodities that must be advertised by some interaction on the current lot.

Tunable.description: The type of commodity to search for.

TunableVariant.name: require_reservable_by_participant
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the object that advertises the commodity must by reservable by the specified participant type.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: The participant that must be able to reserve the object.

TunableVariant.name: requirements
TunableVariant.description:
A variant specifying the terms of this test with regards to the tuned commodities.
* Require Any: The test will pass if any of the tuned commodities are found on an object. * Require All: The test will only pass if all of the tuned commodities are found on a single object. * Require None: The test will only pass if none of the tuned commodities are found on any object on the lot.

TunableList.name: static_commodities
TunableList.description: A list of static commodities that must be advertised by some interaction on the current lot.

Tunable.description: The type of static commodity to search for.

Tunable.name: test_aops
Tunable.description:
If checked, the obj that is advertising the tuned commodities must also have the aops that grant that commodity be able to run.
EX: check if any dishes on the lot can be eaten. Even if the dishes advertise the eat static commodity, the individual dish themselves might not be able to be eaten because they are spoiled, empty, etc.

Tunable.name: test_autonomous_availability
Tunable.description: If enabled, this test will consider advertising objects that the Sim can use autonomously. This should be specifically disabled if we want to bypass on lot and off lot autonomy rules for the purpose of this test.

Tunable.name: test_connectivity_to_target
Tunable.description: If checked, this test will ensure the target Sim can pass a pt to pt connectivity check to the advertising object.

Tunable.name: test_reservations
Tunable.description: If enabled, this test will consider advertising objects that the Sim can currently reserve. This should be specifically disabled if we don't care about object reservations.

TunableVariant.name: tested_objects
TunableVariant.description:
The test will only check these objects for tuned advertised commodities.
EX: to improve performance, when we know that tuned commodities will only be found on laundry objects, set this to Laundry Objects instead of All Objects.

TunableTuple.name: all_objects
TunableTuple.description: The objects are all objects on the lot.

TunableTuple.name: laundry_objects
TunableTuple.description: The objects are laundry objects on the lot.

TunableTuple.name: tagged_objects
TunableTuple.description: The objects are all tagged objects on the lot.

TunableEnum.description: Find all of the objects that have at least one of the tuned tags.

TunableTuple.name: commodity_desired_by_other_sims
TunableTuple.description: Tests to see if another Sim on the lot desires the particular commodity. For example, you can use this to test to see if any Sim is hungry.

Tunable.name: commodity
Tunable.description: The type of commodity to test.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: The threashold to test for.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The value of a threshold.

Tunable.name: count
Tunable.description: The number of sims that must desire the commodity for this test to pass.

Tunable.name: invert
Tunable.description: If checked, the test will be inverted. In other words, the test will fail if any sim desires the tuned commodity.

Tunable.name: only_household_sims
Tunable.description: If checked, only sims in the same household as the testing sim are considered.

Tunable.name: only_other_sims
Tunable.description: If checked, the sim running this test is not counted.

TunableTuple.name: conditional_layer_loaded
TunableTuple.description: Test a conditional layers loaded status.

Tunable.name: conditional_layer
Tunable.description: Which conditional layer to test.

Tunable.name: consider_queued_requests
Tunable.description: If checked then this test will consider the queued requests for this conditional layer.

Tunable.name: negate
Tunable.description: If checked then this test will return True when not loaded.

TunableTuple.name: consumable_test

Tunable.description: If checked, the subject must be a consumable, if unchecked, the subject must not be a consumable.

TunableEnum.name: subject
