TunableTuple.description: Require participants to craft items that meet certain requirements, such as used skill, tags, etc...

TunableVariant.name: masterwork_threshold
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, require the item to match a certain masterwork threshold.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Value/comparison pair used to define a Threshold.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The masterwork threshold to satisfy.

TunableVariant.name: quality_threshold
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, require the item to match a certain quality threshold.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Value/comparison pair used to define a Threshold.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The quality threshold to satisfy.

TunableVariant.name: skill_or_item
TunableVariant.description: Whether to test for a specific item or use of a skill for the item.

TunableTuple.name: crafted_actual_item
TunableTuple.description: This option tests crafted item against a list of possible items

Tunable.description: Object that qualifies for this check.

TunableTuple.name: crafted_tagged_item
TunableTuple.description: This option tests crafted item's tags against a list of possible tags

TunableList.name: tag_set
TunableList.description: The tag of objects we want to test ownership of

TunableEnum.description: What tag to test for

TunableEnum.name: test_type
TunableEnum.description: How to test the tags in the tag set against the objects on the lot.

TunableTuple.name: crafted_with_skill
TunableTuple.description: This option tests for an item craft with the selected skill

Tunable.name: skill_to_test
Tunable.description: Skills needed to pass amount on.

TunableTuple.name: crafted_with_ingredients
TunableTuple.description: A test to check whether a crafted item was made with ingredients

TunableTuple.name: ingredients_used_threshold
TunableTuple.description: Number of ingredients required for the item to have been crafted with

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant for which to check ingredient count on.

TunableTuple.name: crafting_recipe
TunableTuple.description: A test to check what recipe is set in the crafting process.

TunableVariant.name: recipe_test
TunableVariant.description: How to test for the recipe.

TunableTuple.name: by_recipe
TunableTuple.description: Test a recipe by definition.

TunableList.name: valid_recipes
TunableList.description: The set of recipes allowed.

TunableTuple.name: by_tag
TunableTuple.description: Test a recipe by whether it has a specific tag.

TunableEnum.name: required_tag
TunableEnum.description: The tag that must exist on the recipe

TunableVariant.name: subject
TunableVariant.description: Participant to look up the crafting process. Tuning this is not necessary if this loot is run within a crafting interaction.

TunableTuple.name: curfew
TunableTuple.description: A Test for whether or not the current lot is under curfew.

Tunable.name: curfew_active
Tunable.description: If True the test will return True if the current lot is under curfew restrictions. If not checked it will only return True when outside of curfew enforced hours.

TunableTuple.name: custom_name
TunableTuple.description: Require or prohibit an object from having a custom name or description set.

TunableVariant.name: has_custom_description
TunableVariant.description: If checked, the subject must have a custom description set. If unchecked, it cannot have a custom description set.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: If checked, the subject must have a custom description set. If unchecked, it cannot have a custom description set.

TunableVariant.name: has_custom_name
TunableVariant.description: If checked, the subject must have a custom name set. If unchecked, it cannot have a custom name set.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: If checked, the subject must have a custom name set. If unchecked, it cannot have a custom name set.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The subject who is the object of this test.

TunableTuple.name: day_and_time
TunableTuple.description: Test to see if the current time falls within the tuned range and/or is on a valid day.

TunableVariant.name: days_available
TunableVariant.description: Which days of the week to include

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Which days of the week to include

TunableVariant.name: is_day
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, allows you to only pass the test if it's either day or night, as per the Region's tuned sunrise and sunset times.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description:
If checked, this test will only pass if all other criteria are met and it's currently day time (between the sunrise and sunset times tuned for the current region).
If unchecked, this test will only pass if all other criteria are met and it's currently night time (between the sunset and sunrise times tune for the current region).

TunableVariant.name: time_range
TunableVariant.description: The time the test is valid. If days_available is tuned and the time range spans across two days with the second day tuned as unavailable, the test will pass for that day until time range is invalid. Example: Time range 20:00 - 4:00, Monday is valid, Tuesday is invalid. Tuesday at 2:00 the test passes. Tuesday at 4:01 the test fails.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: The time the test is valid. If days_available is tuned and the time range spans across two days with the second day tuned as unavailable, the test will pass for that day until time range is invalid. Example: Time range 20:00 - 4:00, Monday is valid, Tuesday is invalid. Tuesday at 2:00 the test passes. Tuesday at 4:01 the test fails.

TunableTuple.name: begin_time
TunableTuple.description: An Hour(24Hr) and Minute representing a time relative to the beginning of a day.

Tunable.name: hour
Tunable.description: Hour of the day

Tunable.name: minute
Tunable.description: Minute of Hour

TunableTuple.name: duration
TunableTuple.description: An Hour(24Hr) and Minute representing a time relative to the beginning of a day.

Tunable.name: hour
Tunable.description: Hour of the day

Tunable.name: minute
Tunable.description: Minute of Hour

TunableTuple.name: detective_clues
TunableTuple.description: A test that verifies that a Sim in a detective career has collected a certain number of clues.

Tunable.name: career_reference
Tunable.description: The career for which we need to check clue information.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant for which we are running the test.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: The number of clues required in order to pass this test.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The value of a threshold.

TunableTuple.name: diagnostic_action_test
TunableTuple.description: The test to see whether the relevant interaction meets a certain criteria with regards to an active diagnosis on a Sim.

Tunable.name: invert
Tunable.description: Whether or not to invert the results of this test.

TunableEnum.name: target
TunableEnum.description: When this test runs, it checks against this participant for sickness information. If the affordance is targeting a patient, it will typically be TargetSim.

TunableVariant.name: test
TunableVariant.description: Type of test we are performing against the affordance that runs or will run this test.

TunableTuple.name: distance
TunableTuple.description: A tunable factory that tests whether the distance between the actor and the target is within a certain threshold.

TunableVariant.name: level_modifier
TunableVariant.description: Determine how difference in levels affects distance. A modifier of 10, for example, would mean that the distance between two objects is increased by 10 meters for every floor between them.

Tunable.name: specific
Tunable.description: A meter modifier to add to the distance multiplied by the number of floors between subject and target.

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: The subject of the test.

TunableEnum.name: target
TunableEnum.description: The target of the test.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: The distance threshold for this test. The distance between the subject and the target must satisfy this condition in order of the test to pass.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The value of a threshold.

TunableTuple.name: drama_node
TunableTuple.description: A test to check the existence of specific drama nodes.

Tunable.name: check_active_nodes
Tunable.description: Check against nodes that are actively running.

Tunable.name: check_scheduled_nodes
Tunable.description: Check against nodes that are scheduled, but not actively running.

TunableList.name: drama_nodes
TunableList.description: The types of drama nodes that we want to check.

Tunable.description: A Drama node type we want to check.

Tunable.name: exists
Tunable.description: If checked then this drama node will pass if a node meeting the requirements exists. Otherwise it will pass if there is not a node meeting the requirements.

TunableVariant.name: receiver_sim
TunableVariant.description: If enabled we will check that the receiver Sim is the tuned Sim.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: The Sim that we will make sure is the receiver Sim.

TunableVariant.name: time_to_run
TunableVariant.description: If enabled then we will check against the remaining time until the the drama node is scheduled to run.

TunableVariant.name: additional_threshold
TunableVariant.description: If enabled then we will have a second threshold to compare against.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: A threshold to compare the amount of time left for this drma node to be run.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

TunableTuple.name: value
TunableTuple.description: The amount of time to compare against.

Tunable.name: days
Tunable.description: Number of days

Tunable.name: hours
Tunable.description: Number of hours

Tunable.name: minutes
Tunable.description: Number of minutes

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: A threshold to compare the amount of time left for this drma node to be run.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

TunableTuple.name: value
TunableTuple.description: The amount of time to compare against.

Tunable.name: days
Tunable.description: Number of days

Tunable.name: hours
Tunable.description: Number of hours

Tunable.name: minutes
Tunable.description: Number of minutes

TunableTuple.name: dress_code_test
TunableTuple.description: The test to see if sim meet up with the certain dress code.

TunableVariant.name: outfit_to_test
TunableVariant.description: What outfit category to test against.

Tunable.name: pass_when_match
Tunable.description: If checked, the test will pass the sim dresses same with the outfit to test against. False then test pass only when sim is dressing differently.

TunableEnum.name: sim_subject
TunableEnum.description: The participant sim to run the tests against.

TunableTuple.name: during_work_hours
TunableTuple.description: Returns True if run during a time that the subject Sim should be at work.

TunableVariant.name: career
TunableVariant.description: If tuned, this test will run against a specific career instead of against any career.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The specific career to test against.

Tunable.name: fail_if_taking_day_off_during_work
Tunable.display: Fail If Taking Day Off During Work
Tunable.description: If checked, this test will fail if the Sim is taking PTO/vacation/sick day during work hours and is_during_work is checked. If not checked, this test won't care about whether or not the Sim is taking the day off.

Tunable.name: is_during_work
Tunable.description: Check to return True if during work hours.

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: Who or what to apply this test to.

TunableTuple.name: eco_footprint
TunableTuple.description: Tests on the eco footprint of the selected street civic policy provider.

TunableVariant.description: A test to run on the street's policy provider.

TunableEnum.name: required_direction
TunableEnum.description: If the tested street is moving toward this EcoFootprintDirection, the test will pass.

Tunable.name: invert
Tunable.description: If True then the result of this test will be inverted. Otherwise the results remain the same.

TunableEnum.name: required_eco_footprint_state
TunableEnum.description: If the tested street has this EcoFootprintStateType, the test will pass.

TunableVariant.name: street
TunableVariant.description: Select what street to test.

Tunable.name: literal
Tunable.description: Identify a specific Street.

TunableTuple.name: via_street_participant
TunableTuple.description: Get the street participant.

TunableVariant.name: via_zone_source
TunableVariant.description: Select the street to use by specifying a Zone Source.

TunableTuple.name: use_current_zone
TunableTuple.description: Get the active zone.

TunableTuple.name: use_participant_home_zone
TunableTuple.description: Get a participant's home zone. Can be None if they don't have one.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: Test against the participant's home zone. Townies' home zone will be None.

TunableTuple.name: use_pick_info
TunableTuple.description: Get the zone of the lot the user clicked on.

TunableTuple.name: use_picked_zone_ids
TunableTuple.description: Get the zone from the interaction's picked_zone_ids participant. Usually comes from a picker.

TunableTuple.name: ensemble
TunableTuple.description: Test aspects of a sim's ensemble.

TunableVariant.name: check_matching_ensemble
TunableVariant.description: If enabled then we will only check ensembles that the participant and this tuned participant are in together.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: The participant of whos ensemble we want to look at.

Tunable.name: check_selectable_sims
Tunable.description: If checked then we will apply the threshold against the number of selectable sims that are in that ensemble.

TunableVariant.name: ensemble_option
TunableVariant.description: Which ensembles to check against when testing. If any of these ensembles pass the check then the test will pass.

TunableTuple.name: check_all
TunableTuple.description: Check against all ensembles that this sim is in.

TunableTuple.name: check_subset
TunableTuple.description: Check only the ensembles tuned that the sim is in.

TunableList.name: ensemble_types
TunableList.description: The ensembles to check against.

Tunable.description: The ensemble to check against.

TunableTuple.name: check_visible
TunableTuple.description: Check only against the visible ensmebles that the sim is in.

Tunable.name: invert
Tunable.description: If checked then we will check to see if the participant isn't in an ensemble of the chosen participant and option and threshold.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant of whos ensemble we want to look at.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: The number of sims in that ensemble to check against.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The value of a threshold.

TunableTuple.name: existence
TunableTuple.description: A test to check whether the specified participant exists.

Tunable.name: allow_hidden_sim_status
Tunable.description: If checked then we will ignore hidden Sim status such that they will count as existing even though they have been hidden. Use this in conjunction with Require Instantiated in order to determine the Sim's actual instantiated status.

Tunable.name: exists
Tunable.description: When checked, require the specified participant to exist. When unchecked, require the specified participant to not exist.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant for which to check existence.

Tunable.name: require_instantiatable
Tunable.description: If checked, the specified participant must be instantiatable. This is generally true for all Sims at LOD above MINIMUM.

Tunable.name: require_instantiated
Tunable.description: If checked, the participant will also be checked for instantiation. This is helpful when the participant might be a SimInfo (e.g. StoredSim) and we just want to check if it exists and don't care if the Sim is actually instantiated.

TunableTuple.name: fame_moment_test
TunableTuple.description: A test to see if a the current interaction has a fame moment that is active. For instance this is being used to keep chance cards from appearing on the same day as the fame moments.

Tunable.name: negate
Tunable.description: If checked then this test will return True when the current interaction does not have a scheduled fame moment.

TunableTuple.name: familiar
TunableTuple.description: A test for testing the active familiar.

TunableVariant.name: familiar_type_filter
TunableVariant.description: If enabled then we will filter based on the familiar type.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: A filter on the type of familiar that is active.

TunableVariant.name: blacklist
TunableVariant.description: When an item is tested against this white/black list, it is only allowed if it is not in the blacklist. If no blacklist is specified, no items are disallowed.

TunableTuple.name: specify
TunableTuple.description: A tunable blacklist.

TunableList.name: blacklist
TunableList.description: Blacklisted items.

TunableEnum.description: The type of familiar to check for.

TunableVariant.name: threshold
TunableVariant.description: Tunable option for how many items must be in the blacklist for the blacklist to fail when testing a collection of items. By default, only one object needs to be in the list.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: When testing a collection of items, the number of items in that collection that are in the blacklist must pass this threshold test for the blacklist to disallow them all.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

TunableVariant.name: whitelist
TunableVariant.description: When an item is tested against this white/black list, it is only allowed if it is in the whitelist. If no whitelist is specified, all items are allowed.

TunableTuple.name: specify
TunableTuple.description: A tunable whitelist.

TunableVariant.name: threshold
TunableVariant.description: Tunable option for how many items must be in the whitelist for the whitelist to pass when testing a collection of items. By default, only one object needs to be in the list.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: When testing a collection of items, the number of items in that collection that are in the whitelist must pass this threshold test for the whitelist to allow them all.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

TunableList.name: whitelist
TunableList.description: Whitelisted items.

TunableEnum.description: The type of familiar to check for.

Tunable.name: negate
Tunable.description: If checked then we will negate the results of this test.

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: The subject who's familiar tracker we are checking.

TunableTuple.name: favorites
TunableTuple.description: Tests if an object is a sim's favorite.

TunableVariant.name: favorite_type
TunableVariant.description:
The type of favorite that we are testing.
Preferred Object: Test whether the object is a sim's preferred object to use for a specific func tag. Favorite Stack: Test whether the object is in one of the sim's favorite stacks in their inventory.

TunableTuple.name: preferred_object
TunableTuple.description: Test whether the object is a sim's preferred object for a specified tag.

Tunable.name: instance_must_match
Tunable.description: If checked, the object instance must match the instance of the favorite object for this test to pass (barring the case where this test is negated). If unchecked, either the instance or definition may match for this test to pass.

TunableEnum.name: tag
TunableEnum.description: The tag that represents this type of favorite.

Tunable.name: negate
Tunable.description: If checked, the result of this test will be negated. Error cases, like subject or target not being found or the subject not having a favorites tracker, will always fail.

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: The subject who's favorite we're testing against.

TunableEnum.name: target
TunableEnum.description: The potential favorite object to test against.

TunableTuple.name: festival_running
TunableTuple.description: A test to check whether a festival is running.

TunableVariant.name: check_if_on_festival_street
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, test against if the player is on the festival's street.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: If checked, this test will pass only if the player is on the festival's street. If unchecked, the test will pass only if the player is not on the festival street.

TunableVariant.name: drama_node
TunableVariant.description: If enabled then we will check a specific type of festival drama node otherwise we will look at all of the festival drama nodes.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Reference to the festival drama node that we want to be running.

TunableVariant.name: festivals_to_check
TunableVariant.description: If enabled then we will only check a subset of all festival drama nodes referenced here. This will only apply if there is no specific drama node specified.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: A list of festival drama nodes that we want to check against.

Tunable.description: Reference to the festival drama node that we want to check against.

Tunable.name: negate
Tunable.description: If enabled this test will pass if no festivals of the tuned requirements are running.

TunableTuple.name: valid_time_blocks
TunableTuple.description:
Festival drama nodes have a tunable pre-festival duration that delay festival start to some point after the drama node has started. For example, if the festival drama node has a pre-festival duration of 2 hours and the drama node runs at 8am, the festival will not start until 10am.
By default, this test passes if the festival drama node is running, regardless if the festival is in its pre-festival duration. This tuning changes that behavior.

Tunable.name: pre_festival
Tunable.description: If the festival is currently in its pre-festival duration, test can pass if this is checked and fails if unchecked.

Tunable.name: running
Tunable.description: If the festival is running (it is past its pre-festival duration), test can pass if this is checked and fails if unchecked.

TunableTuple.name: filter_test
TunableTuple.description: A tunable test that checks to see if a sim matches a given filter.

Tunable.name: duration_available
Tunable.description: The duration from now that will be used for the start and end time of the filter request.

TunableVariant.name: filter_target
TunableVariant.description: The sim that will have the filter checked against.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: The sim that will have the filter checked against.

TunableEnum.name: relative_sim
TunableEnum.description: The sim that will be the relative sim that the filter will check against for relative checks such as relationships or household ids.

TunableVariant.name: threshold_matched
TunableVariant.description:
If enabled, we will require the number of Sims that match the filter pass the threshold requirement. Otherwise we require all Sims that the filter runs on to match.
This is useful if you only need one or a number of Sims to match the filter.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: A threshold of how many sims should match the filter.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The number that describes the threshold for how many Sims should match the filter.

TunableVariant.name: lot_on_fire
TunableVariant.description: Whether you are testing for fire being present on the lot or not present.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Whether you are testing for fire being present on the lot or not present.

Tunable.name: on_fire
Tunable.description: Whether the sim needs to be on fire or not

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: Check the selected participant for whether or not they are on fire.

TunableTuple.name: game_component
TunableTuple.description: Require the participant's game component information to match the specified conditions.

TunableVariant.name: can_join
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, require the current game to be either joinable or non- joinable. If disabled, ignore joinability.

TunableVariant.name: can_join_autonomously_after_user_directed
TunableVariant.display: Can Join Autonomously After User Directed
TunableVariant.description:
If enabled, require the current game to be either autonomously joinable or non-joinable after at least one of the player in the game join by user direction. If disabled, ignore this state.
ex. In bowling game, we don't want autonomous Sim to join the game if the last sim that join the game is user directed. In this case, enabled this filter.

TunableVariant.name: current_game_rule
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, require the game currently being played to be the same with this tuned game rule value. The test will fail if no game has been started. If disabled, ignore this state.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The game rule to be used for checking current game.

TunableVariant.name: game_over
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, require the game to have either ended or not ended. If disabled, ignore this state. A game is considered to be over if there is either no active game, or if a winning team has been chosen.

TunableVariant.name: high_score_comparison
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, compare the statistic value with game high score.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The operator to use for the comparison. Specifics: Stat Value <Operator> Game High Score.

Tunable.name: stat
Tunable.description: The stat we are comparing to high score.

TunableVariant.name: high_score_exist
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, require the game to persist high score and has high score set. If disabled, ignore this state.

TunableVariant.name: is_sim_turn
TunableVariant.description: Whether it must or must not be the participant's turn in this game.

TunableVariant.name: is_winner
TunableVariant.description: Whether the participant must be the winner or loser of this game.

TunableVariant.name: number_of_players
TunableVariant.description: The number of players required for this interaction to run.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: A tunable interval between lower_bound and upper_bound.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The subject of this game test.

TunableVariant.name: participant_has_high_score
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the participant must be either the member or non-member of the highest score team. If disabled, ignore this state.

Tunable.name: require_challenge_availability
Tunable.description: If checked, require that: * The participant is currently playing and is a challenger * No challenge is ongoing

TunableVariant.name: requires_setup
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, require the game to either be set up or not set up. If disabled, ignore this state.

TunableTuple.name: game_option
TunableTuple.description: Test whether or not a Sim has a specific gameplay option set.

TunableEnum.name: gameplay_option
TunableEnum.description: The gameplay option to test. This test will pass if this option is set.

Tunable.name: invert
Tunable.description: If enabled, requires the option to be unset for the test to pass.

TunableTuple.name: gender_preference
TunableTuple.description: A tunable factory that tests whether the actor and the subject Sim have compatible genders and gender preferences.

Tunable.name: fallback_if_no_perference_is_set
Tunable.display: Fallback If No Perference Is Set
Tunable.description: If checked then if no gender preference is set for the sim we will still pass if it is a heterosexual connection.

TunableVariant.name: override_target_gender_test
TunableVariant.description: Required gender to test against as the target gender.

TunableEnum.name: test_specific_gender
TunableEnum.description: Required gender to test against as the target gender.

TunableList.name: subject
TunableList.description: The subject(s) checking this the gender preference.

TunableList.name: target_sim
TunableList.description: Target(s) of the relationship(s).

TunableTuple.name: genealogy
TunableTuple.description: A test to check if two sims are genealogy related.

TunableEnum.name: required_relationship
TunableEnum.description: The genealogy relationship required from test_participant to target_participant.

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: The subject who requires to have the genealogy relationship with the target participant. e.g, if PARENTS is selected, then the subject_sim must be a parent of the target_sim.

TunableEnum.name: target_sim
TunableEnum.description: The target sim to test the relationship against.

TunableTuple.name: global_policy_state
TunableTuple.description: Global Policy State Test will test if the specified policies are in a given progress state.

TunableEnum.name: progress_state
TunableEnum.description: The progress state against which to test.

TunableVariant.name: test_type
TunableVariant.description: The type of test to run. Note, 'All Active Policies' will test against the set of all policies that have ever had progress made towards them.

TunableTuple.name: all_active_policies
TunableTuple.description: Test if all policies are in a given state.

Tunable.name: inverse
Tunable.description: If checked, test will pass if no states are in the specified progress state.

TunableTuple.name: specific_policy
TunableTuple.description: Test if specific policies are in a given state.

TunableList.name: policies
TunableList.description:
The subset of policies against which to test if all members are in the specified state.
Inactive policies that have never had progress made towards them will be treated as Not-Started.

Tunable.description: The global policy whose progress state is checked.

TunableTuple.name: greeted
TunableTuple.description: Tunable test for testing to see if the player is greeted or not on the current lot.

Tunable.name: test_for_greeted_status
Tunable.description: If checked then this test will pass if the player is considered greeted on the current lot. If unchecked the test will pass If the player is considered ungreeted on the current lot. If the current lot doesn't require visitation rights the player will never be considered greeted.

TunableTuple.name: has_any_favorite_of_type
TunableTuple.description:
Test to see if a sim has any preference for objects of a certain tag. Does not require the sim to have a specific favorite object listed, and will be used to run appropriate mixer interactions if the sim does/doesn't have a preference for a type of object
eg: if the sim has a preference for chopsticks, sim will run the respective mixer

TunableEnum.name: favorite_tag
TunableEnum.description: The tag to check whether the subject has a preference for

Tunable.name: negate
Tunable.description: If checked, the result of the test will be negated

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: The subject whose preference we're testing

TunableTuple.name: has_child_object_on_part
TunableTuple.description: A tunable test to check if the target has a child object on a specific part.

Tunable.name: negate
Tunable.description: If set to True, the test will pass if the subroot index we are looking for has no children.

TunableVariant.name: subroot_index
TunableVariant.description: If enabled we will look at a specific subroot index. Otherwise we will look at parts that do not have a subroot index.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The subroot index/suffix associated with the part we want to look at.

TunableEnum.name: targets
TunableEnum.description: Who or what to apply this test to.

TunableTuple.name: has_child_of_type
TunableTuple.description: A tunable test to check if the object specified contains a booth seat as a child. This is needed because seats are usually tested for using a slot test, but the booth isn't slotted into the part object on a slot. It is instead parented to the whole main object and there are two of them (one for each side of the table).

Tunable.name: negate
Tunable.description: If set to True, the test will pass if the subroot index we are looking for has no children.

TunableList.name: object_type_tags
TunableList.description: A list of the type of object tags to check for.

TunableEnum.description: The tag that the object must have in order for it to count for the test.

TunableEnum.name: targets
TunableEnum.description:
The target(s) that must have an object of the specified type as a child in order for the test to pass.
NOTE: if you pass in an object that has parts that contain an object of the specified type this will return True. You want to specify the exact part to test for a child of the correct type.

TunableTuple.name: has_familiar
TunableTuple.description: A test for testing if a subject has any bound familiars.

Tunable.name: negate
Tunable.description: If checked then we will negate the results of this test.

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: The subject who's familiar tracker we are checking.

TunableTuple.name: has_free_part
TunableTuple.description: A tunable test to check that the actor passes the may_reserve function of at least one part that matches the particular tuned definition.

Tunable.name: part_definition
Tunable.description: The part definition to check against.

TunableEnum.name: targets
TunableEnum.description: Who or what to apply this test to.

TunableTuple.name: has_head_parented_object
TunableTuple.description: A test to check whether a sim has an object parented into its head.

Tunable.name: negate
Tunable.description: If enabled test will pass if the participant doesn't have an object set as head.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant who will be verified if it has an object attached to its head.

TunableTuple.name: has_in_use_part
TunableTuple.description: A tunable test to check that there is at least one in use part that matches the particular tuned definition.

Tunable.name: part_definition
Tunable.description: The part definition to check against.

TunableEnum.name: targets
TunableEnum.description: Who or what to apply this test to.

TunableTuple.name: has_lot_owner
TunableTuple.description: Test to check if the lot has an owner or not.

Tunable.name: consider_rented_lot_as_owned
Tunable.description: If unchecked, test will not consider, renting as ownership. If checked and a sim is renting the current lot then the test will treat being rented as having an owner. If unchecked and a sim is renting the current lot then the test will not treat this lot as having an owner.

Tunable.name: has_owner
Tunable.description: If checked then the test will return true if the lot has an owner. If unchecked then the test will return true if the lot does not have an owner.

TunableTuple.name: has_parent_object
TunableTuple.description: A tunable test to check if the target has a parent object.

Tunable.name: negate
Tunable.description: If set to True, the test will pass if targets DON'T have parent.

TunableVariant.name: parent_object
TunableVariant.description: If enabled the parent of the object has to be the specified participant to pass/fail the test.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: Who or what to apply this test to.

TunableEnum.name: targets
TunableEnum.description: Who or what to apply this test to.

TunableTuple.name: has_photo_filter
TunableTuple.description: A tunable test to see if a photograph is using the tuned filter type.

Tunable.name: negate
Tunable.description: If checked the test will fail if the photo is using the tuned photo filter.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant for which we are running the test.

TunableEnum.name: photo_filter
TunableEnum.description: The photo filter that you want to test that this photo is using.

TunableTuple.name: has_timed_aspirations
TunableTuple.description: A tunable test that tests if a Sim has timed aspirations.

TunableEnum.name: target
TunableEnum.description: Who or what to apply this test to.

TunableVariant.name: test_behavior
TunableVariant.description: The type of test to run.

TunableTuple.name: has_any_timed_aspiration
TunableTuple.description: Test that passes if a Sim has any timed aspirations.

Tunable.name: invert
Tunable.description: If checked, the test will pass if a Sim has no timed aspirations.

TunableTuple.name: has_specific_timed_aspiration
TunableTuple.description: Test that passes if a Sim has any of the specific timed aspirations.

Tunable.name: invert
Tunable.description: If checked, the test will pass if a Sim has none of the specific timed aspirations.

TunableList.name: timed_aspirations
TunableList.description: The specific timed aspirations to test.

TunableTuple.name: holiday_test
TunableTuple.description: A test that tests the state of holidays.

TunableVariant.name: test_behavior
TunableVariant.description: The type of holiday test we want to run.

TunableTuple.name: holidays_running
TunableTuple.description:
A test that returns true if holidays are running.
This is a lot cheaper than specific holiday running tests if you do not care about what specific holiday is running.

Tunable.name: count_pre_holiday_time
Tunable.description: Should holidays that are in pre-holiday mode count?

Tunable.name: invert
Tunable.description: Invert the results of this test.

TunableTuple.name: specific_holiday_running
TunableTuple.description: A test that returns true if a specific holiday drama node is running.

Tunable.name: count_pre_holiday_time
Tunable.description: Should drama nodes that are in pre-holiday mode count?

Tunable.name: holiday_drama_node
Tunable.description: The holiday drama node we are interested in.

Tunable.name: invert
Tunable.description: Invert the results of this test.

TunableTuple.name: holiday_tradition
TunableTuple.description: A tunable factory that tests against the active traditions.

TunableTuple.name: tradition_filter
TunableTuple.description: A white and black list for checking if traditions are active.

TunableVariant.name: blacklist
TunableVariant.description: When an item is tested against this white/black list, it is only allowed if it is not in the blacklist. If no blacklist is specified, no items are disallowed.

TunableTuple.name: specify
TunableTuple.description: A tunable blacklist.

TunableList.name: blacklist
TunableList.description: Blacklisted items.

TunableVariant.name: threshold
TunableVariant.description: Tunable option for how many items must be in the blacklist for the blacklist to fail when testing a collection of items. By default, only one object needs to be in the list.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: When testing a collection of items, the number of items in that collection that are in the blacklist must pass this threshold test for the blacklist to disallow them all.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

TunableVariant.name: whitelist
TunableVariant.description: When an item is tested against this white/black list, it is only allowed if it is in the whitelist. If no whitelist is specified, all items are allowed.

TunableTuple.name: specify
TunableTuple.description: A tunable whitelist.

TunableVariant.name: threshold
TunableVariant.description: Tunable option for how many items must be in the whitelist for the whitelist to pass when testing a collection of items. By default, only one object needs to be in the list.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: When testing a collection of items, the number of items in that collection that are in the whitelist must pass this threshold test for the whitelist to allow them all.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

TunableList.name: whitelist
TunableList.description: Whitelisted items.

TunableTuple.name: household_can_post_alert
TunableTuple.description: A tunable factory that tests if a household can post an alert for a missing pet.

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: The subject whose household to check.

TunableTuple.name: household_has_missing_pet
TunableTuple.description: A tunable factory that tests if a household has a missing pet.

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: The subject whose household to check.

TunableTuple.name: household_size
TunableTuple.description: Require the specified participant's household to have a specified number of free Sim slots.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The subject whose household is the object of this test.

TunableVariant.name: test_type
TunableVariant.description: The type of test to

TunableTuple.name: actual_size
TunableTuple.description: Use this option when you're testing the actual number of sims in a household. This should not be used for testing if you are able to add a sim to the household and should only be used for functionality that depents on the actual household members being there and not counting reserved slots. ex. Achievement for having a household of 8 sims.

TunableTuple.name: count
TunableTuple.description: The number of household members.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The value of a threshold.

TunableTuple.name: count
TunableTuple.description: Use this option when you're testing for a specific number of free slots in the household.

TunableTuple.name: count
TunableTuple.description: The number of required free slots for the specified household.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The value of a threshold.

TunableTuple.name: participant
TunableTuple.description: Use this option when you're testing a specific Sim being added to the household.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant whose required slot count we consider.

TunableTuple.name: identity
TunableTuple.description: Require the specified participants to be the same, or, alternatively, require them to be different.

TunableEnum.name: subject_a
TunableEnum.description: The participant to be compared to subject_b.

TunableEnum.name: subject_b
TunableEnum.description: The participant to be compared to subject_a.

Tunable.name: subjects_match
Tunable.description: If True, subject_a must match subject_b. If False, they must not.

Tunable.name: use_definition
Tunable.description: If checked, the two subjects will only compare definition. Not the instance. This will mean two different types of chairs, for instance, can return True if they use the same chair object definition.

Tunable.name: use_part_owner
Tunable.description: If checked, the two subjects will compare based on the part owner if either are a part.

TunableTuple.name: in_footprint
TunableTuple.description:
A tunable factory that runs a test checking if a Sim participant is in a footprint.
NOTE: This is an expensive test, so do NOT tune it on autonomous interactions or other expensive operations.

TunableEnum.name: actor
TunableEnum.description: The actor whose location will be used.

TunableVariant.name: footprint_names
TunableVariant.description: Specific footprints to check against. If left unspecified, we check against the object's default footprints (i.e. the ones enabled in Medator).

Tunable.description: Name of footprint. Can be looked up in Medator. If in doubt, consult the modeler.

TunableVariant.name: footprint_target
TunableVariant.description: The object whose footprint to check against.

TunableTuple.name: by_participant
TunableTuple.description: Get footprint from a participant.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant whose required slot count we consider.

TunableTuple.name: by_tag
TunableTuple.description: Get footprint from an object with this tag. If there are multiple, the test passes as long as one passes.

TunableEnum.name: tag
TunableEnum.description: Tag to find objects by.

Tunable.name: invert
Tunable.description: If checked, test will pass if the actor is not in the footprint.

TunableTuple.name: in_home_neighborhood
TunableTuple.description: A test that returns true if the neighborhood of the Sim's home is the same neighborhood in which the Sim is currently in.

Tunable.name: negate
Tunable.description: If checked, negate the result of the test.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant against which to run the HomeNeighborhood test.

TunableTuple.name: in_home_region
TunableTuple.description: A test that returns true if the region of the Sim's home is the same region in which the Sim is currently in.

Tunable.name: negate
Tunable.description: If checked, negate the result of the test.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant against which to run the HomeRegion test.

TunableTuple.name: in_inventory
TunableTuple.description: A test to check if the specified participant is in, or not in, an inventory of a particular type.

TunableList.name: inventory_types
TunableList.description: Inventory types to test against. If this is any, the test will consider ALL inventory types.

TunableEnum.description: The inventory type to test.

Tunable.name: negate
Tunable.description: If enabled, we will check that the participant IS NOT in any of the specified inventory types. If disabled, we will check that the participant IS in at least one of the specified inventory types.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant to test.

Tunable.name: test_hidden
Tunable.description:
If enabled, will test whether the participant is in the hidden storage of the inventory or not, based on the value of negate.
If this is enabled and negate is not, we require the object to be in the hidden storage of the inventory. If this enabled and negate is enabled, we require that the object is not in the hidden storage of the inventory.

TunableTuple.name: in_use
TunableTuple.description: A tunable test to tell if any of the tuned targets are in use by any sims.

TunableEnum.name: candidates
TunableEnum.description: Which sims will be considered users of the target.

Tunable.name: negate
Tunable.description:
If unchecked, this test will pass when the object is in use. If checked, this test will pass when the object is not in use.
If a number using range is specified, then if checked the test will pass when the number using is outside the specified range. Either too many or too few.

TunableVariant.name: number_using
TunableVariant.description: An optional interval to specify an inclusive range of valid sims that must be using the target(s) Too few or too many, and the test will fail.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: A tunable interval between lower_bound and upper_bound.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

TunableList.name: targets
TunableList.description: Targets to check whether in use.

TunableTuple.name: inappropriateness
TunableTuple.description: A test to determine if a specific affordance is inappropriate for a Sim.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The subject of this situation data test.

TunableTuple.name: interaction_restored_from_load
TunableTuple.description: Test whether an interaction was pushed from load or from normal gameplay.

Tunable.name: from_load
Tunable.description: If checked, this test will pass if the interaction was restored from save load (restored interactions are pushed behind the loading screen). If not checked, this test will only pass if the interaction was pushed during normal gameplay.

TunableTuple.name: inventory
TunableTuple.description: A test to check on the contents of either a sim inventory or an object inventory.

TunableVariant.name: contents_check
TunableVariant.description: Checks to run on each object of the specified inventory

TunableTuple.name: has_object_of_participant_type
TunableTuple.description: Participant type we want to test if its in the selected inventory.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: Which participant of the interaction do we want to validate on the inventory.

Tunable.name: definition
Tunable.description: The object definition to look for inside inventory.

TunableTuple.name: has_object_with_states
TunableTuple.description: This option tests crafted item's tags against a list of possible tags.

Tunable.name: definition
Tunable.description: The object must have this definition.

TunableTuple.name: tag
TunableTuple.description: The object must have this tag.

TunableList.name: tag_set
TunableList.description: The tag of objects we want to test ownership of

TunableEnum.description: What tag to test for

TunableEnum.name: test_type
TunableEnum.description: How to test the tags in the tag set against the objects on the lot.

Tunable.description: What state to test for.

TunableEnum.name: test_type
TunableEnum.description: How to test the states in the state set against the objects in the inventory.

TunableTuple.name: has_object_with_tag
TunableTuple.description: This option tests crafted item's tags against a list of possible tags

TunableList.name: tag_set
TunableList.description: The tag of objects we want to test ownership of

TunableEnum.description: What tag to test for

TunableEnum.name: test_type
TunableEnum.description: How to test the tags in the tag set against the objects on the lot.

TunableVariant.name: inventory_location
TunableVariant.description:
Who owns the inventory. Either look in the inventory of a participant or specify an object inventory type directly.
If participant returns multiple inventory owners, the test will pass only if ALL of those owners pass the inventory content test.

TunableEnum.name: inventory
TunableEnum.description: Check in the hidden inventory for objects that can go into the specified inventory type. EX: check that there are mailbox objects in the hidden inventory

TunableEnum.name: inventory
TunableEnum.description: Check the global Object inventory that has the specified type. EX: check in the global fridge inventory that exists for all fridges

TunableEnum.name: inventory
TunableEnum.description: The owner of the inventory

TunableTuple.name: required_count
TunableTuple.description:
The inventory must have a tunable threshold of objects that pass the contents check test.
EX: test is object definition of type pizza. required count is enabled and has a threshold of >= 5. That means this test will pass if you have 5 or more pizzas in your inventory. To check if any objects exist, use required count >= 1

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The value of a threshold.

TunableEnum.name: test_hidden
TunableEnum.description: Optionally restrict to only hidden or non-hidden inventories.

TunableTuple.name: is_carrying_object
TunableTuple.description: Require the participant to be carrying the specified object. For example, this is being used currently to only allow a Sim to run the wash dishes interaction if they're currently carrying the dirty dish stack object.

Tunable.name: negate
Tunable.description: If checked the test will fail if the user is carrying the object.

Tunable.name: object_reference
Tunable.description: A type of object required to be carried.

TunableEnum.name: object_tag
TunableEnum.description: A tag to test the target object for.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The subject of this test.

TunableTuple.name: is_entitled
TunableTuple.description: A test to check if the player is entitled to a certain pack or object.

Tunable.name: entitlement
Tunable.description: Entitlement to check against.

Tunable.name: negate
Tunable.description: If checked the test will pass if the user is not entitled.

TunableTuple.name: is_in_current_temple_room
TunableTuple.description: A tunable test that takes in a participant and passes if it's in the current temple room.

Tunable.name: negate
Tunable.description: If checked, the outcome of this test will be negated. The test will still fail, regardless of this check box, if this isn't a temple zone or if the tuned trap_object participant doesn't exist.

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: The subject whose position will be used to determine if they are inside the current temple room. Test will pass if they are, and fail if they aren't.

TunableTuple.name: is_live_event_active
TunableTuple.description: A tunable test to see if a given live event is active.

Tunable.name: event_id
Tunable.description: The string associated with the live event to be tested. If that live event is active, this test will return True.

TunableTuple.name: is_online
TunableTuple.description: A test to check the online status of the game.

Tunable.name: negate
Tunable.description: If checked the test will pass if the user is not online.

TunableTuple.name: is_temple_trigger_interaction
TunableTuple.description: A tunable test that will pass if the interaction is the trigger interaction for the current temple room.

Tunable.name: affordance_to_test
negate
Tunable.description: If checked, the outcome of this test will be negated. The test will still fail, regardless of this check box, if this isn't a temple zone or if the tuned trap_object participant doesn't exist.

TunableEnum.name: trap_object
TunableEnum.description: The trap object to test against. For the room this object is in, if the tuned affordance on this object is the trigger interaction, the test will Pass. Otherwise, the test will Fail.

TunableTuple.name: knowledge
TunableTuple.description: A test that determines whether two different Sims have knowledge about each other's information.

TunableVariant.name: career_knowledge_requirement
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the test will check the subject's knowledge of the target's careers and fail if the knowledge requirement is not met.

TunableVariant.name: knows_all_traits_of_type
TunableVariant.description: The subject Sim does/does not know all the traits of a certain type of target Sim.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: The subject Sim does/does not know all the traits of a certain type of target Sim.

Tunable.name: knows_all
Tunable.description: If checked, the subject Sim must know all the traits of the specified type to pass. If unchecked, the subject Sim must not know all the traits of the specified type to pass.

TunableEnum.name: trait_type
TunableEnum.description: The trait type to check.

TunableVariant.name: major_knowledge_requirement
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the test will check the subject's knowledge of the target's major and fail if the knowledge requirement is not met.

TunableList.name: prohibited_traits
TunableList.description: The test will fail if any of the traits specified in this list are known.

TunableList.name: required_traits
TunableList.description: If there are any traits specified in this list, the test will fail if none of the traits are known.

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: The subject of the test. This is the Sim that needs to know information about the target.

TunableEnum.name: target
TunableEnum.description: The target of the test. This is the Sim whose information needs to be known by the subject.

TunableTuple.name: lifestyle_brand
TunableTuple.description: A test to see if a sim has an active Lifestyle Brand or not.

Tunable.name: negate
Tunable.description: If checked then this test will return True when the subject does not have an active lifestyle brand.

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: The subject to check for an active Lifestyle Brand.

TunableTuple.name: location
TunableTuple.description: Tests for object locations. Outside: Check if an object is on the inside or outside (has a roof over its head) Natural ground: Checks the floor tiles where the object is to see if it qualifies as natural ground

TunableVariant.name: has_terrain_tag
TunableVariant.description: If checked, will verify the subject of the test is currently on the tuned terrain tag.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: , A set of terrain tags required for this test to pass.

Tunable.name: negate
Tunable.description: If checked, the test will be inverted. In other words, the test will fail if at least one tag is detected at this location.

TunableList.name: terrain_tags
TunableList.description: A set of terrain tags. Only one of these tags needs to be present at this location. Although it is not tunable, there is a threshold weight underneath which a terrain tag will not appear to be present.

Tunable.name: test_floor_tiles
Tunable.description: If checked, floor tiles will be tested. Otherwise, it'll only check the terrain and will ignore the floor tiles on the terrain.

TunableVariant.name: in_common_area
TunableVariant.description: If checked, will verify the subject is in the common area of an apartment. If unchecked will verify the subject is not.

TunableVariant.name: is_fire_allowed
TunableVariant.description: If checked, will verify if fire is possible at the subject's position. If unchecked, will pass if fire is not possible. If not enabled, doesn't care either way.

TunableVariant.name: is_in_slot
TunableVariant.description: If enabled will test if the object is attacked/deattached to any of possible tuned slots. If you tune a slot type set the test will test if the object is slotted or not slotted into into any of those types.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Test if an object is current slotted in any of a possible list of slot types. Empty slot type set is allowed for testing for slotted or not slotted only.

TunableVariant.name: slot_test_type
TunableVariant.description: Strategy to test the slots: Any Slot - is the object in any slot Surface Slot - is object is in a surface slot Specific Slot - is the object in specific list of slots

TunableTuple.name: any_slot
TunableTuple.description: Singleton factory for testing if object is slotted.

Tunable.name: require_slotted
Tunable.description: If checked, return success if the object is slotted If unchecked, test the absense of slotting.

TunableTuple.name: specific_slot
TunableTuple.description: Subclass of SlotTestType that can check against a specific slot set.

Tunable.name: require_slotted
Tunable.description: If checked, return success if the object is slotted If unchecked, test the absense of slotting.

Tunable.name: specific_slot_set
Tunable.description: Set of slots the object may be attached to.

TunableTuple.name: surface_slot
TunableTuple.description: Subclass of SlotTestType that checks that a slot has is_surface set to true.

Tunable.name: require_slotted
Tunable.description: If checked, return success if the object is slotted If unchecked, test the absense of slotting.

TunableVariant.name: is_inside_building
TunableVariant.description: If checked, will verify if the subject of the test is inside a building. This uses a client function that checks if the block the sim is mostly enclosed by walls or if not, if the adjoining blocks are themselves enclosed. This should be used when we want to test if a subject is inside a normally constructed building. If we simply want to test whether the subject is covered / has a roof over them, use is_outside. See comment on is_outside for more details. If unchecked, will negate this test.

TunableVariant.name: is_natural_ground
TunableVariant.description: If checked, will verify the subject of the test is on natural ground (no floor tiles are under him). Otherwise, will verify the subject of the test is not on natural ground.

TunableVariant.name: is_on_active_lot
TunableVariant.description:
If disabled the test will not be used. If enabled and checked, the test will pass if the subject is on the active lot. (their center is within the lot bounds) If enabled and not checked, the test will pass if the subject is outside of the active lot.
For example, Ask To Leave is tuned with this enabled and checked for the TargetSim. You can only ask someone to leave if they are actually on the active lot, but not if they are wandering around in the open streets.

TunableTuple.name: Is_or_is_not_on_active_lot
TunableTuple.display: Is Or Is Not On Active Lot

Tunable.name: include_spawn_point
Tunable.description: If set to true, we will consider the lot's spawn point as part of the active lot.

Tunable.name: is_or_is_not_on_active_lot
Tunable.display: Is Or Is Not On Active Lot
Tunable.description: If checked then the test will pass if the subject is on the active lot.

Tunable.name: explicit
Tunable.description: The tolerance from the edge of the lot that the location test will use in order to determine if the test target is considered on lot or not.

TunableTuple.name: use_default_tolerance
TunableTuple.description: Use the default tuned global offlot tolerance tuned in objects.components.statistic_component.Default Off Lot.

TunableVariant.name: is_on_level
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, we check the participant's current level against the tuned threshold. In the case of sims in pools, the effective level will be that of the surface of the pool, not the bottom.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Value/comparison pair used to define a Threshold.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

TunableVariant.name: is_outside
TunableVariant.description: PLEASE BE AWARE. If checked, will verify if the subject of the test does not have a roof over their head. If unchecked, will test if the subject has a roof over their head. If the intention is to determine if a subject is in/not in a building, this test is deprecated in favor of is_inside_building. If you would like to test if a subject is inside a building, but also need to test if they have a roof over their head, please use both options.

TunableVariant.name: is_venue_type
TunableVariant.description: If checked, will verify if the subject is at a venue of the specified type.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Venue type required for this test to pass.

Tunable.name: negate
Tunable.description: If enabled, the test will return true if the subject IS NOT at a venue of the specified type.

Tunable.name: use_source_venue
Tunable.description: If enabled, the test will test the source venue instead of the active venue. For example, the Community Lot instead of the active Marketplace. Testing the active venue is the default.

Tunable.name: venue_type
Tunable.description: Venue type to test against.

TunableVariant.name: valid_surface_types
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, we will test the surface type of the subject against prohibited or required surface types.

TunableTuple.name: Test_Surface_Types
TunableTuple.description: Required and Prohibited Surface Types.

TunableVariant.name: blacklist
TunableVariant.description: When an item is tested against this white/black list, it is only allowed if it is not in the blacklist. If no blacklist is specified, no items are disallowed.

TunableTuple.name: specify
TunableTuple.description: A tunable blacklist.

TunableList.name: blacklist
TunableList.description: Blacklisted items.

TunableEnum.description: Surface Type the object is placed on.

TunableVariant.name: threshold
TunableVariant.description: Tunable option for how many items must be in the blacklist for the blacklist to fail when testing a collection of items. By default, only one object needs to be in the list.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: When testing a collection of items, the number of items in that collection that are in the blacklist must pass this threshold test for the blacklist to disallow them all.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

TunableVariant.name: whitelist
TunableVariant.description: When an item is tested against this white/black list, it is only allowed if it is in the whitelist. If no whitelist is specified, all items are allowed.

TunableTuple.name: specify
TunableTuple.description: A tunable whitelist.

TunableVariant.name: threshold
TunableVariant.description: Tunable option for how many items must be in the whitelist for the whitelist to pass when testing a collection of items. By default, only one object needs to be in the list.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: When testing a collection of items, the number of items in that collection that are in the whitelist must pass this threshold test for the whitelist to allow them all.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

TunableList.name: whitelist
TunableList.description: Whitelisted items.

TunableEnum.description: Surface Type the object is placed on.

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: Who or what to apply this test to.

TunableTuple.name: locked_portal_count
TunableTuple.description: A test that checks the number of locked doors.

TunableVariant.name: lock_priority
TunableVariant.description: The priority of the locks we want to test. None means all priorities.

TunableVariant.name: lock_types
TunableVariant.description: The type of the locks we want to test. None means all types.

TunableTuple.name: number_to_test
TunableTuple.description: The number of doors that need to be locked to pass this test.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The value of a threshold.

TunableTuple.name: lot_decorations
TunableTuple.description:
LotDecorationTest will test the state of the player's lot for certain lot decoration conditions.
If Seasons pack is not installed, this test will always fail.

TunableVariant.name: test
TunableVariant.description: The test we want to run.

TunableTuple.name: active_lot_decorated_for_occasion
TunableTuple.description: Test to determine if the lot is decorated for some non-everyday occasion.

TunableTuple.name: custom_decorations
TunableTuple.description: Test to detremine if the active lot has any custom decorations within the given context.

TunableVariant.name: _decoration_occasion
TunableVariant.description: The holiday this applies to. If disabled, applies only to everyday decorations.

TunableTuple.name: active_holiday
TunableTuple.description:
The current holiday in pre-holiday state.
Can return no holiday if there is no holiday in pre-holiday state.

TunableTuple.name: active_or_upcoming
TunableTuple.description:
The active or upcoming holiday.
First checks for an active holiday. If there is no active holiday, falls back to a holiday that is in pre-holiday state.
Can return no holiday if there is no holiday in either state.

TunableTuple.name: specific_holiday
TunableTuple.description: The holiday definition.

TunableTuple.name: upcoming_holiday
TunableTuple.description:
The active holiday.
Can return no holiday if there is no holiday running.

TunableTuple.name: decorations_available
TunableTuple.description: Test to determine if the active lot has decorations available itself within a given context. This can be either custom or holiday decorations.

TunableVariant.name: _decoration_occasion
TunableVariant.description: The holiday this applies to. If disabled, applies only to everyday decorations.

TunableTuple.name: active_holiday
TunableTuple.description:
The current holiday in pre-holiday state.
Can return no holiday if there is no holiday in pre-holiday state.

TunableTuple.name: active_or_upcoming
TunableTuple.description:
The active or upcoming holiday.
First checks for an active holiday. If there is no active holiday, falls back to a holiday that is in pre-holiday state.
Can return no holiday if there is no holiday in either state.

TunableTuple.name: specific_holiday
TunableTuple.description: The holiday definition.

TunableTuple.name: upcoming_holiday
TunableTuple.description:
The active holiday.
Can return no holiday if there is no holiday running.

TunableTuple.name: holiday_decoratable
TunableTuple.description: Test to determine if the active lot has holiday decorations within the given context.

TunableVariant.name: _decoration_occasion
TunableVariant.description: The holiday this applies to. If disabled, applies only to everyday decorations.

TunableTuple.name: active_holiday
TunableTuple.description:
The current holiday in pre-holiday state.
Can return no holiday if there is no holiday in pre-holiday state.

TunableTuple.name: active_or_upcoming
TunableTuple.description:
The active or upcoming holiday.
First checks for an active holiday. If there is no active holiday, falls back to a holiday that is in pre-holiday state.
Can return no holiday if there is no holiday in either state.

TunableTuple.name: specific_holiday
TunableTuple.description: The holiday definition.

TunableTuple.name: upcoming_holiday
TunableTuple.description:
The active holiday.
Can return no holiday if there is no holiday running.

TunableEnum.name: terrain_feature

TunableTuple.name: lot_has_front_door
TunableTuple.description: A test that checks if the active lot has a front door.

Tunable.name: invert
Tunable.description: If checked, test will pass if there is NO front door

TunableTuple.name: lot_has_garden
TunableTuple.description: A test that checks if the active lot has a garden.

TunableTuple.name: lot_owner
TunableTuple.description: Gate availability by whether a sim owns the lot the object is on or not.

Tunable.name: consider_business_lot_as_owned
Tunable.description: If checked, business lots are considered owned. If unchecked, business lots are considered unowned.

Tunable.name: consider_rented_lot_as_owned
Tunable.description: If checked, rented lots are considered owned. If unchecked, rented lots are considered unowned.

Tunable.name: invert
Tunable.description: If checked, this test will return the opposite of what it's tuned to return. For instance, if this test is tuned to return True if the active household owns the lot, but "Invert" is checked, it will actually return False.

Tunable.name: owns_lot
Tunable.description: If checked and subject owns the current lot then this test will pass. If unchecked, subject does not own lot, this test will pass.

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: Who or what to apply this test to

TunableTuple.name: mood
TunableTuple.description: A tunable test that tests if a Sim has the requested mood.

Tunable.name: disallow
Tunable.description: If True, this test will pass if the Sim's mood does NOT match the tuned mood reference.

Tunable.name: mood
Tunable.description: The mood that must be active (or must be inactive, if 'Disallow' is checked).

TunableEnum.name: who
TunableEnum.description: To whom or what this test should be applied.

TunableList.name: stats
TunableList.description: The stat we are operating on.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: The threshold to control availability based on the statistic's value.

TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value

TunableEnum.description: Who or what to apply this test to.

Tunable.description: Reference to the festival drama node that we want to check against.

Tunable.name: negate
Tunable.description: If enabled this test will pass if the next festival is not one of the tuned nodes.
