TunableTuple.name: serving
TunableTuple.description:
Create an object that is a serving of the specified crafted object. This loot can be used to create an object outside of the GrabServingInteraction flow, which requires the Sim to go into carry posture.
Use cases: - For cases where we want to get more than one serving at a time in a single interaction, we don't want to run the grab serving more than once. e.g. cauldron bottle up all servings of a potion. - For cases where we don't even want to run a carry at all. e.g. cauldron drink from cauldron, we want to drink directly from the cauldron (no carry), but create a hidden object we can run a custom consume on.

TunableEnum.name: serving_source
TunableEnum.description: The source of the

TunableList.name: transferred_states
TunableList.description: A list of states to be copied over to the created object.

TunableList.name: transferred_stats
TunableList.description: A list of stats to be copied over to the created object.

Tunable.name: use_base_recipe_on_setup
Tunable.description: If enabled, the created serving will use the Base Object when being set up. Otherwise, the recipe tuning will be used. In general, this should stay checked. Unchecking this is useful for objects like the Pit BBQ where a group serving is being pulled from another group serving. The "Call to Meal" interactions will be forwarded correctly.

Tunable.name: use_linked_recipe_mapping
Tunable.description: If enabled, when creating the recipe, instead of using the base recipe it will look into the recipe linked recipe tuning and find what recipes it can generate. This is used to support multiple recipes generated from the same multiserve. i.e. Ice cream carton can generate bowls, milkshakes and cones.

Tunable.name: destroy_on_placement_failure
Tunable.description: If checked, the created object will be destroyed on placement failure. If unchecked, the created object will be placed into an appropriate inventory on placement failure if possible. If THAT fails, object will be destroyed. By default it goes into location target's inventory, you can use fallback_location_target_override to make the created object go to another participant's inventory.

TunableVariant.name: fallback_location_target_override
TunableVariant.description: This will be ignored if destroy_on_placement_failure is checked. If this is enabled, we override fallback location target. Currently this is used when location target is different with the target whose inventory we want this created object to go into. For example we want to create an object near another object but we want this object to go to actor's inventory when placement fails.

TunableList.name: initial_states
TunableList.description: A list of states to apply to the object as soon as it is created.

TunableTuple.description: The state to apply and optional tests to decide if the state should apply.

TunableVariant.name: tests
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the state will only get set on the created object if the tests pass. Note: These tests can not be performed on the newly created object.

TdescFragTag.name: enabled
TdescFragTag.description:
A list of tests groups. At least one must pass all its sub- tests to pass the TestSet.
ORs of ANDs

TunableVariant.name: location
TunableVariant.description: Where the object should be created.

TunableTuple.name: carry
TunableTuple.description: Carry the object. Note: This expects an animation in the interaction to trigger the carry.

TunableVariant.name: carry_track_override
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, specify which carry track the Sim must use to carry the created object.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: Which hand to carry the object in.

TunableTuple.name: inventory
TunableTuple.description: An inventory based off of the chosen Participant Type.

TunableEnum.name: location_target
TunableEnum.description: "The owner of the inventory the object will be created in."

Tunable.name: mark_object_as_stolen_from_career
Tunable.display: Mark Object As Stolen From Career
Tunable.description: Marks the object as stolen from a career by the tuned location_target participant. This should only be checked if this basic extra is on a CareerSuperInteraction.

Tunable.name: place_in_hidden_inventory
Tunable.description: If True, the object is placed in the hidden inventory rather than the user-facing inventory.

TunableTuple.name: position
TunableTuple.description: The object is placed somewhere on the ground/floor. This executes an FGL search.

Tunable.name: allow_off_lot_placement
Tunable.description: If checked, objects will be allowed to be placed off-lot. If unchecked, we will always attempt to place created objects on the active lot.

Tunable.name: enclosed_room_only
Tunable.description: If checked, objects will run their placement search only for positions that are considered in an enclosed room.

TunableVariant.name: facing
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the final location will ensure that the placed object faces a specific location.

Tunable.name: angle
Tunable.description: The angle that facing will trying to keep inside while test FGL. The larger the number is, the more offset the facing could be, but the chance will be higher to succeed in FGL.

TunableVariant.name: target
TunableVariant.description: The location to face.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: Specify a participant that needs to be faced.

Tunable.name: ignore_bb_footprints
Tunable.description:
Ignores the build buy object footprints when trying to find a position for creating this object. This will allow objects to appear on top of each other.
e.g. Trash cans when tipped over want to place the trash right under them so it looks like the pile came out from the object while it was tipped.

Tunable.name: ignore_sim_positions
Tunable.description: If checked, the FGL search will ignore current Sim positions and any positions Sims are intending to go. If unchecked, these Sim positions will be taken into account when placing the object.

Tunable.name: in_same_room
Tunable.description: If checked, objects will be placed in the same block/room of the initial location. If there is not enough space to put down the object in the same block, the placement will fail.

TunableVariant.name: initial_location
TunableVariant.description: The FGL search initial position is determined by this. If more than one initial position is available, all are considered up to the specified upper bound.

TunableTuple.name: from_joint
TunableTuple.description: The location is based on an object joint.

Tunable.name: joint_name
Tunable.description: The name of the joint to use for the position.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant that determines the object to be used for the specified placement strategy.

TunableTuple.name: from_lot
TunableTuple.description: The location is the default lot location.

TunableEnum.name: lot_location_strategy
TunableEnum.description: Strategy for how we will determine a location on the lot. Default: Tries to retrieve the position of the front door, otherwise uses an arbitrary corner (will always be the same corner) Random: Retrieves a random point on the lot

TunableTuple.name: from_participant
TunableTuple.description: The object is determined by a participant on the resolver.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant that determines the object to be used for the specified placement strategy.

TunableTuple.name: from_tags
TunableTuple.description: The object is determined by a set of specified tags.

Tunable.name: should_shuffle
Tunable.description: If False, go through each tag in order, and try placement for each object (in the order of their indices in object manager). If True, we gather all objects matching any tag, then pick a random one, if placement fails, pick another random one.

TunableEnum.description: For each tag, in order, gather objects that match that have that tag. If the placement fails, consider another object, then consider objects for the next tag. If should_shuffle is True, gather all objects matching any tag, then pick a random one, if placement fails, pick another random one.

TunableTuple.name: front_door_object
TunableTuple.description: The front door.

TunableTuple.name: default_offset
TunableTuple.description: The default Vector3 offset from the location target's position.

Tunable.name: x
Tunable.description: x component

Tunable.name: y
Tunable.description: y component

Tunable.name: z
Tunable.description: z component

TunableVariant.name: x_randomization_range
TunableVariant.description: A random number in this range will be applied to the default offset along the x axis.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: A random number in this range will be applied to the default offset along the x axis.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

TunableVariant.name: z_randomization_range
TunableVariant.description: A random number in this range will be applied to the default offset along the z axis.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: A random number in this range will be applied to the default offset along the z axis.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: lot_terrain_only
Tunable.description: If checked, objects will run their placement search only for positions that are within the lot and on terrain.

TunableVariant.name: max_water_depth
TunableVariant.description: (float) If provided, each vertex of the test polygon along with its centroid will be tested to determine whether the ocean water at the test location is at most this deep. Values <= 0 indicate placement in ocean is invalid.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Value of the max water depth allowed.

TunableVariant.name: min_water_depth
TunableVariant.description: (float) If provided, each vertex of the test polygon along with its centroid will be tested to determine whether the ocean water at the test location is at least this deep. Values <= 0 indicate placement on land is valid.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Value of the min water depth allowed.

Tunable.name: perform_fgl_check
Tunable.description:
If checked (default), FGL will be used to find an unblocked location for the object to be placed after it is created.
If unchecked, FGL will not be performed, and the object will be placed at the location + orientation specified, even if it overlaps other footprints.
Ideally this should be used in conjunction with another system that assures objects will not overlap. This is useful for placing an object on top of a jig, but probably should not be used for placing a build buy object that intersects with another build buy object.
It should also be noted that object collisions will not play nice with save/load, and objects that overlap may be deleted when loading a save. This should be used with objects that are temporary.

Tunable.name: randomize_orientation
Tunable.description: If checked, object will be spawned using a random orientation. Otherwise, it will use the orientation of the target object.

TunableVariant.name: raytest
TunableVariant.description: If enabled then we will run a raytest to make sure that the object remains within LOS.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Data related to running a raytest to a position.

Tunable.name: raytest_end_height_offset
Tunable.description: The height offset of end point of the ray. 1.5 is the height of a Sim.

Tunable.name: raytest_radius
Tunable.description: The radius of the ray. 0.1 is acceptable for a line of sight check.

Tunable.name: raytest_start_height_offset
Tunable.description: The height offset of the start height. 1.5 is the height of a Sim.

TunableVariant.name: starting_position
TunableVariant.description: Use either the previously calculated starting point or perform a raytest in regards to a specific participant.

TunableEnum.name: use_participants_location
TunableEnum.description: A partcipant's location that we will perform the raytest to.

Tunable.name: stay_in_connected_connectivity_group
Tunable.description:
If unchecked then the object will be allowed to be placed in a connectivity group that is currently disconnected from the starting location.
If checked then the placement will fail if there is not a position inside a connected connectivity group from the starting position that can be used for placement.

Tunable.name: stay_outside_placement
Tunable.description: If checked, objects will run their placement search only for positions that are considered outside.

TunableVariant.name: surface_type_override
TunableVariant.description:
If enabled, we will override the routing surface type of the location to whatever is tuned here. Otherwise, we use the routing surface of the initial location.
Example: The initial location may be in a pool but you want the created object to be placed on the ground.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: The routing surface we want to force the object to be placed on.

TunableVariant.name: terrain_tags
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, a set of allowed terrain tags. At least one tag must match the terrain under each vertex of the footprint of the supplied object.

TunableTuple.name: slot
TunableTuple.description: The object is slotted somewhere.

TunableVariant.name: parent
TunableVariant.description: The object this object is going to be slotted into.

TunableTuple.name: from_participant
TunableTuple.description: The object is determined by a participant on the resolver.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant that determines the object to be used for the specified placement strategy.

TunableTuple.name: from_tags
TunableTuple.description: The object is determined by a set of specified tags.

Tunable.name: should_shuffle
Tunable.description: If False, go through each tag in order, and try placement for each object (in the order of their indices in object manager). If True, we gather all objects matching any tag, then pick a random one, if placement fails, pick another random one.

TunableEnum.description: For each tag, in order, gather objects that match that have that tag. If the placement fails, consider another object, then consider objects for the next tag. If should_shuffle is True, gather all objects matching any tag, then pick a random one, if placement fails, pick another random one.

TunableVariant.name: parent_slot
TunableVariant.description: The slot on location_target where the object should go. This may be either the exact name of a bone on the location_target or a slot type, in which case the first empty slot of the specified type in which the child object fits will be used.

Tunable.name: by_name
Tunable.description: The exact name of a slot on the location_target in which the target object should go.

Tunable.name: by_reference
Tunable.description: A particular slot type in which the target object should go. The first empty slot of this type found on the location_target will be used.

Tunable.name: use_part_owner
Tunable.description: If enabled and target is a part, placement will use the part owner instead of the part.

TunableVariant.name: notification_inventory
TunableVariant.description: The notification to show when created object is placed in an inventory.

TunableTuple.name: household_inventory
TunableTuple.description: The notification to show when created object is placed in a household inventory.

TunableVariant.name: additional_texts
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, add additional text to the dialog

Tunable.description: A localized string that may use tokens.

Tunable.name: anonymous_target_sim
Tunable.description: If this dialog is using a target sim id to give a conversation type view and this is checked, then the target sim icon will instead be replaced by an anonymous caller.

TunableVariant.name: audio_sting
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, play an audio sting when the dialog is shown.

Tunable.name: audio
Tunable.description: The sound to play.

Tunable.name: immediate_audio
Tunable.description:
If checked, this audio will be triggered immediately, nothing will block.
ex. Earbuds audio will be played immediately while the Sim is routing or animating.

TunableVariant.name: joint_name_hash
TunableVariant.description: Specify if the audio is attached to a slot and, if so, which slot. Otherwise the audio will be attached to the object's origin.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The name of the slot this audio is attached to.

Tunable.name: play_on_active_sim_only
Tunable.description:
If enabled, and audio target is Sim, the audio will only be played on selected Sim. Otherwise it will be played regardless Sim is selected or not.
If audio target is Object, always set this to False. Otherwise the audio will never be played.
ex. This will be useful for Earbuds where we want to hear the music only when the Sim is selected.

TunableVariant.name: background_audio
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, play background audio while the dialog is open.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The background audio event string.

TunableEnum.name: dialog_bg_style
TunableEnum.description: The style background to apply to this dialog.

TunableList.name: dialog_options
TunableList.description: Options to apply to the dialog.

TunableEnum.name: dialog_style
TunableEnum.description: The style layout to apply to this dialog.

TunableEnum.name: expand_behavior
TunableEnum.description: Specify the notification's expand behavior.

TunableVariant.name: icon
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, specify an icon to be displayed.

TunableList.name: participant_type
TunableList.description: The Participant who owns the lifestyle brand we want to use.

TunableTuple.name: participant
TunableTuple.description: The Sim who's thumbnail will be used.

TunableTuple.name: privacy
TunableTuple.description: Search an interaction's privacy liability to find violating Sims and randomly select one to display an icon of.

TunableTuple.name: resource_key
TunableTuple.description: The icon image to be displayed.

Tunable.name: key
Tunable.description: The icon image to be displayed.

TunableList.name: participant_type

ex. This will be useful for Earbuds where we want to hear the music only when the Sim is selected.

TunableList.description: A list of tokens that will be returned by this factory. Any string that uses this token will have token '0' be set to the first element, '1' to the second element, and so on. Do not let the list inheritance values confuse you; regardless of what the list element index is, the first element will always be 0, the second element 1, and so on.

TunableVariant.description: Define what the token at the specified index is.

TunableTuple.name: associated_club
TunableTuple.description: The token is a stored "associated_club" on this interaction. Only works with ClubMixerInteractions or ClubSuperInteractions.

TunableTuple.name: buck_amount
TunableTuple.description: The token is a number repesenting the amount of the specified buck type the specified participant has.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant from whom we will fetch the specified statistic's value.

TunableTuple.name: career_data
TunableTuple.description: The token is a localized string, number, or Sim, representing the specified career data for the specified participant.

TunableVariant.name: career_data
TunableVariant.description: The piece of data to fetch.

Tunable.name: career_type
Tunable.description: The career we care about.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant's whose career data we care about.

TunableTuple.name: civic_policy
TunableTuple.description: Tokens for the Civic Policy system.

TunableVariant.name: civic_policy_data
TunableVariant.description: The specific value to display.

TunableTuple.name: definition
TunableTuple.description: A catalog definition to use as a token. This is useful if you want to properly localize an object's name or description.

TunableTuple.name: game_component_data
TunableTuple.description: The token is a localized number or Sim representing the specified game component data from game component.

TunableVariant.name: game_component_data
TunableVariant.description: The piece of data to fetch.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant's from whom the game component data we want to fetch.

TunableTuple.name: global_policy
TunableTuple.description: The token used to display data from the tuned global policy.

Tunable.name: global_policy
Tunable.description: The global policy from which data is displayed.

TunableEnum.name: token_property
TunableEnum.description: Which property from the Global Policy Token to use. NAME will use the policy's display name, PROGRESS will use the progress made over the max progress value.

TunableTuple.name: lifestyle_brand
TunableTuple.description: The token used to display the name of a Lifestyle Brand owned by a Sim.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant who owns the lifestyle brand.

TunableTuple.name: money_amount
TunableTuple.description: The token is a number representing the amount of Simoleons that were awarded in loot to the specified participant.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant for whom we fetch the earned amount of money.

TunableTuple.name: object_marketplace
TunableTuple.description: Tokens for the object marketplace component and marketplace system.

TunableVariant.name: object_marketplace_data
TunableVariant.description: Please select what value you would like to use.

TunableTuple.name: object_property
TunableTuple.description: The token is a property of a game object. This could be catalog properties like its price or its rarity which is a property given by a component.

TunableEnum.name: obj_property
TunableEnum.description: The property of the object that we will request.

TunableTuple.name: participant_count
TunableTuple.description: The number of participants of the specified type.

TunableTuple.name: from_gardening
TunableTuple.description: The generated objects are those gardening objects that are within the specified distance from the tuned participant.

Tunable.name: distance
Tunable.description: The distance used to determine which objects are generated.

TunableVariant.name: object_type
TunableVariant.description: The type of gardening object to return.

TunableTuple.name: harvestables
TunableTuple.description: Return all harvestables, i.e. all fruits/flowers parented to plants.

TunableTuple.name: plants
TunableTuple.description: Return all plants.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The object used as a center point for distance calculations.

TunableTuple.name: from_participant
TunableTuple.description: Specify a participant type to generate objects based on this interaction.

TunableVariant.name: in_slot
TunableVariant.description: slots of the participant object from which the target objects should be pulled.

Tunable.name: by_name
Tunable.description: The exact name of a slot on the parent object in which the object should be.

Tunable.name: by_reference
Tunable.description: A particular slot type in which the object should be.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant determining which objects are to be generated.

TunableTuple.name: from_stored_object_component
TunableTuple.description: Return the stored object of the specified type from the stored object component of the specified participant.S

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant from which the stored object is returned.

TunableEnum.name: stored_object_type
TunableEnum.description: The type of object to apply loot actions to.

TunableTuple.name: participant_type
TunableTuple.description: The token is a Sim or object participant from the interaction.

TunableVariant.name: formatter
TunableVariant.description: Define the format for this token.

TunableTuple.name: bullet_list
TunableTuple.description: The token is a string, which is a formatted bullet point list. Objects are grouped by definition. The text for each item must be specified.

Tunable.name: bullet_text
Tunable.description: The text for the bullet entry. The string is provided the following tokens, in this order: 0 An object representitive of the group 1 The number of objects in the group

TunableTuple.name: single
TunableTuple.description: The token is a single object name. If multiple participants are returned, an arbitrary one is used. That is, unless the mismatch key is specified. In that case, the string is used unless all of the participants' definitions match.

TunableVariant.name: mismatch_name
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this is the object name to use when using a multi- object participant yielding definitions with different names.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: A localized string that may NOT require tokens.

TunableTuple.description: The generated objects are those gardening objects that are within the specified distance from the tuned participant.

Tunable.name: distance

TunableVariant.name: object_type
TunableVariant.description: The type of gardening object to return.

TunableTuple.name: plants
TunableTuple.description: Return all plants.

TunableEnum.name: stored_object_type
TunableEnum.description: The type of object to apply loot actions to.

TunableTuple.name: picked_part
TunableTuple.description: The token used to display the name of a picked part.

TunableTuple.name: scholarship_letter_component_data
TunableTuple.description: The token can be used to get strings representing scholarship information from the scholarship letter component of an object.

TunableEnum.description: The participant from whom to get the scholarship letter component data.

TunableVariant.name: scholarship_letter_component_data

TunableTuple.description: The token is the name of the sickness on the specified Sim.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant who is sick.

TunableTuple.name: statistic_value
TunableTuple.description: The token is a number representing the value of a specific statistic from the selected participant.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant from whom we will fetch the specified statistic's value.

Tunable.name: statistic
Tunable.description: The statistic's whose value we want to fetch.

TunableTuple.name: street
TunableTuple.description: Using the Street Selector tuning, provide a token localization appropriate street selection.

TunableVariant.name: street
TunableVariant.description: Select what street to test.

Tunable.name: literal
Tunable.description: Identify a specific Street.

TunableTuple.name: via_street_participant
TunableTuple.description: Get the street participant.

TunableVariant.name: via_zone_source
TunableVariant.description: Select the street to use by specifying a Zone Source.

TunableTuple.name: use_current_zone
TunableTuple.description: Get the active zone.

TunableTuple.name: use_participant_home_zone
TunableTuple.description: Get a participant's home zone. Can be None if they don't have one.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: Test against the participant's home zone. Townies' home zone will be None.

TunableTuple.name: use_pick_info
TunableTuple.description: Get the zone of the lot the user clicked on.

TunableTuple.name: use_picked_zone_ids
TunableTuple.description: Get the zone from the interaction's picked_zone_ids participant. Usually comes from a picker.

TunableVariant.name: street_data
TunableVariant.description: The piece of data to fetch.

TunableVariant.name: timeout_duration
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, override the timeout duration for this dialog in game time.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The time, in sim minutes, that this dialog should time out.

TunableVariant.name: title
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this dialog will include title text.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The dialog's title.

TunableList.name: ui_responses
TunableList.description: A list of buttons that are mapped to UI commands.

TunableTuple.description: A dialog response.

TunableVariant.name: response_command
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, specifies a command to be called by the client.

TunableVariant.name: enabled
TunableVariant.description: This may be tuned in place here using 'literal' or as a reference to a UIResponseCommand tuning snippet.

TunableTuple.name: literal
TunableTuple.description: A UI Response that sends a server command.

TunableList.name: arguments
TunableList.description: The arguments for this command. Arguments will be added after the command.

TunableVariant.description: An argument being passed to the command.

TunableTuple.name: boolean
TunableTuple.description: A boolean value.

TunableTuple.name: floating_point
TunableTuple.description: A floating point number.

TunableTuple.name: integer
TunableTuple.description: An integer number.

TunableTuple.name: participant_id
TunableTuple.description: UI Response argument that will resolve the participant specified.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant to resolve for this response argument. The value sent will be the id of the specified participant. If more than one participant is found, it will only send the id of the first participant found.

TunableTuple.name: special_command_data
TunableTuple.description: This will use the data passed into the show_dialog() function. This must be supported with GPE work, so only use this if you have talked to a GPE.

TunableTuple.name: string
TunableTuple.description: A string.

Tunable.name: command
Tunable.description: The command.

Tunable.name: reference
Tunable.description: A reference to a UIResponseCommand tuning snippet.

Tunable.name: text
Tunable.description: The prompt's text.

TunableEnum.name: ui_request
TunableEnum.description: This prompt's associated UI action.

TunableEnum.name: urgency
TunableEnum.description: Specify the notification's urgency.

TunableEnum.name: visual_type
TunableEnum.description: Specify the notification's visual treatment.

TunableEnum.name: owner_sim
TunableEnum.description: The participant Sim whose household should own the object. Leave this as Invalid to not assign ownership.

Tunable.name: require_claim
Tunable.description: If checked, the created object will be claimed, and will need to be reclaimed on load. If it isn't reclaimed on load, the object will be destroyed.

TunableVariant.name: reserve_object
TunableVariant.description: If this is enabled, the created object will be reserved for use by the set Sim.

Tunable.name: set_sim_as_owner
Tunable.description: If checked and owner_sim is set, the sim will also be set on the object ownership component and not just the household.

Tunable.name: set_to_invisible
Tunable.description: If checked, the created object will be set to invisible when the interaction ends.

Tunable.name: set_value_to_crafted_tooltip
Tunable.description: If checked, the value will be set to the tooltip if this item has a crafting component.

TunableVariant.name: spawn_vfx
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, play the one-shot VFX when the object is created in world.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description:
Distributable Primitive-like object (it supports the running/stop/write API) that represents a visual effect parented to a game object.
Call start() to start the effect and stop() to stop it.

Tunable.name: effect_name
Tunable.description: The name of the effect to play.

TunableVariant.name: joint_name
TunableVariant.description: Specify if the visual effect is attached to a slot and, if so, which slot.

Tunable.name: Slot
Tunable.description: The name of the slot this effect is attached to.

Tunable.name: play_immediate
Tunable.description:
If checked, this effect will be triggered immediately, nothing will block.
ex. VFX will be played immediately while the Sim is routing or animating.

TunableTuple.name: success_chance
TunableTuple.description: The percentage chance that this action will be applied.

Tunable.name: base_chance
Tunable.description: The basic chance of success.

TunableList.name: multipliers
TunableList.description: A list of multipliers to apply to base_chance.

Tunable.name: multiplier
Tunable.description: The multiplier to apply to base_chance if the associated tests pass.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A series of tests that must pass in order for multiplier to be applied.

TunableVariant.name: temporary_tags
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, these Tags are added to the created object and DO NOT persist.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: A set of temporary tags that are added to the created object. These tags DO NOT persist.

TunableEnum.description: A tag that is added to the created object. This tag DOES NOT persist.

TunableVariant.name: timing
TunableVariant.description: Determines the exact timing of the behavior, either at the beginning of an interaction, the end, or when an xevt occurs in an animation played as part of the interaction.

TunableTuple.name: at_beginning
TunableTuple.description: The behavior should occur at the very beginning of the interaction. It will not be tightly synchronized visually with animation. This isn't a very common use case and would most likely be used in an immediate interaction or to change hidden state that is used for bookkeeping rather than visual appearance.

TunableVariant.name: offset_time
TunableVariant.description:
If enabled, the interaction will wait this amount of time after the beginning before running the element.
Only use this if absolutely necessary. Better alternatives include using xevts, time based conditional action with loot ops, and using outcomes.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The interaction will wait this amount of time after the beginning before running the element

TunableTuple.name: at_end
TunableTuple.description: The behavior should occur at the end of the interaction. It will not be tightly synchronized visually with animation. An example might be an object that gets dirty every time a Sim uses it (so using a commodity change is overkill) but no precise synchronization with animation is desired, as might be the case with vomiting in the toilet.

TunableTuple.name: on_xevt
TunableTuple.description:
The behavior should occur synchronized visually with an xevt in an animation played as part of the interaction. If for some reason such an event doesn't occur, the behavior will occur at the end of the interaction unless supports failsafe is False.
This is by far the most common use case, as when a Sim flushes a toilet and the water level should change when the actual flush animation and effects fire.

Tunable.name: supports_failsafe
Tunable.description: If checked and the x-event does not fire, the basic extra will still run at the end of the interaction as a fail-safe.

Tunable.name: transient
Tunable.description: If checked, the created object will be destroyed when the interaction ends.

TunableTuple.name: create_photo_memory
TunableTuple.description: Creates a memory based on the data stored on the photo.

TunableEnum.name: memory_sim
TunableEnum.description: The participant Sim that is the Sim making the memory.

TunableEnum.name: photo_object
TunableEnum.description: The participant object that is the photo.

TunableTuple.description: The percentage chance that this action will be applied.

Tunable.name: base_chance
Tunable.description: The basic chance of success.

TunableList.name: multipliers
TunableList.description: A list of multipliers to apply to base_chance.

Tunable.name: multiplier
Tunable.description: The multiplier to apply to base_chance if the associated tests pass.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A series of tests that must pass in order for multiplier to be applied.

TunableTuple.name: create_sim
TunableTuple.description: Create one or more sims. Sims are instanced, placed into a specified household, and added to the skewer if necessary.

TunableVariant.name: household_option
TunableVariant.description: The household that the created sim should be put into.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant that will have their household used to put the sim into.

TunableList.name: pre_spawn_loot
TunableList.description: List of loot actions to apply to the created sim info before it is spawned.

TunableList.name: relationship_bits_to_add
TunableList.description: A list of relationship bits to add between the source sim and the created sim.

TunableVariant.name: set_genealogy
TunableVariant.description: Genealogy option to set on the created Sim. Example: Setting a child of a family.

TunableTuple.name: set_as_child
TunableTuple.description: Tunable action to set the created sim as the actor's child.

TunableVariant.name: set_summoning_purpose
TunableVariant.description: If enabled this will trigger the summon NPC situation depending on the summoning purpose type set. This should be tuned when we create Sims and don't add them into the active household.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: The purpose that is used to summon the sim to the lot. Defined in venue tuning.

TunableVariant.name: sim_info_source
TunableVariant.description: The source of the sim_info and position data for the sims to be created.

TunableTuple.name: clone_a_sim
TunableTuple.description: Tunable factory for specifying a sim to be cloned

Tunable.name: force_fgl
Tunable.description: Normally, FGL will only be invoked if no spawning position is found. Use this tunable to force FGL to run. e.g. Cloning spell uses caster Sim's position as a spawning position. In that case, we still want to force FGL so the clone spawns near that Sim rather than directly on top of the Sim.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant that is a sim that will be cloned Note: MUST be a sim. Use create object - clone object for non-sim objects.

TunableVariant.name: sim_spawn_slot
TunableVariant.description: The slot on the parent object where the sim should spawn. This may be either the exact name of a bone on the parent object or a slot type, in which case the first empty slot of the specified type will be used. If None is chosen, then the sim will at or near the interaction target's location.

TunableTuple.name: by_name
TunableTuple.description: Tunable factory for getting a slot by type

Tunable.name: slot_name
Tunable.description: The exact name of a slot on the parent object.

TunableTuple.name: by_type
TunableTuple.description: Tunable factory for getting a slot by type

Tunable.name: slot_type
Tunable.description: A particular slot type in which the should spawn.

TunableEnum.name: spawn_location_participant
TunableEnum.description:
The participant used for finding where to spawn the Sim. Typically you want to leave this as object.
Special cases include: - For self-interactions, Object will resolve to None. This can be set to Actor if you want to spawn near the Sim running the interaction.

TunableTuple.name: mass_object
TunableTuple.description: Tunable factory for mass resurrecting sims around a participant's position.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant of the interaction that will have sims resurrected around their position.

Tunable.name: radius
Tunable.description: The distance around a participant that will resurrect all of the dead sim objects.

TunableEnum.name: tag
TunableEnum.description: Tag the delineates an object that we want to resurrect sims from.

TunableTuple.description: Tunable factory for specifying a sim to be generated from a tuned sim filter.

Tunable.name: filter
Tunable.description: Sim filter that is used to create or find a Sim that matches this filter request.

If None is chosen, then the sim will at or near the interaction target's location.

Tunable.name: template

TunableTuple.name: targeted
TunableTuple.description: Tunable factory for resurrected from a single participant.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant of the interaction against whom any relationship and genealogy tunables are applied.

Tunable.name: resurrect
Tunable.description:
If checked, all Ghost traits are removed from the created Sim and its death type is cleared.
If unchecked, this is a simple spawn operation.

TunableEnum.name: sim_info_subject
TunableEnum.description: The subject from which the Sim Info used to create the new Sim should be fetched.

TunableVariant.name: spawn_action
TunableVariant.description: Define the methods to show the Sim after spawning on the lot. This defaults to fading the Sim in, but can be a specific interaction or an animation.

TunableTuple.name: affordance
TunableTuple.description: The Sim will run an interaction that will make it visible.

Tunable.name: spawn_affordance
Tunable.description: The affordance that is pushed on the Sim as soon as they are spawned on the lot.

Tunable.name: fallback_vehicle_def
Tunable.description: The definition of the vehicle to spawn if the sim doesn't have a favorite vehicle.

TunableEnum.name: vehicle_obj_tag
TunableEnum.description: The tag to use to look up if the sim has a favorite vehicle to use for the spawn action.

TunableTuple.name: at_beginning
TunableTuple.description: The behavior should occur at the very beginning of the interaction. It will not be tightly synchronized visually with animation. This isn't a very common use case and would most likely be used in an immediate interaction or to change hidden state that is used for bookkeeping rather than visual appearance.

TunableVariant.name: offset_time
TunableVariant.description:
If enabled, the interaction will wait this amount of time after the beginning before running the element.
Only use this if absolutely necessary. Better alternatives include using xevts, time based conditional action with loot ops, and using outcomes.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The interaction will wait this amount of time after the beginning before running the element

TunableTuple.name: at_end
TunableTuple.description: The behavior should occur at the end of the interaction. It will not be tightly synchronized visually with animation. An example might be an object that gets dirty every time a Sim uses it (so using a commodity change is overkill) but no precise synchronization with animation is desired, as might be the case with vomiting in the toilet.

TunableTuple.name: on_xevt
TunableTuple.description:
The behavior should occur synchronized visually with an xevt in an animation played as part of the interaction. If for some reason such an event doesn't occur, the behavior will occur at the end of the interaction unless supports failsafe is False.
This is by far the most common use case, as when a Sim flushes a toilet and the water level should change when the actual flush animation and effects fire.

Tunable.name: supports_failsafe
Tunable.description: If checked and the x-event does not fire, the basic extra will still run at the end of the interaction as a fail-safe.

TunableTuple.name: create_situation
TunableTuple.description: Start a situation, either via gameplay or via player-facing UI.

TunableVariant.name: create_situation
TunableVariant.description: Determine how to create a specific situation.

TunableTuple.name: situation_creation_ui
TunableTuple.description: Triggers the Situation Creation UI.

TunableVariant.name: situations_available
TunableVariant.description:
An optional list of situations to filter with. This way, we can pop up the plan an event flow, but restrict the situations that are available. They still have to test for availability, but we won't show others if one or more of these succeed.
If the list contains any situations, other situations will not show up if any in the list pass their tests. If the list is empty or this field is disabled, then any situations that pass their tests will be available.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: A list of Situations to restrict the Plan an Event flow.

Tunable.description: An available Situation in the Plan an Event flow.

TunableVariant.name: targeted_situation_participant
TunableVariant.description: Tuning to make this situation creature UI to use the targeted situation UI instead of the regular situation creation UI.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: The target participant for this Situation.

TunableTuple.name: situation_start
TunableTuple.description: Start a Situation as part of this Interaction.

TunableVariant.name: actor_init_job
TunableVariant.description: The Situation job actor would be assigned while join the situation.

Tunable.name: invite_actor
Tunable.description:
If checked, then the actor of this interaction will be invited in the default job. This is the common case.
If not checked, then the actor will not be invited. The Tell A Ghost Story interaction spawning a Ghost walkby is an example.
If your situation takes care of all the sims that should be in the default job itself (such as auto-invite) it will probably not work if this is checked.

Tunable.name: invite_household_sims_on_active_lot
Tunable.display: Invite Household Sims On Active Lot
Tunable.description:
If checked then all instanced sims on the active lot will be invited. This is not a common case. An example of this is leaving the hospital after having a baby, bringing both sims home.
If not checked, then no additional sims will be invited.
If your situation takes care of all the sims that should be in the default job itself (such as auto-invite) it will probably not work if this is checked.

TunableList.name: invite_participants
TunableList.description: The map to invite certain participants into the situation as specified job if assigned. Otherwise will invite them as situation's default job.

TunableVariant.name: invite_to_job
TunableVariant.description:
A list of situation jobs that can be specified. If a single job is specified then all Sims will be given that job. Otherwise we will loop through all of the Sims invited and give them jobs in list order. The list will begin to be repeated if we run out of jobs.
NOTE: We cannot guarantee the order of the Sims being passed in most of the time. Use this if you want a distribution of different jobs, but without a guarantee that Sims will be assigned to each one.

TunableList.name: specify_job
TunableList.description:
A list of situation jobs that can be specified. If a single job is specified then all Sims will be given that job. Otherwise we will loop through all of the Sims invited and give them jobs in list order. The list will begin to be repeated if we run out of jobs.
NOTE: We cannot guarantee the order of the Sims being passed in most of the time. Use this if you want a distribution of different jobs, but without a guarantee that Sims will be assigned to each one.

TunableEnum.name: participants_to_invite
TunableEnum.description: The participant of who will join the situation.

Tunable.name: invite_picked_sims
Tunable.description:
If checked then any picked sims of this interaction will be invited to the default job. This is the common case.
If not checked, then any picked sims will not be invited. The Tell A Ghost Story interaction spawning a Ghost walkby is an example.
If your situation takes care of all the sims that should be in the default job itself (such as auto-invite) it will probably not work if this is checked.

Tunable.name: invite_target_sim
Tunable.description:
If checked then the target sim of this interaction will be invited to the default job. This is the common case.
If not checked, then the target sim will not be invited. The Tell A Ghost Story interaction spawning a Ghost walkby is an example.
If your situation takes care of all the sims that should be in the default job itself (such as auto-invite) it will probably not work if this is checked.

TunableVariant.name: linked_sim_participant
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this situation will be linked to the specified Sim.

Tunable.name: situation
Tunable.description: The Situation to start when this Interaction runs.

TunableVariant.name: situation_default_target
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the participant of the interaction will be set as the situation target object.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: The participant that will be set as the situation's default target

TunableVariant.name: situation_guest_info
TunableVariant.description: By default, situation guest infos are created as an invite. This overrrides that behavior.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Situation Guest Info tuning. Consult a GPE if you're at all unsure what any of this does.

TunableEnum.name: bouncer_request_priority
TunableEnum.description: Bouncer Request Priority. Requests with higher priority will be filled first. Conversely, lower priority requests will be pushed out first upon hitting the sim cap.

TunableEnum.name: request_spawning_option
TunableEnum.description: Spawning Option. MUST_SPAWN: Choose from uninstantiated Sims. CANNOT_SPAWN: Choose from instantiated Sims. DONT_CARE: Choose from all Sims.

TunableVariant.name: target_init_job
TunableVariant.description: The Situation job target would be assigned while join the situation.

Tunable.name: user_facing
Tunable.description:
If checked, then the situation will be user facing (have goals, and scoring).
If not checked, then situation will not be user facing.
This setting does not override the user option to make all situations non-scoring.
Example: Date -> Checked Invite To -> Not Checked

TunableTuple.name: success_chance
TunableTuple.description: The percentage chance that this action will be applied.

Tunable.name: base_chance
Tunable.description: The basic chance of success.

TunableList.name: multipliers
TunableList.description: A list of multipliers to apply to base_chance.

Tunable.name: multiplier
Tunable.description: The multiplier to apply to base_chance if the associated tests pass.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A series of tests that must pass in order for multiplier to be applied.

TunableTuple.name: destroy_object
TunableTuple.description: Destroy one or more objects and optionally award the total current value among one or more Sims.

TunableVariant.name: award_value
TunableVariant.description: If necessary, define how an amount corresponding to the objects' value is distributed among Sims.

Tunable.name: multiplier
Tunable.description: Value multiplier for the award.

TunableEnum.name: recipients
TunableEnum.description: Who to award funds to. If more than one participant is specified, the value will be evenly divided among the recipients.

TunableTuple.name: tested_multipliers
TunableTuple.description: Each multiplier that passes its test set will be applied to each award payment.

Tunable.name: base_value
Tunable.description: The basic value to return if no modifications are applied.

TunableList.name: multipliers
TunableList.description: A list of multipliers to apply to base_value.

Tunable.name: multiplier
Tunable.description: The multiplier to apply to base_value if the associated tests pass.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A series of tests that must pass in order for multiplier to be applied.

Tunable.name: check_self_or_parts_in_use
Tunable.display: Check Self Or Parts In Use
Tunable.description: If unchecked, the destruction element checks if an object is in use by the Sim that is performing this interaction. If checked, check if the object or any of its parts are in use by anything. This should only be used after checking with a GPE, as it is intended for when objects are being reserved outside of tuning, such as by a situation.

TunableVariant.name: fade_duration
TunableVariant.description: The number of sim minutes it should take for objects to fade out when getting destroyed.

Tunable.name: use_custom_fade_duration
Tunable.description: The number of sim minutes it should take for objects to fade out when getting destroyed.

TunableVariant.name: objects_to_destroy
TunableVariant.description: The objects to destroy.

TunableTuple.name: from_gardening
TunableTuple.description: The generated objects are those gardening objects that are within the specified distance from the tuned participant.

Tunable.name: distance
Tunable.description: The distance used to determine which objects are generated.

TunableVariant.name: object_type
TunableVariant.description: The type of gardening object to return.

TunableTuple.name: harvestables
TunableTuple.description: Return all harvestables, i.e. all fruits/flowers parented to plants.

TunableTuple.name: plants
TunableTuple.description: Return all plants.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The object used as a center point for distance calculations.

TunableTuple.name: from_participant
TunableTuple.description: Specify a participant type to generate objects based on this interaction.

TunableVariant.name: in_slot
TunableVariant.description: slots of the participant object from which the target objects should be pulled.

Tunable.name: by_name
Tunable.description: The exact name of a slot on the parent object in which the object should be.

Tunable.name: by_reference
Tunable.description: A particular slot type in which the object should be.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant determining which objects are to be generated.

TunableTuple.name: from_stored_object_component
TunableTuple.description: Return the stored object of the specified type from the stored object component of the specified participant.S

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant from which the stored object is returned.

TunableEnum.name: stored_object_type
TunableEnum.description: The type of object to apply loot actions to.

TunableTuple.name: success_chance
TunableTuple.description: The percentage chance that this action will be applied.

Tunable.name: base_chance
Tunable.description: The basic chance of success.

TunableList.name: multipliers
TunableList.description: A list of multipliers to apply to base_chance.

Tunable.name: multiplier
Tunable.description: The multiplier to apply to base_chance if the associated tests pass.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A series of tests that must pass in order for multiplier to be applied.

TunableVariant.name: tag_restriction
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, only objects that have the tag inside this tuned set will get destroyed. Disable means all objects found as the participant will get destroyed.

TunableList.name: add_restriction
TunableList.description: Tags for the objects to delete.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: Tests that each object to destroy must pass in order for it to actually be destroyed.

TunableTuple.name: notification
TunableTuple.description: Show a notification to a Sim's player.

Tunable.name: allow_autonomous
Tunable.description: If checked, then this notification will be displayed even if its owning interaction was initiated by autonomy. If unchecked, then the notification is suppressed if the interaction is autonomous.

TunableVariant.name: single
TunableVariant.description: This may be tuned in place here using 'literal' or as a reference to a Notification tuning snippet.

TunableTuple.name: literal
TunableTuple.description: A dialog that is displayed as a notification.

TunableVariant.name: additional_texts
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, add additional text to the dialog

Tunable.description: A localized string that may use tokens.

Tunable.name: anonymous_target_sim
Tunable.description: If this dialog is using a target sim id to give a conversation type view and this is checked, then the target sim icon will instead be replaced by an anonymous caller.

TunableVariant.name: audio_sting
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, play an audio sting when the dialog is shown.

Tunable.name: audio
Tunable.description: The sound to play.

Tunable.name: immediate_audio
Tunable.description:
If checked, this audio will be triggered immediately, nothing will block.
ex. Earbuds audio will be played immediately while the Sim is routing or animating.

TunableVariant.name: joint_name_hash
TunableVariant.description: Specify if the audio is attached to a slot and, if so, which slot. Otherwise the audio will be attached to the object's origin.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The name of the slot this audio is attached to.

Tunable.name: play_on_active_sim_only
Tunable.description:
If enabled, and audio target is Sim, the audio will only be played on selected Sim. Otherwise it will be played regardless Sim is selected or not.
If audio target is Object, always set this to False. Otherwise the audio will never be played.
ex. This will be useful for Earbuds where we want to hear the music only when the Sim is selected.

TunableVariant.name: background_audio
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, play background audio while the dialog is open.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The background audio event string.

TunableEnum.name: dialog_bg_style
TunableEnum.description: The style background to apply to this dialog.

TunableList.name: dialog_options
TunableList.description: Options to apply to the dialog.

TunableEnum.name: dialog_style
TunableEnum.description: The style layout to apply to this dialog.

TunableEnum.name: expand_behavior
TunableEnum.description: Specify the notification's expand behavior.

TunableVariant.name: icon
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, specify an icon to be displayed.

TunableList.name: participant_type
TunableList.description: The Participant who owns the lifestyle brand we want to use.

TunableTuple.name: participant
TunableTuple.description: The Sim who's thumbnail will be used.

TunableTuple.name: privacy
TunableTuple.description: Search an interaction's privacy liability to find violating Sims and randomly select one to display an icon of.

TunableTuple.name: resource_key
TunableTuple.description: The icon image to be displayed.

Tunable.name: key
Tunable.description: The icon image to be displayed.

TunableList.name: participant_type
TunableList.description: We use this participant's holiday tracker to get the icon.

TunableVariant.name: icon_override_participant

ex. This will be useful for Earbuds where we want to hear the music only when the Sim is selected.

TunableList.description: A list of tokens that will be returned by this factory. Any string that uses this token will have token '0' be set to the first element, '1' to the second element, and so on. Do not let the list inheritance values confuse you; regardless of what the list element index is, the first element will always be 0, the second element 1, and so on.

TunableVariant.description: Define what the token at the specified index is.

TunableTuple.name: associated_club
TunableTuple.description: The token is a stored "associated_club" on this interaction. Only works with ClubMixerInteractions or ClubSuperInteractions.

TunableTuple.name: buck_amount
TunableTuple.description: The token is a number repesenting the amount of the specified buck type the specified participant has.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant from whom we will fetch the specified statistic's value.

Tunable.description: The career we care about.

TunableEnum.name: participant

TunableEnum.description: Which property from the Global Policy Token to use. NAME will use the policy's display name, PROGRESS will use the progress made over the max progress value.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description:
A list of tests groups. At least one must pass all its sub- tests to pass the TestSet.
ORs of ANDs

Tunable.name: limit_to_one_notification
Tunable.description: If checked, this notification will only be displayed for the first recipient subject. This is useful to prevent duplicates of the notification from showing up when sending a notification to LotOnwers or other Participant Types that have multiple Sims.

TunableEnum.name: recipient_subject
TunableEnum.description: The Sim's whose player will be the recipient of this notification.

TunableTuple.name: success_chance
TunableTuple.description: The percentage chance that this action will be applied.

Tunable.name: base_chance
Tunable.description: The basic chance of success.

TunableList.name: multipliers
TunableList.description: A list of multipliers to apply to base_chance.

Tunable.name: multiplier
Tunable.description: The multiplier to apply to base_chance if the associated tests pass.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A series of tests that must pass in order for multiplier to be applied.

TunableVariant.name: timing
TunableVariant.description: Determines the exact timing of the behavior, either at the beginning of an interaction, the end, or when an xevt occurs in an animation played as part of the interaction.

TunableTuple.name: at_beginning
TunableTuple.description: The behavior should occur at the very beginning of the interaction. It will not be tightly synchronized visually with animation. This isn't a very common use case and would most likely be used in an immediate interaction or to change hidden state that is used for bookkeeping rather than visual appearance.

TunableVariant.name: offset_time
TunableVariant.description:
If enabled, the interaction will wait this amount of time after the beginning before running the element.
Only use this if absolutely necessary. Better alternatives include using xevts, time based conditional action with loot ops, and using outcomes.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The interaction will wait this amount of time after the beginning before running the element

TunableTuple.name: at_end
TunableTuple.description: The behavior should occur at the end of the interaction. It will not be tightly synchronized visually with animation. An example might be an object that gets dirty every time a Sim uses it (so using a commodity change is overkill) but no precise synchronization with animation is desired, as might be the case with vomiting in the toilet.

TunableTuple.name: on_xevt
TunableTuple.description:
The behavior should occur synchronized visually with an xevt in an animation played as part of the interaction. If for some reason such an event doesn't occur, the behavior will occur at the end of the interaction unless supports failsafe is False.
This is by far the most common use case, as when a Sim flushes a toilet and the water level should change when the actual flush animation and effects fire.

Tunable.name: supports_failsafe
Tunable.description: If checked and the x-event does not fire, the basic extra will still run at the end of the interaction as a fail-safe.

TunableTuple.name: payment
TunableTuple.description:
Remove any funds this interaction has reserved, either when an appropriate xevt has been triggered, or on interaction complete.
To reserve payment and trigger it at the end of all the continuations of an interaction instead use a payment liability.

Tunable.name: display_only
Tunable.description: A PaymentElement marked as display_only will affect an affordance's display name (by appending the Simoleon cost in parentheses), but will not deduct funds when run.

Tunable.name: include_in_total
Tunable.description:
This should normally be set, but in cases where multiple payment elements are tuned in separate outcomes, they will be all be summed up to tally up the total cost of the interaction.
In those cases, only set this to True for the 'definitive' cost.

TunableTuple.name: insufficient_funds_behavior
TunableTuple.description: The behavior to define if we can succeed the payment if the household doesn't have enough money.

Tunable.name: allow_payment_succeed
Tunable.description: If True, the payment element will still return True if there is not enough fund. Otherwise return False.

TunableVariant.name: notification
TunableVariant.description: The notification about what the game will do if household doesn't have enough fund.

TunableVariant.name: enabled
TunableVariant.description: This may be tuned in place here using 'literal' or as a reference to a Notification tuning snippet.

TunableTuple.name: literal
TunableTuple.description: A dialog that is displayed as a notification.

TunableVariant.name: additional_texts
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, add additional text to the dialog

Tunable.description: A localized string that may use tokens.

Tunable.name: anonymous_target_sim
Tunable.description: If this dialog is using a target sim id to give a conversation type view and this is checked, then the target sim icon will instead be replaced by an anonymous caller.

TunableVariant.name: audio_sting
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, play an audio sting when the dialog is shown.

Tunable.name: audio
Tunable.description: The sound to play.

Tunable.name: immediate_audio
Tunable.description:
If checked, this audio will be triggered immediately, nothing will block.
ex. Earbuds audio will be played immediately while the Sim is routing or animating.

TunableVariant.name: joint_name_hash
TunableVariant.description: Specify if the audio is attached to a slot and, if so, which slot. Otherwise the audio will be attached to the object's origin.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The name of the slot this audio is attached to.

Tunable.name: play_on_active_sim_only
Tunable.description:
If enabled, and audio target is Sim, the audio will only be played on selected Sim. Otherwise it will be played regardless Sim is selected or not.
If audio target is Object, always set this to False. Otherwise the audio will never be played.
ex. This will be useful for Earbuds where we want to hear the music only when the Sim is selected.

TunableVariant.name: background_audio
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, play background audio while the dialog is open.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The background audio event string.

TunableTuple.name: lifestyle_brand
TunableTuple.description: The token used to display the name of a Lifestyle Brand owned by a Sim.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant who owns the lifestyle brand.

TunableTuple.name: money_amount
TunableTuple.description: The token is a number representing the amount of Simoleons that were awarded in loot to the specified participant.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant for whom we fetch the earned amount of money.

TunableTuple.name: object_marketplace
TunableTuple.description: Tokens for the object marketplace component and marketplace system.

TunableVariant.name: object_marketplace_data
TunableVariant.description: Please select what value you would like to use.

TunableTuple.name: object_property
TunableTuple.description: The token is a property of a game object. This could be catalog properties like its price or its rarity which is a property given by a component.

TunableEnum.name: obj_property
TunableEnum.description: The property of the object that we will request.

TunableTuple.name: participant_count
TunableTuple.description: The number of participants of the specified type.

TunableTuple.name: from_gardening
TunableTuple.description: The generated objects are those gardening objects that are within the specified distance from the tuned participant.

Tunable.name: distance
Tunable.description: The distance used to determine which objects are generated.

TunableVariant.name: object_type
TunableVariant.description: The type of gardening object to return.

TunableTuple.name: harvestables
TunableTuple.description: Return all harvestables, i.e. all fruits/flowers parented to plants.

TunableTuple.name: plants
TunableTuple.description: Return all plants.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The object used as a center point for distance calculations.

TunableTuple.name: from_participant
TunableTuple.description: Specify a participant type to generate objects based on this interaction.

TunableVariant.name: in_slot
TunableVariant.description: slots of the participant object from which the target objects should be pulled.

Tunable.name: by_name
Tunable.description: The exact name of a slot on the parent object in which the object should be.

Tunable.name: by_reference
Tunable.description: A particular slot type in which the object should be.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant determining which objects are to be generated.

TunableTuple.name: from_stored_object_component
TunableTuple.description: Return the stored object of the specified type from the stored object component of the specified participant.S

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant from which the stored object is returned.

TunableEnum.name: stored_object_type
TunableEnum.description: The type of object to apply loot actions to.

TunableTuple.name: participant_type
TunableTuple.description: The token is a Sim or object participant from the interaction.

TunableVariant.name: formatter
TunableVariant.description: Define the format for this token.

TunableTuple.name: bullet_list
TunableTuple.description: The token is a string, which is a formatted bullet point list. Objects are grouped by definition. The text for each item must be specified.

Tunable.name: bullet_text
Tunable.description: The text for the bullet entry. The string is provided the following tokens, in this order: 0 An object representitive of the group 1 The number of objects in the group

TunableTuple.name: single
TunableTuple.description: The token is a single object name. If multiple participants are returned, an arbitrary one is used. That is, unless the mismatch key is specified. In that case, the string is used unless all of the participants' definitions match.

TunableVariant.name: mismatch_name
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this is the object name to use when using a multi- object participant yielding definitions with different names.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: A localized string that may NOT require tokens.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant who is sick.

TunableTuple.name: statistic_value
TunableTuple.description: The token is a number representing the value of a specific statistic from the selected participant.

TunableTuple.name: street

TunableVariant.description: Select what street to test.

Tunable.name: literal
Tunable.description: Identify a specific Street.

TunableTuple.name: via_street_participant
TunableTuple.description: Get the street participant.

TunableVariant.name: via_zone_source
TunableVariant.description: Select the street to use by specifying a Zone Source.

TunableTuple.name: use_current_zone
TunableTuple.description: Get the active zone.

TunableTuple.name: use_participant_home_zone
TunableTuple.description: Get a participant's home zone. Can be None if they don't have one.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: Test against the participant's home zone. Townies' home zone will be None.

TunableTuple.name: use_pick_info
TunableTuple.description: Get the zone of the lot the user clicked on.

TunableTuple.name: use_picked_zone_ids
TunableTuple.description: Get the zone from the interaction's picked_zone_ids participant. Usually comes from a picker.

TunableVariant.name: street_data
TunableVariant.description: The piece of data to fetch.

TunableVariant.name: timeout_duration
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, override the timeout duration for this dialog in game time.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The time, in sim minutes, that this dialog should time out.

TunableVariant.name: title
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this dialog will include title text.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The dialog's title.

TunableList.name: ui_responses
TunableList.description: A list of buttons that are mapped to UI commands.

TunableTuple.description: A dialog response.

TunableVariant.name: response_command
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, specifies a command to be called by the client.

TunableVariant.name: enabled
TunableVariant.description: This may be tuned in place here using 'literal' or as a reference to a UIResponseCommand tuning snippet.

TunableTuple.name: literal
TunableTuple.description: A UI Response that sends a server command.

TunableList.name: arguments

TunableTuple.description: A floating point number.

TunableTuple.description: An integer number.

TunableTuple.name: participant_id
TunableTuple.description: UI Response argument that will resolve the participant specified.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant to resolve for this response argument. The value sent will be the id of the specified participant. If more than one participant is found, it will only send the id of the first participant found.

TunableTuple.name: special_command_data
TunableTuple.description: This will use the data passed into the show_dialog() function. This must be supported with GPE work, so only use this if you have talked to a GPE.

TunableTuple.name: string
TunableTuple.description: A string.

Tunable.name: command
Tunable.description: The command.

Tunable.name: reference
Tunable.description: A reference to a UIResponseCommand tuning snippet.

Tunable.name: text
Tunable.description: The prompt's text.

TunableEnum.name: ui_request
TunableEnum.description: This prompt's associated UI action.

TunableEnum.name: urgency
TunableEnum.description: Specify the notification's urgency.

TunableEnum.name: visual_type
TunableEnum.description: Specify the notification's visual treatment.

Tunable.name: reference
Tunable.description: A reference to a Notification tuning snippet.

TunableVariant.name: payment
TunableVariant.description: This may be tuned in place here using 'literal' or as a reference to a Payment tuning snippet.

TunableTuple.name: literal
TunableTuple.description: A payment, which consists of a source, destination, and associated costs.

TunableTuple.name: cost_modifiers
TunableTuple.description: A tunable list of test sets and associated multipliers to apply to the total cost of this payment.

Tunable.name: base_value
Tunable.description: The basic value to return if no modifications are applied.

TunableList.name: multipliers
TunableList.description: A list of multipliers to apply to base_value.

Tunable.name: multiplier
Tunable.description: The multiplier to apply to base_value if the associated tests pass.

ex. This will be useful for Earbuds where we want to hear the music only when the Sim is selected.

TunableVariant.name: success_continuation
TunableVariant.description: If tuned to an interaction, we will push that interaction as a continuation if we receive a valid dialog response. Additionally, we will attach a payment liability to that interaction so that the payment can be resolved on the sequence of that interaction or on a later continuation. The payment liability will store the entered value and tuned destination, but will not respect all other tuned options.To trigger that payment, add a payment basic extra to that interaction and select the "Liability" payment cost.

TunableTuple.name: utility
TunableTuple.description:
Cash out the current amount of utilities consumed/produced. If production is net positive, the household earns money. If the production is net negative, the household pays money. Payments respect if the excess production is currently being retained, so no money can be earned.
If there is an outstanding bill, the amount already assigned to the bill will be deducted from that available, so the unpaid bill is not changed.

TunableVariant.name: override_keep_excess_production
TunableVariant.description: If enabled then ignore the results of the Keep Excess Production test that would normally be used to compute the amount of the utility available for payout.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Use this value and ignore the results of the Keep Excess Production test that would normally be used to compute the amount of the utility available for payout.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant for whom we need to pay bills.

TunableEnum.name: utility
TunableEnum.description: The household utility we want to modify.

TunableVariant.description: The source of the funds.
