TunableTuple.name: object_connectivity
TunableTuple.description: A test that returns True if the given object can reach the target object/joint using a point-to-point connectivity test. Note that this could have a performance impact if called too frequently so please use sparingly.

TunableEnum.name: from_object
TunableEnum.description: First object to use for the connectivity test. Routing context will be based on this object.

TunableEnum.name: to_object
TunableEnum.description: Second (target) object to use for the connectivity test.

TunableVariant.name: to_object_joint
TunableVariant.description: Optionally specify a joint on the target object to test connectivity against.

Tunable.name: Specify_Joint
Tunable.description: The name of the joint to test.

TunableTuple.name: object_criteria
TunableTuple.description: A test to look at all the objects and compare them to the tuned criteria.

Tunable.name: completed
Tunable.description: If checked, any craftable object (such as a painting) must be finished for it to be considered.

TunableVariant.name: desired_state_threshold
TunableVariant.description: A state threshold that the object must satisfy for this test to pass

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: A state threshold that the object must satisfy for this test to pass

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

TunableVariant.name: identity_test
TunableVariant.description: Which test to run on the object in order to determine if it matches or not.

Tunable.name: actual_object
Tunable.description: The object we want to test ownership of

TunableEnum.description: What tag to test for.

TunableEnum.name: test_type
TunableEnum.description: How to test the tags in the tag set against the objects on the lot.

Tunable.name: on_active_lot
Tunable.description: If checked, test whether or not the object is on the active lot. If unchecked the object can be either on the active lot or in the open streets area, we don't really care.

Tunable.name: owned
Tunable.description: If checked will test if the object is owned by the active household. If unchecked it doesn't matter who owns the object or if it is owned at all.

TunableVariant.name: positional_relationship_test
TunableVariant.description: The type of positional relationship test to run on the object with respect to another object.

TunableTuple.name: radius_test
TunableTuple.description: The object must be within a certain radius of a tuned participant in order for the test to pass.

Tunable.name: radius
Tunable.description: The radius, with the radius actor's position, that defines the area within which the object is valid.

TunableEnum.name: radius_actor
TunableEnum.description: The actor whose position, with the radius, defines the area within which the object is valid.

TunableTuple.name: tagged_object_on_same_level_test
TunableTuple.display: Tagged Object On Same Level Test
TunableTuple.description: The object must has at least one object with a tuned tag on the same level as a tuned participant in order for the test to pass.

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: The participant to test against.

TunableEnum.name: tag
TunableEnum.description: A single tag to find an object matching to test against the participant.

TunableVariant.name: sim_ownership
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, test whether or not the object is owned by the active Sim. If checked, test will pass if the Sim owns the object.

TunableTuple.name: quantity
TunableTuple.description: The number of objects that meet the tuned critera needed to pass this test. quantity is run after a list of matching objects is created using the tuned criteria.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The value of a threshold.

TunableVariant.name: total_value
TunableVariant.description: If set, the total monetary value of all the objects that meet the tuned criteria needed in order to pass this test. total_value is run after a list of matching objects is created using the tuned criteria.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: If set, the total monetary value of all the objects that meet the tuned criteria needed in order to pass this test. total_value is run after a list of matching objects is created using the tuned criteria.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The value of a threshold.

TunableEnum.name: target
TunableEnum.description: If set this test will loop through the specified participants and run the object identity and criteria tests on them instead of all of the objects on the lot.

TunableList.name: test_events
TunableList.description:
The list of events that trigger this instance of the tuned test on.
If you pick ObjectStateChange, the test will be registered with EventManager for every ObjectStateValue managed by ObjectState controlling the desired_state_threshold. E.g. if the test cares about BrokenState_Broken, we will register tolisten for events for state changes of BrokenState_Broken, BrokenState_Unbroken, BrokenState_Repairing, etc.

Tunable.name: use_depreciated_values
Tunable.description: If checked, the value consideration for each checked object will at its depreciated amount. This affects the "All Objects" test type, changing the total value considered to be at the non-depreciated amount.

TunableVariant.name: value
TunableVariant.description: A threshold test for the monetary value of a single object in order for it to be considered.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: Value/comparison pair used to define a Threshold.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The value of a threshold.

TunableTuple.name: object_definition_criteria
TunableTuple.description: A test to look at all the tuned participant object definitions and compare them to the tuned criteria.

TunableVariant.name: identity_test
TunableVariant.description: Which test to run on the object definitions in order to determine if it matches or not. Ex: In the case of Object Ingredients all ingredients should match in the test to pass.

Tunable.name: actual_object
Tunable.description: The object we want to test ownership of

TunableEnum.description: What tag to test for.

TunableEnum.name: test_type
TunableEnum.description: How to test the tags in the tag set against the objects on the lot.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The specified participant to run the object identity and criteria tests on.

TunableTuple.name: object_environment_score
TunableTuple.description: Test the object's environment score for a particular mood againts a threshold.

TunableVariant.name: environment_score_type
TunableVariant.description: The type of environment score to test against. This can be mood based, positive scoring, or negative scoring.

TunableTuple.name: mood_scoring
TunableTuple.description: Test for a particular mood's environment score on the object.

Tunable.name: mood_to_check
Tunable.description: The mood to check the participant's environment scoring.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: The threshold for this mood's scoring to pass.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The value of a threshold.

TunableTuple.name: negative_scoring
TunableTuple.description: Test for the object's negative environment scoring.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: The threshold for positive scoring to pass.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The value of a threshold.

TunableTuple.name: positive_scoring
TunableTuple.description: Test for the object's positive environment scoring.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: The threshold for negative scoring to pass.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The value of a threshold.

Tunable.name: ignore_emotional_aura
Tunable.description: Whether or not this test cares if Emotional Aura is Enabled/Disabled. If this is checked and the emotional aura is disabled (EmotionEnvironment_Disabled is on the object), then there will be no mood scoring and the test will fail if checking moods. If unchecked, any mood scoring will always affect this test.

TunableEnum.name: object_to_test
TunableEnum.description: The object particiant we want to check the environment score of.

TunableVariant.name: sim_participant
TunableVariant.description: An Optional Sim to test Environment Score against. If disabled, the Environment Score will not take into acount any Trait modifiers relative to the Sim. If enabled, Trait modifiers will be taken into account.

TunableTuple.name: object_has_no_children
TunableTuple.description: A tunable test that checks to see if a specific object has any objects slotted on it or not.

Tunable.name: check_part_owner
Tunable.description: If enabled and target of tests is a part, the test will be run on the part owner instead.

Tunable.name: consider_bb_only_children
Tunable.description:
If this is true then objects that are BB_ONLY children will count for the purposes of this test.
Example: The campfire is allowed to have chairs slotted into it that are BB_ONLY children. If this is not true then this test will fail.

TunableEnum.name: targets
TunableEnum.description: Who or what to apply this test to.

TunableTuple.name: object_ownership
TunableTuple.description: A test that passes or fails based on object ownership.

Tunable.name: consider_renter_as_household_owner
Tunable.description:
If checked, unowned objects are considered owned by the renter of the current lot. If unchecked, the objects remain as considered unowned.
If this is checked, Test Household Owner must be checked, as this option operates at the household level and not on a Sim level.

TunableVariant.name: creator
TunableVariant.description:
If disabled, the test disregards who created the object.
If this is enabled, Test Household Owner must be unchecked, as crafters are on a per-Sim basis and not a per-household basis.

Tunable.name: check_creator
Tunable.description:
Test whether or not the specified Sim is the creator of the object.
If checked, pass if Sim is creator. If unchecked, fail if Sim is creator.

Tunable.name: is_not_owner
Tunable.description: If checked, the test will only pass if the Sim does not own the object.

Tunable.name: is_owner
Tunable.description: If checked, the test will only pass if the Sim owns the object.

Tunable.name: must_be_owned
Tunable.description:
If checked, the test will only pass if someone owns this object. If unchecked, the test will only pass if nobody owns this object.
This tunable is only considered if Is Owner and Is Not Owner are not checked.

TunableEnum.name: sim
TunableEnum.description: Presumed Owner.

Tunable.name: test_household_owner
Tunable.description: If checked, the test considers a Sim as owning the object if the Sim's household owns it. If unchecked, the Sim must individually own the object. That is, the object must have an Ownable Component and the Sim is set as the owner.

TunableEnum.name: test_object
TunableEnum.description: Object to test ownership of.

TunableTuple.name: object_pair_id_chance
TunableTuple.description: A tunable test which tests based on object IDs and a tuned percent chance. This means that given two object ids, the test result will always be the same.

TunableEnum.name: actor
TunableEnum.description: Who or what to apply this test to

TunableEnum.name: target
TunableEnum.description: Who or what to use for the comparison

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: The comparison to perform against the value. The test passes if the sum of two ids modded 100 passes the comparison.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The value of a threshold.

TunableTuple.name: object_purchase_test
TunableTuple.description: Test the value of a purchased object against tuned requirements.

TunableVariant.name: test_type
TunableVariant.description: The object we want to test for.

Tunable.name: actual_object
Tunable.description: The object we want to test ownership of

TunableEnum.description: What tag to test for.

TunableEnum.name: test_type
TunableEnum.description: How to test the tags in the tag set against the objects on the lot.

Tunable.name: use_depreciated_value
Tunable.description: If checked, the value consideration for purchased object will at its depreciated amount.

TunableTuple.name: value_threshold
TunableTuple.description: The condition the object's value (in Simoleons) is required to satisfy in order for the test to pass.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The value of a threshold.

TunableTuple.name: object_relationship
TunableTuple.description: Test relationships between a specific Sim and a specific object. The target object(s) must have an ObjectRelationshipComponent attached to them for this test to be valid.

TunableVariant.name: can_add_relationship
TunableVariant.description: If checked, this object must be able to add a new relationship. If unchecked, this object must not be able to add any more relationships.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: If checked, this object must be able to add a new relationship. If unchecked, this object must not be able to add any more relationships.

TunableVariant.name: relationship_status
TunableVariant.description:
Whether the object cannot have a relationship with the sim, or the sim and object's relationship value is within a tuned range.
For test on relationship range: If a sim does not have a relationship with the object and use_default_value_if_no_relationship is checked, the relationship value used will be the initial value of the relationship statistic used to track relationships on the object. If sim doesn't have a relationship and use_default_value_if_no_relationship is NOT checked, the test will fail (so you can use that to check if a relationship exists).

Tunable.name: use_default_value_if_no_relationship
Tunable.display: Use Default Value If No Relationship
Tunable.description: If checked, the initial value of the relationship stat will be used if the sim and object do not already have a relationship. If unchecked, the test will fail if the sim and object don't have a relationship.

TunableTuple.name: value_interval
TunableTuple.description: A tunable interval between lower_bound and upper_bound.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

TunableEnum.name: sims
TunableEnum.description: The Sim(s) to test.

TunableEnum.name: targets
TunableEnum.description: The object(s) to test.

TunableTuple.name: object_routable_surface
TunableTuple.description: A test that checks if a Sim is routing on an object and what object they are routing on.

TunableVariant.name: identity_test
TunableVariant.description: Which test to run on the object in order to determine if it matches or not.

Tunable.name: actual_object
Tunable.description: The object we want to test ownership of

TunableEnum.description: What tag to test for.

TunableEnum.name: test_type
TunableEnum.description: How to test the tags in the tag set against the objects on the lot.

TunableEnum.name: sims
TunableEnum.description: The Sim we are going to check being on an object.

TunableTuple.name: object_spawn_firemeter
TunableTuple.description: A test that checks if the amount of objects with a tag is below the Global Spawn Firemeter limit.

TunableEnum.name: tag_to_test
TunableEnum.description: The tag we want to test against. If the amount of objects with this tag is below the Global Spawn Firemeter limit, the test will pass.

TunableTuple.name: object_type_relationship
TunableTuple.description:
Gate availability by a relationship status.
Note: This is different than the instance-based Object Relationship Component and applies only to the relationships of Object Based Tracks tuned under relationship tracker module tuning.
If object rel does not exist, the test will treat the rel_track value with an assumed value of 0 with no rel-bits.

TunableList.name: match_all
TunableList.description: All of these relationship bits must match to fail the test.

TunableList.name: match_any
TunableList.description: If any of these relationship bits match the test will fail.

TunableTuple.name: relationship_score_interval
TunableTuple.description: The range that the relationship score must be within in order for this test to pass.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

TunableList.name: match_all
TunableList.description: All of these relationship bits must be present to pass the test.

TunableList.name: match_any
TunableList.description: Any of these relationship bits will pass the test.

TunableList.name: subject
TunableList.description: Owner(s) of the relationship(s).

TunableVariant.name: target_type
TunableVariant.description: The type of target we want to test the relationship on. This will either be a tag set (in the case where we want to test rel on uninstantiated objects) or an object.

TunableList.name: object
TunableList.description: Target Object of the relationship.

Tunable.name: tag_set
Tunable.description: Tag set that defines the target objects of the relationship.

TunableEnum.name: test_event
TunableEnum.description: The event that we want to trigger this instance of the tuned test on.

Tunable.name: track
Tunable.description: The object relationship track on which to check for bits and threshold values.

TunableTuple.name: occult_form_availability
TunableTuple.description: A test that checks a specific participant to see if they can enter a specific occult form.

Tunable.name: negate
Tunable.description: If checked, negate the outcome such that if it would pass it will now fail and vice-versa.

TunableEnum.name: occult_type
TunableEnum.description: The occult type to test against.

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: The Sim to which this test applies.

TunableTuple.name: organization_membership_test
TunableTuple.description: Return True if the Sim has the tuned membership status in the organization(s).

Tunable.name: invert
Tunable.description: If checked, test will pass if all subjects do NOT qualify.

TunableEnum.name: membership_status
TunableEnum.description: The status of the Sim in the organization(s).

TunableList.name: organizations
TunableList.description: The organization(s) against which to test the Sim's membership. If any in the list do not pass, the test will return False.

Tunable.description: An organization against which to test membership status.

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: The subject of this test.

TunableTuple.name: outfit
TunableTuple.description: Test various conditions regarding a Sim's or object's outfits.

TunableList.name: blacklist_outfits
TunableList.description: If the specified participant's outfit matches any of these categories, the test will fail.

TunableVariant.name: outfit
TunableVariant.description: The outfit to use for the blacklist/whitelist tests.

TunableVariant.name: outfit_addition_test
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, then the test will verify whether or not the specified participant can add an outfit to a specific category.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Tunables controlling the nature of this test.

TunableVariant.name: outfit_category
TunableVariant.description: Define the outfit category for which we need to test addition.

TunableTuple.name: from_enum
TunableTuple.description: Get an outfit category from the specified enum.

TunableEnum.name: outfit_category
TunableEnum.description: The outfit category for which we must be able to add an outfit.

TunableTuple.name: from_participant
TunableTuple.description: Get an outfit category by considering the current outfit of the specified participant.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant whose current outfit will determine the resulting outfit category.

TunableVariant.name: test_type
TunableVariant.description: The condition to test for.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant against which to run this outfit test.

TunableList.name: whitelist_outfits
TunableList.description: If set, then the participant's outfit must match any of these entries, or the test will fail.

TunableTuple.name: outfit_body_types
TunableTuple.description: A tunable factory that tests body type flags of outfits.

TunableTuple.name: body_types
TunableTuple.description: The allowed and disallowed body types required to pass this test. All CAS parts of the subject will be used to determine success or failure.

TunableVariant.name: blacklist
TunableVariant.description: When an item is tested against this white/black list, it is only allowed if it is not in the blacklist. If no blacklist is specified, no items are disallowed.

TunableTuple.name: specify
TunableTuple.description: A tunable blacklist.

TunableList.name: blacklist
TunableList.description: Blacklisted items.

TunableEnum.description: The body type we want the CAS part to support or not support.

TunableVariant.name: threshold
TunableVariant.description: Tunable option for how many items must be in the blacklist for the blacklist to fail when testing a collection of items. By default, only one object needs to be in the list.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: When testing a collection of items, the number of items in that collection that are in the blacklist must pass this threshold test for the blacklist to disallow them all.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

TunableVariant.name: whitelist
TunableVariant.description: When an item is tested against this white/black list, it is only allowed if it is in the whitelist. If no whitelist is specified, all items are allowed.

TunableTuple.name: specify
TunableTuple.description: A tunable whitelist.

TunableVariant.name: threshold
TunableVariant.description: Tunable option for how many items must be in the whitelist for the whitelist to pass when testing a collection of items. By default, only one object needs to be in the list.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: When testing a collection of items, the number of items in that collection that are in the whitelist must pass this threshold test for the whitelist to allow them all.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

TunableList.name: whitelist
TunableList.description: Whitelisted items.

TunableEnum.description: The body type we want the CAS part to support or not support.

TunableVariant.name: outfit_override
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, specify a particular outfit to check the body types of. Otherwise we check the subject's current outfit.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: The outfit we want to check the body types of.

Tunable.name: index
Tunable.description: The outfit index.

TunableEnum.name: outfit_category
TunableEnum.description: The outfit category.

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: The Sim we want to test the body type outfit for.

TunableTuple.name: participant_running_interaction
TunableTuple.description: A test that verifies if the participant is running or transitioning to a specific interaction.

TunableList.name: affordance_lists
TunableList.description: The affordances to test. The test will pass if any participant is running any of the affordances.

Tunable.description: A reference to a AffordanceList tuning snippet.
The affordances to test. The test will pass if any participant is running any of the affordances.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant of the interaction to test. The test will pass if any participant is running any of the affordances.

Tunable.name: test_for_not_running
Tunable.description: Changes this test to check for the opposite case, as in verifying that none of these affordances are being run by any of the participants.

TunableTuple.name: party_age
TunableTuple.description: Require all sims in the party meet with the age requirement.

TunableList.name: ages_allowed
TunableList.description: All valid ages.

Tunable.name: check_ensemble
Tunable.description: If enabled then we will check against the subject's rally ensemble instead.

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: The subject of this party age test.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: The number of sims that must pass these tests per group to pass the test.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The value of a threshold.

TunableTuple.name: party_size
TunableTuple.description: Require the party size of the subject sim to match a threshold.

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: The subject of this party size test.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: The party size threshold for this test.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The value of a threshold.

TunableTuple.name: phone_silenced_test
TunableTuple.description: Test to check if the phone is silenced.

Tunable.name: is_silenced
Tunable.description: If checked the test will return True if the phone is silenced.

TunableTuple.name: pick_info_test
TunableTuple.description: A tunable factory that tests the pick of an interaction context.

TunableTuple.name: pick_terrain
TunableTuple.description: A tunable factory that tests the location in a Pick Terrain matches the tuned type.

TunableVariant.name: terrain_feature
TunableVariant.description: Tune this if you want to require a floor feature to be present

Tunable.name: terrain_feature_radius
Tunable.description: The radius to look for the floor feature, if one is tuned in terrain_feature

TunableEnum.name: terrain_location
TunableEnum.description: Terrain type to find.

TunableVariant.name: tooltip
TunableVariant.description: Reason of failure.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Reason of failure.

TunableTuple.name: pick_type
TunableTuple.description: A tunable factory that tests if the location in a Pick Terrain matches the tuned type. A Pick Type is what got clicked on. Example: Stairs, Walls, Sim, Object, Terrain, etc.

TunableList.name: blacklist
TunableList.description: A set of pick types that will fail the test if the pick type matches any of them.

TunableEnum.description: A pick type.

TunableVariant.name: prohibited_terrain_tags
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, will verify the location of the test is currently not on one of the tuned terrain tags.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: A set of terrain tags. If any tag is present at the location, the test will fail

TunableVariant.name: terrain_tags
TunableVariant.description: If checked, will verify the location of the test is currently on one of the tuned terrain tags.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: A set of terrain tags. Only one of these tags needs to be present at this location. Although it is not tunable, there is a threshold weight underneath which a terrain tag will not appear to be present.

TunableVariant.name: tooltip
TunableVariant.description: Reason of failure.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Reason of failure.

TunableList.name: whitelist
TunableList.description: A set of pick types that will pass the test if the pick type matches any of them.

TunableEnum.description: A pick type.

TunableTuple.name: player_population
TunableTuple.description: A test determining whether or not a player is over the maximum player population cap.

TunableTuple.name: allowable_size
TunableTuple.description: The range (inclusive min, exclusive max) of pool sizes for which this test will pass. Pool size is measured in half tiles.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

TunableEnum.name: target
TunableEnum.description: The target of the test.

TunableTuple.name: portal_locked_test
TunableTuple.description: A test that checks whether an object is locked. Return True if the lock exists. If negative is checked, return True if the lock does not exist.

Tunable.name: negate
Tunable.description: If checked, the test will pass if there is no lock on the object (test_lock_exist selected) or the object is not locked to sim (test_lock_sim selected).

Tunable.name: require_locking_component
Tunable.description: If checked, every object targeted by the test must have a locking component. If unchecked, the test can continue without requiring every object to have a locking component.

TunableEnum.name: targets
TunableEnum.description: The object(s) to test.

TunableVariant.name: test_data
TunableVariant.description: Different condition we want the test to test against.

TunableTuple.name: test_lock_exist
TunableTuple.description: Test if the door has any lock on it with the certain lock priority.

TunableTuple.name: test_lock_sim
TunableTuple.description: Test if the door will lock the sim in the subject.

TunableTuple.name: posture
TunableTuple.description: Require the participants of this interaction to pass certain posture tests.

TunableVariant.name: container_supports
TunableVariant.description: Test whether or not the subject's current posture's container supports the specified posture.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The posture that the container of the subject's current posture must support.

TunableList.name: prohibited_postures
TunableList.description: The test will fail if the subject is in any of these postures.

TunableList.name: required_postures
TunableList.description:
If this list is not empty, the subject is required to be in at least one of the postures specified here.
Note: If a multi Sim posture is tuned in this list, target must also be tuned.

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: The subject of this posture test.

TunableVariant.name: target
TunableVariant.description: If checking for multi sim postures, this is the linked Sim participant to check for. This must be tuned if container supports is enabled or if a multi sim posture exists in the list of required postures.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: , The target of multi Sim postures.

TunableTuple.name: pregnancy
TunableTuple.description: Test conditions related to a Sim's pregnancy.

TunableVariant.name: offspring_gender
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, test for the offspring's gender.

TunableEnum.name: Require
TunableEnum.description: The gender to test for. If the offsrping is not of this gender, the test fails.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant against which to run this pregnancy test.

TunableTuple.name: rabbit_hole
TunableTuple.description: A test for testing if the Sim is in a rabbit hole.

Tunable.name: negate
Tunable.description: If checked then we will negate the results of this test.

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: The subject who's familiar tracker we are checking.

TunableTuple.name: ranked_statistic
TunableTuple.description: A test that checks whether or not a statistic is at a certain threshold for a given participant.

Tunable.name: must_have_ranked_stat
Tunable.description: Setting this to True (checked) will ensure that this test only passes if the tested Sim actually has the ranked statistic referenced. If left False (unchecked), this test will evaluate as if the Sim had the ranked statistic at the value of 0

TunableVariant.name: num_participants
TunableVariant.description: If disabled, all participants must pass this stat test. If enabled, we test against this number for the number of participants that need this value of stat to pass.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: The threshold of the number of participants who must meet the criteria individually.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The value of a threshold.

Tunable.name: ranked_stat
Tunable.description: The ranked stat we are operating on.

Tunable.name: test_against_highest_rank
Tunable.description: When checked this test will only return True is the highest rank achieved is in the threshold specified, and not the current rank.

TunableVariant.name: threshold
TunableVariant.description: The value or state threshold to test against.

TunableTuple.name: state_value_threshold
TunableTuple.description: Value/comparison pair used to define a Threshold.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The state threshold for this test.

TunableTuple.name: value_threshold
TunableTuple.description: The threshold to control availability based on the ranked statistic's value.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The value of a threshold.

TunableEnum.name: who
TunableEnum.description: Who or what to apply this test to.

TunableTuple.name: region
TunableTuple.description: A test to check which region the actor sim is in.

TunableVariant.name: blacklist
TunableVariant.description: If enabled then we will check a blacklist of regions in insure that the sim is not within one of them.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: A set of regions that the sim being tested must not be within.

Tunable.description: A region that the sim being tested in must not be within.

TunableVariant.name: subject
TunableVariant.description: If enabled then we will test the region of the specified participant type. Otherwise we will test the current region.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: Who do we want to run this test on.

TunableVariant.name: whitelist
TunableVariant.description: If enabled then we will check a whitelist of regions in insure that the sim is within one of them.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: A set of regions that the sim being tested must be within.

Tunable.description: A region that the sim being tested in must be within.

TunableTuple.name: relationship
TunableTuple.description: Gate availability by a relationship status.

Tunable.name: invert_num_relations
Tunable.description: If checked then we will check that your Num Relations is less than or equal to the value rather than the other way around.

Tunable.name: num_relations
Tunable.description:
Number of Sims with specified relationships required to pass, default(0) is all known relations.
If value set to 1 or greater, then test is looking at least that number of relationship to match the criteria.
If value is set to 0, then test will pass if relationships being tested must match all criteria of the test to succeed. For example, if interaction should not appear if any relationship contains a relationship bit, this value should be 0.

TunableList.name: match_all
TunableList.description: All of these relationship bits must match to fail the test.

TunableList.name: match_any
TunableList.description: If any of these relationship bits match the test will fail.

TunableTuple.name: relationship_score_interval
TunableTuple.description: The range that the relationship score must be within in order for this test to pass.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

TunableList.name: match_all
TunableList.description: All of these relationship bits must be present to pass the test.

TunableList.name: match_any
TunableList.description: Any of these relationship bits will pass the test.

TunableList.name: subject
TunableList.description: Owner(s) of the relationship(s).

TunableList.name: target_sim
TunableList.description: Target(s) of the relationship(s).

TunableEnum.name: test_event
TunableEnum.description: The event that we want to trigger this instance of the tuned test on.

TunableVariant.name: test_incest
TunableVariant.description: Test for incest status. Test passes if this matches the two Sim's incest status.

Tunable.name: track
Tunable.description: If set, the test will use the relationship score between sims for this track. If unset, the track defaults to the global module tunable REL_INSPECTOR_TRACK.

TunableTuple.name: relationship_bit_count
TunableTuple.description: Tests the number of relationships each subject Sim has compared to a threshold. All subjects must pass for the test to pass.

TunableEnum.name: comparison_operator
TunableEnum.description: The operator to use to compare the sim's actual relationship count vs. the tuned Relationship Count.

Tunable.name: rel_bit
Tunable.description:
The type of relationship we're looking for.
In other words, we're looking for any relationship with this Rel Bit.

Tunable.name: relationship_count
Tunable.description: The number of relationships we want to compare against the sim's actual number of relationships.

TunableList.name: subject
TunableList.description: Owner of the relationship.

TunableTuple.name: relationship_comparative
TunableTuple.description: A tunable test method that compares relationships among participants. The average relationship of all Sims in each tuned subject participantType will be used for comparison.

TunableVariant.name: expected_result
TunableVariant.default: Subject A has higher relationship with target.
TunableVariant.description: The expected result of this relationship comparison.

Tunable.name: Subject A has higher relationship with target.
Tunable.display: Subject A Has Higher Relationship With Target.

Tunable.name: Subject B has higher relationship with target.
Tunable.display: Subject B Has Higher Relationship With Target.

TunableVariant.name: fallback
TunableVariant.description: The fallback winner in case subjects a and b have the exact same average relationship with the target.

TunableList.name: subject_a
TunableList.description: Owner(s) of the relationship(s) to be compared with subject_b.

TunableList.name: subject_b
TunableList.description: Owner(s) of the relationship(s) to be compared with subject_a.

TunableList.name: target
TunableList.description: Target of the relationship(s).

Tunable.name: track
Tunable.description: The relationship track to compare.

TunableTuple.name: relationship_modified_by_statistic
TunableTuple.description: Gate availability by combination of relationship tracks and statistics.

TunableList.name: relationship_tracks
TunableList.description: List of the relationship tracks and respective multipliers.

TunableTuple.name: score_interval
TunableTuple.description: The range that the score must be within in order for this test to pass. Min inclusive, max exclusive. Score is sum of all specified statistics and tracks multiplied by their respective multipliers.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

TunableList.name: subject
TunableList.description: Owner(s) of the relationship.

TunableList.name: subject_statistics
TunableList.description: List of the statistics and respective multipliers for the subject.

TunableList.name: target_sim
TunableList.description: Target(s) of the relationship.

TunableList.name: target_statistics
TunableList.description: List of the statistics and respective multipliers for the target.

TunableTuple.name: relative_statistic
TunableTuple.description:
A Test that compares statistics against each other either on the same participant or on two different participants. I.E. I want this to pass only when the actor has lower hunger than the target. I.E. I want this to pass only when the targets's hunger is lower than their bladder.
If either of the Sims doesn't have the stat being compared the value will default to the initial value of the stat, or in the case that rank is being used, then the initial rank will be used.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value. The test passes if (source_stat comparison target)

Tunable.name: difference
Tunable.description: The difference between the source and target stat in order to pass the threshold. This value is added to the source stat value and the threshold is checked against the resulting value.

TunableVariant.name: score_to_use
TunableVariant.description: Depending on the choice, this decides what value to use for the threshold comparison.

TunableTuple.name: points
TunableTuple.description: Use the raw points for the comparison in the test.

TunableTuple.name: rank
TunableTuple.description: Use the rank value for the comparison in the test.

TunableTuple.name: user_value
TunableTuple.description: Use the user value for the comparison in the test.

Tunable.name: highest_level_reached_instead
Tunable.description: If checked this will test against the highest level reached. This currently only works with Ranked Statistics. Other statistics do not have a notion of highest level reached. If we are using something that doesn't support highest level reached it will test against the current level instead.

TunableEnum.name: source
TunableEnum.description: Who or what to apply this test to

Tunable.name: stat
Tunable.description: The stat we are using for the comparison

TunableEnum.name: target
TunableEnum.description: Who or what to use for the comparison

TunableList.name: target_stats
TunableList.description: The stat on the target we want to compare against. If there is more than one, all must pass the comparison. If there is none, it compares the same stat.

TunableVariant.name: claimed_table_status
TunableVariant.description:
Test for whether or not a Sim/Sims Dining Group has already claimed a table, or alternatively whether or not a specific table has been claimed.
If enabled and the subject is a Sim this test will return True if that Sim or the dining group they are in have already claimed a table.
If enabled and the subject is an object this test will return True if the subject is a table that has been claimed. If anything other than a table is passed then this test will return False.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description:
If this is set to true then the test will return True if the Sim/Sims Group has claimed a table or if the Table has already been claimed. Otherwise it will return False.
If this is set to False then the test will return True if the Sim/Sims Group has not claimed a table yet or the Table hasn't already claimed a table. Otherwise this test will return False.

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: The participant to run the tests against.

TunableVariant.name: waiting_for_food
TunableVariant.description: Test for whether or not the Sim specified by the subject and their group currently has an order being worked on.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description:
If set to True then this test will return True if the group associated with the subject is currently waiting on an order (This means they have a GroupOrder in status Taken or later).
If False then this test will return True if the group associated with the subject doesn't have an order with a statu > Taken.
(Note: When the order has been delivered there is no more group order to have a status.

TunableTuple.name: restaurant_course_item_count
TunableTuple.description: The test to check whether there are enough items in the menu to meet a certain threshold.

TunableList.name: blacklist_recipes
TunableList.description: The items from the course to not include in this test.

TunableEnum.name: course
TunableEnum.description: The course to check for this test.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: The number of items that should available in this course.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The value of a threshold.

TunableTuple.name: restaurant_dining_spot
TunableTuple.description: The test to see if the dining spot(either the table or the seat) is claimed, or is claimed by the subject sim's group.

Tunable.name: negate
Tunable.description: If checked, the test will pass if the table/seat is not claimed. Otherwise the test will pass if the table/seat is claimed by the certain claim type.

Tunable.name: non_spot_seat_always_pass
Tunable.description: If checked, the seat that is not a dining spot, like barstool on bar or a chair not attach to table, will always pass this test.

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: The participant to run the tests against.

TunableEnum.name: test_type
TunableEnum.description: What type of claim table situation we want to test. The three options are: IS CLAIMED : will pass if the table is claimed by anyone. If negate, it will pass if the table is not claimed. CLAIMED BY GROUP : will pass if the table is claimed by the subject sim's group. If negate it will pass if the table is not claimed by the group. CLAIMED BY SIM : will pass if the seat if assigned to the subject sim. If negate, it will pass if the seat is not assigned to the subject sim

TunableTuple.name: restaurant_payment
TunableTuple.description: The test to see if the subject's dining group has restaurant payment. Test will pass if the group has bill.

Tunable.name: negate
Tunable.description: If checked, the test will pass if the dining group doesn't have bill. If not, it will pass if the dining group has bill.

TunableEnum.name: sim_subject
TunableEnum.description: The participant to run the tests against.

TunableTuple.name: retail_test
TunableTuple.description: A variety of tests related to the current retail lot.

TunableVariant.name: retail_test
TunableVariant.description: Tests to check various things about the current retail lot.

TunableTuple.name: retail_markup_test
TunableTuple.description: Test against the current markup multiplier for the retail lot.

Tunable.name: markup_multiplier
Tunable.description: If the current multiplier matches this tuned multiplier, the test will pass.

Tunable.name: negate
Tunable.description: Will negate the result of the test. e.g. if the current markup is not equal the test will pass

TunableTuple.name: retail_open_test
TunableTuple.description: Checks to see if the current lot is an open retail lot or not. Regardless of how this is tuned, this will ALWAYS return False if the current lot is not a retail venue.

Tunable.name: is_open
Tunable.description: If enabled, the test will pass if the current lot is a retail lot and is open. If disabled, the test will pass if the current lot is a retail lot and is closed.

TunableTuple.name: reward_part_test
TunableTuple.description: Test to see if the Sim has the item unlocked in the UnlockTrackerTest.

Tunable.name: invert
Tunable.description: If checked, test will pass if any subject does NOT have the unlock.

TunableList.name: reward_parts
TunableList.description: All the reward parts that

TunableEnum.name: reward_parts_from_object_participant
TunableEnum.description: A participant whose saved cas parts will be appended to any tuned in reward_parts.

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: Who or what to apply this test to

TunableTuple.name: roommate_tests
TunableTuple.description: This test contains all the various roommate tests

TunableVariant.name: test_type
TunableVariant.description: The type of roommate test to perform.

TunableTuple.name: is_roommate_test
TunableTuple.description: Returns True if the subject is a roommate of the specified household(s).

TunableVariant.name: household
TunableVariant.description: Which household the participant must be a roommate of.

TunableEnum.name: participant_sim_household
TunableEnum.description: The sim whose household the participant must be a roommate of.

Tunable.name: invert
Tunable.description: If true, the test will pass if the sim is a valid roommate Otherwise will pass if the sim is not.

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: The participant against which to run this test.

TunableTuple.name: roommate_ad_test
TunableTuple.description: Returns True if the ad for roommates is currently running.

Tunable.name: invert
Tunable.description: If checked, invert the test

TunableTuple.name: roommate_leave_reason_test
TunableTuple.description: Returns True if the target sim has the specified RoommateLeaveReason

Tunable.name: invert
Tunable.description: If checked, invert the test

TunableList.name: reasons
TunableList.description: Reasons to be tested for.

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: The subject

TunableTuple.name: roommate_room_test
TunableTuple.description: Returns True if there is room available for a roommate on the active sims home lot

Tunable.name: invert
Tunable.description: If checked, invert the test

TunableTuple.name: routability
TunableTuple.description: A tunable factory that tests whether the subject can route to the target. Currently only tests permissability, not actual existance of path

Tunable.name: negate
Tunable.description: If checked, passes the test if the sim does NOT have permissions

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: The subject of the test.

TunableEnum.name: target
TunableEnum.description: The target of the test.

TunableTuple.name: routing_slave_formation
TunableTuple.description: Test whether or not the Sim is in a routing formation, either as slave or master, and satisfies a set of requirements. If both master and slave are specified, the formations considered are those common to both Sims.

TunableVariant.name: formation_test
TunableVariant.description: How we want to test the formation of the Master/Slave.

TunableTuple.name: available_formations
TunableTuple.description:
The master Sim is required to be able to enslave the specified slave participant in any of the tuned formation types. This is equivalent to "not in formation OR formation is not full."
If the master is not specified, the test merely requires the slave participant to not be in any formation.
If the slave is not specified, the test merely requires the master to not be in any formation other than this one and to have room for one more Sim in this formation.

TunableList.name: available_formations
TunableList.description: The Sims must be able to form at least one of these formations.

TunableTuple.name: compatibility
TunableTuple.description: Test whether or not the master/slave are in a required or prohibited formation.

TunableTuple.name: compatibility
TunableTuple.description: A white/blacklist that determines compatibility via required or prohibited formations.

TunableVariant.name: blacklist
TunableVariant.description: When an item is tested against this white/black list, it is only allowed if it is not in the blacklist. If no blacklist is specified, no items are disallowed.

TunableTuple.name: specify
TunableTuple.description: A tunable blacklist.

TunableList.name: blacklist
TunableList.description: Blacklisted items.

Tunable.description: A routing formation

TunableVariant.name: threshold
TunableVariant.description: Tunable option for how many items must be in the blacklist for the blacklist to fail when testing a collection of items. By default, only one object needs to be in the list.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: When testing a collection of items, the number of items in that collection that are in the blacklist must pass this threshold test for the blacklist to disallow them all.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

TunableVariant.name: whitelist
TunableVariant.description: When an item is tested against this white/black list, it is only allowed if it is in the whitelist. If no whitelist is specified, all items are allowed.

TunableTuple.name: specify
TunableTuple.description: A tunable whitelist.

TunableVariant.name: threshold
TunableVariant.description: Tunable option for how many items must be in the whitelist for the whitelist to pass when testing a collection of items. By default, only one object needs to be in the list.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: When testing a collection of items, the number of items in that collection that are in the whitelist must pass this threshold test for the whitelist to allow them all.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

TunableList.name: whitelist
TunableList.description: Whitelisted items.

Tunable.description: A routing formation

TunableTuple.name: in_formation
TunableTuple.description:
Test whether or not the master/slave is in a formation of any type.
Use this to psychologically test against whether the slave is actually a slave, and whether the master is a master.

TunableVariant.name: formations_to_validate
TunableVariant.description: If enabled depending on the required_or_prohibited check, we will validate if the Sim current formation against the ones on this list.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: A white/blacklist that determines compatibility via required or prohibited formations.

TunableVariant.name: blacklist
TunableVariant.description: When an item is tested against this white/black list, it is only allowed if it is not in the blacklist. If no blacklist is specified, no items are disallowed.

TunableTuple.name: specify
TunableTuple.description: A tunable blacklist.

TunableList.name: blacklist
TunableList.description: Blacklisted items.

TunableVariant.name: threshold
TunableVariant.description: Tunable option for how many items must be in the blacklist for the blacklist to fail when testing a collection of items. By default, only one object needs to be in the list.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: When testing a collection of items, the number of items in that collection that are in the blacklist must pass this threshold test for the blacklist to disallow them all.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

TunableVariant.name: whitelist
TunableVariant.description: When an item is tested against this white/black list, it is only allowed if it is in the whitelist. If no whitelist is specified, all items are allowed.

TunableTuple.name: specify

TunableVariant.name: threshold

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: When testing a collection of items, the number of items in that collection that are in the whitelist must pass this threshold test for the whitelist to allow them all.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

TunableList.name: whitelist
TunableList.description: Whitelisted items.

Tunable.description: A routing formation

Tunable.name: required_or_prohibited
Tunable.description: If enabled, we require the master/slave to be in a formation of any type. If disabled, we require that the master/slave is not in a formation.

TunableVariant.name: participant_master
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the specified participant must satisfy the test requirements for all routing formations they are a master of.

TunableVariant.name: participant_slave

TunableVariant.name: time_of_season
TunableVariant.description: Portion(s) of season(s) that we must be in to pass the test.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: Portion(s) of season(s) that we must be in to pass the test.

TunableTuple.name: selected_aspiration_test
TunableTuple.description: A tunable test that a Sim has the tuned Aspiration selected.

Tunable.name: aspiration
Tunable.description: The aspiration that must be active.

TunableEnum.name: who
TunableEnum.description: Who or what to apply this test to.

TunableTuple.name: selected_aspiration_track_test
TunableTuple.description: A tunable test that a Sim has the tuned AspirationTrack selected.

Tunable.name: aspiration_track
Tunable.description: The mood that must be active (or must not be active, if disallow is True).

TunableEnum.name: who
TunableEnum.description: Who or what to apply this test to.

TunableTuple.name: service_npc_hired_test
TunableTuple.description: Tests on the state of service npc requests of the participant's household. EX whether a maid was requested or has been cancelled

Tunable.name: hired
Tunable.description: Whether to test if service is hired or not hired. EX: If True, we test that you have hired the tuned service. If False, we test that you don't have the service hired.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The subject of this test. We will use the subject's household to test if the household has requested a service

Tunable.name: service
Tunable.description: The service tuning to perform the test against

TunableTuple.name: sickness_test
TunableTuple.description: The test to determine whether a Sim currently has or has had a sickness or a specified sickness.

Tunable.name: check_history
Tunable.description:
Whether or not to check sickness history.
If False, we only check if they are currently sick with the specified sickness.

Tunable.name: invert
Tunable.description: Whether or not to invert the results of this test.

TunableVariant.name: sickness
TunableVariant.description:
Optionally specify sickness to test against.
If disabled, will check if the sick is sick with any sickness.

TunableTuple.name: by_tag
TunableTuple.description:
Validate sickness using tags.
This conforms to the white/blacklist API.

TunableEnum.description: Only sickness that share any of the tags specified pass.

TunableTuple.name: white_blacklist
TunableTuple.description: A tunable whitelist and blacklist.

TunableVariant.name: blacklist
TunableVariant.description: When an item is tested against this white/black list, it is only allowed if it is not in the blacklist. If no blacklist is specified, no items are disallowed.

TunableTuple.name: specify
TunableTuple.description: A tunable blacklist.

TunableList.name: blacklist
TunableList.description: Blacklisted items.

TunableVariant.name: threshold
TunableVariant.description: Tunable option for how many items must be in the blacklist for the blacklist to fail when testing a collection of items. By default, only one object needs to be in the list.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: When testing a collection of items, the number of items in that collection that are in the blacklist must pass this threshold test for the blacklist to disallow them all.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

TunableVariant.name: whitelist
TunableVariant.description: When an item is tested against this white/black list, it is only allowed if it is in the whitelist. If no whitelist is specified, all items are allowed.

TunableTuple.name: specify
TunableTuple.description: A tunable whitelist.

TunableVariant.name: threshold
TunableVariant.description: Tunable option for how many items must be in the whitelist for the whitelist to pass when testing a collection of items. By default, only one object needs to be in the list.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: When testing a collection of items, the number of items in that collection that are in the whitelist must pass this threshold test for the whitelist to allow them all.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

TunableList.name: whitelist
TunableList.description: Whitelisted items.

TunableEnum.name: target
TunableEnum.description: When this test runs, it checks against this participant for sickness information. If the affordance is targeting a patient, it will typically be TargetSim.

TunableTuple.name: sim_info
TunableTuple.description: The SimInfo tests some of the basic aspects of a Sim, such as their age, gender, or species.

TunableVariant.name: ages
TunableVariant.description: The Sim must be one of the specified ages.

TunableList.name: specified
TunableList.description: The Sim must be one of the specified ages.

TunableVariant.name: can_age_up
TunableVariant.description: Whether the Sim is eligible to advance to the next age.

Tunable.name: specified
Tunable.description: Whether the Sim is eligible to advance to the next age.

TunableVariant.name: gender
TunableVariant.description: The Sim must be of the specified gender.

TunableEnum.name: specified
TunableEnum.description: The Sim must be of the specified gender.

TunableVariant.name: has_been_played
TunableVariant.description: Whether the Sim has ever been played as a Playable Sim. If enabled and true, the Sim must have been played by the player. If enabled and false, the Sim must never have been played. If disabled, this portion of the Sim Info test will be ignored.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Whether the Sim has ever been played as a Playable Sim. If enabled and true, the Sim must have been played by the player. If enabled and false, the Sim must never have been played. If disabled, this portion of the Sim Info test will be ignored.

TunableVariant.name: is_active_sim
TunableVariant.description: Whether the Sim must be the active selected Sim. If enabled and true, the sim must active for this test to pass. If enabled and false, the sim must not be active for this test to pass. If disabled, this portion of the Sim Info test will be ignored.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Whether the Sim must be the active selected Sim. If enabled and true, the sim must active for this test to pass. If enabled and false, the sim must not be active for this test to pass. If disabled, this portion of the Sim Info test will be ignored.

TunableEnum.name: match_type
TunableEnum.description:
When testing multiple participants if MATCH_ALL is set, then all the participants need to pass the test.
If MATCH_ANY is set, test will pass as soon as one of them meet the criteria

TunableVariant.name: npc
TunableVariant.description:
Whether the Sim must be an NPC or Playable Sim. If enabled and true, the sim must be an NPC for this test to pass. If enabled and false, the sim must be playable, non-NPC sim for this test to pass. If disabled, this portion of the Sim Info test will be ignored.
Note: NPC in this case means a Sim that is not currently controllable (selectable), or Not Player Controllable. If you need to know if the Sim has ever been played, use 'Has Been Played'

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description:
Whether the Sim must be an NPC or Playable Sim. If enabled and true, the sim must be an NPC for this test to pass. If enabled and false, the sim must be playable, non-NPC sim for this test to pass. If disabled, this portion of the Sim Info test will be ignored.
Note: NPC in this case means a Sim that is not currently controllable (selectable), or Not Player Controllable. If you need to know if the Sim has ever been played, use 'Has Been Played'

TunableTuple.name: specified
TunableTuple.description: The Sim must be one of the specified species. Species are consolidated, e.g. large/small dog are both DOG.

TunableList.name: species
TunableList.description: The Sim must be one of the specified species. Species are consolidated, e.g. large/small dog are both DOG.

TunableTuple.name: specified_extended
TunableTuple.description: The Sim must be one of the specified species. Species are *not* consolidated, e.g. large/small dog are different species.

TunableList.name: species
TunableList.description: The Sim must be one of the specified species. Species are *not* consolidated, e.g. large/small dog are different species.

TunableEnum.name: who
TunableEnum.description: Who or what to apply this test to

TunableTuple.name: sim_info_gameplay_options
TunableTuple.description: Test whether or not a Sim has a specific gameplay option set.

TunableEnum.name: gameplay_option
TunableEnum.description: The gameplay option to test. This test will pass if this option is set.

Tunable.name: invert
Tunable.description: If enabled, requires the option to be unset for the test to pass.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The subject of the test.

TunableTuple.name: simoleon_value
TunableTuple.description: Tests the Simoleon value of various contexts (property value, object value, net worth, etc.).

TunableVariant.name: is_apartment
TunableVariant.description: If checked, test will pass if the zone is an apartment. If unchecked, test passes if the zone is NOT an apartment. Useful in aspiration tuning, to discriminate between property types in tests of lot value. Allows "Own a House worth X" and "Own an Apartment worth X"

TunableTuple.name: Is_or_is_not_apartment_zone
TunableTuple.display: Is Or Is Not Apartment Zone
TunableTuple.description: Test whether the zone is an apartment or not.

Tunable.name: consider_penthouse_an_apartment
Tunable.description: If enabled, we will consider penthouses to be apartments when testing them against the apartment check.

Tunable.name: is_apartment
Tunable.description: If checked, test will pass if the zone is an apartment. If unchecked, test passes if the zone is NOT an apartment.

TunableEnum.name: test_event
TunableEnum.description: The event that we want to trigger this instance of the tuned test on. NOTE: OnClientConnect is still used as a trigger regardless of this choice in order to update the UI.

TunableVariant.name: value_context
TunableVariant.description: The context against which to test the value.

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: Who to examine for Simoleon values.

TunableTuple.name: net_worth
TunableTuple.description: The net worth of the participants' households.

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: Who to examine for Simoleon values.

TunableTuple.name: property_only
TunableTuple.description: The property value of the participants' households.

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: Who to examine for Simoleon values.

TunableTuple.name: retail_funds
TunableTuple.description: The total retail funds on the current retail lot. Returns a False test result if the active lot is not a business or is not owned by the subject.

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: Who to examine for Simoleon values.

TunableTuple.name: total_cash
TunableTuple.description: The total funds for the participants' households.

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: Who to examine for Simoleon values.

TunableTuple.name: value_threshold
TunableTuple.description: Amounts in Simoleons required to pass

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The value of a threshold.

TunableTuple.name: sims_in_constraint
TunableTuple.description:
A tunable factory that runs a test set on all Sims in a constraint. If any of the Sims in the constraint fails the test set, this test will fail as well. If there are no Sims in the constraint, the test will pass.
NOTE: This is an expensive test, so do NOT tune it on autonomous interactions or other expensive operations.

TunableList.name: constraints
TunableList.description: A list of constraints that, when intersected, will be used to find all Sims we care about.

TunableVariant.description: A constraint that will determine what Sims to test.

TunableTuple.name: circle
TunableTuple.description: The relative circle geometry required for a sim/posture to use the object.

Tunable.name: enables_height_scoring
Tunable.description: If enabled, this constraint will score goals using the height of the surface. The higher the goal the cheaper it is.

Tunable.name: ideal_radius
Tunable.description: Ideal distance for this circle constraint, points closer to the ideal distance will score higher.

Tunable.name: ideal_radius_width
Tunable.description: This creates a band around the ideal_radius that also costs 0 instead of rising in cost. ex: If you have a circle of radius 5, with an ideal_radius of 2.5, and a ideal_radius_width of 0.5, all goals in the radius 2 to radius 3 range will score optimially.

Tunable.name: multi_surface
Tunable.description:
If enabled, this constraint will be considered for multiple surfaces.
Example: You want a circle constraint that can be both inside and outside of a pool.

Tunable.name: radial_cost_weight
Tunable.description: The importance of the radial cost function. = 0: Not used > 1: Important on surfaces > 2: Important on grass

Tunable.name: radius
Tunable.description: Circle radius

Tunable.name: require_los
Tunable.description:
If checked, the Sim will require line of sight to the actor. Positions where a Sim can't see the actor (e.g. there's a wall in the way) won't be valid.
NOTE: This will NOT work on a constraint that is not used to generate routing goals such as broadcasters and reactions, use a Line Of Sight Constraint instead. This will work on constraints used to keep Sims in an interaction.

TunableTuple.name: cone
TunableTuple.description: The relative cone geometry required for a sim/posture to use the object.

Tunable.name: angle
Tunable.description: The cone angle in degrees.

Tunable.name: angular_cost_weight
Tunable.description: The importance of the angular cost function. = 0: Not used > 1: Important on surfaces > 2: Important on grass

Tunable.name: enables_height_scoring
Tunable.description: If enabled, this constraint will score goals using the height of the surface. The higher the goal the cheaper it is.

Tunable.name: ideal_angle
Tunable.description: The angular extents of an ideal region as a fraction of angle.

Tunable.name: ideal_radius_max
Tunable.description: The radial upper bound of an ideal region as a fraction of the difference between max_radius and min_radius.

Tunable.name: ideal_radius_min
Tunable.description: The radial lower bound of an ideal region as a fraction of the difference between max_radius and min_radius.

Tunable.name: max_radius
Tunable.description: The maximum cone radius.

Tunable.name: min_radius
Tunable.description: The minimum cone radius.

Tunable.name: multi_surface
Tunable.description:
If enabled, this constraint will be considered for multiple surfaces.
Example: You want a circle constraint that can be both inside and outside of a pool.

Tunable.name: offset
Tunable.description:
An offset (rotation) in degrees.
By default the cone will face the forward vector of the object. Use an offset to rotate the cone to face a different direction.

Tunable.name: radial_cost_weight
Tunable.description: The importance of the radial cost function. = 0: Not used > 1: Important on surfaces > 2: Important on grass

Tunable.name: require_los
Tunable.description:
If checked, the Sim will require line of sight to the actor. Positions where a Sim can't see the actor (e.g. there's a wall in the way) won't be valid.
NOTE: This will NOT work on a constraint that is not used to generate routing goals such as broadcasters and reactions, use a Line Of Sight Constraint instead. This will work on constraints used to keep Sims in an interaction.

TunableTuple.name: current_position
TunableTuple.description: A constraint that is a small circle around the actor Sim's current position. For interactions, regardless of what the tuned constraint actor is, the Actor participant is always used as the target for the generated circle.

Tunable.name: ignore_on_object_routing_surface
Tunable.description: If checked, we will ignore this constraint on the object routing surface. This should be used when we are only tuning this constraint for performance reasons in order to be compatible with stair landings or other object routing surface areas that are not in the sim quadtree- which don't support geometric constraints.

Tunable.name: radius
Tunable.description: The maximum radius around the center point.

TunableTuple.name: facing
TunableTuple.description: Existential tunable that requires the sim to face the object.

Tunable.name: inner_radius
Tunable.description: A radius around the center of the constraint that defines an area in which the Sim's facing is unrestricted.

Tunable.name: range
Tunable.description: The size of the angle-range that sims should use when determining facing constraints.

TunableVariant.name: subroot_index
TunableVariant.description: An optional subroot to use for facing.

TunableTuple.name: line_of_sight
TunableTuple.description: Existential tunable that creates a line of sight constraint.

Tunable.name: multi_surface
Tunable.description:
If enabled, this constraint will be considered for multiple surfaces.
Example: You want a circle constraint that can be both inside and outside of a pool.

TunableVariant.name: temporary_los
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, a Line of Sight component will be temporarily created when constraints are needed. This should be used if the affordance requires LOS on an object that doesn't have an LOS component (i.e. a Sim needs to see another Sim WooHoo to play the jealousy reactions but Sims don't have LoS components.)

Tunable.name: boundary_epsilon
Tunable.description: The LOS origin is allowed to be outside of the boundary by this amount.

Tunable.name: facing_offset
Tunable.description: The LOS origin is offset from the object origin by this amount (mainly to avoid intersecting walls).

Tunable.name: map_divisions
Tunable.description: The number of points around the object to check collision from. More points means higher accuracy.

Tunable.name: max_line_of_sight_radius
Tunable.description: The maximum possible distance from this object than an interaction can reach.

Tunable.name: simplification_ratio
Tunable.description: A factor determining how much to combine edges in the line of sight polygon.

TunableTuple.name: ocean_loc
TunableTuple.description: The circle geometry relative to the nearest ocean locator.

Tunable.name: enables_height_scoring
Tunable.description: If enabled, this constraint will score goals using the height of the surface. The higher the goal the cheaper it is.

Tunable.name: ideal_radius
Tunable.description: Ideal distance for this circle constraint, points closer to the ideal distance will score higher.

Tunable.name: ideal_radius_width
Tunable.description: This creates a band around the ideal_radius that also costs 0 instead of rising in cost. ex: If you have a circle of radius 5, with an ideal_radius of 2.5, and a ideal_radius_width of 0.5, all goals in the radius 2 to radius 3 range will score optimially.

TunableEnum.name: interval
TunableEnum.description: Select the depth for the Sim based on the water height offset at a target location and the Sim's wading interval data.

Tunable.name: multi_surface
Tunable.description:
If enabled, this constraint will be considered for multiple surfaces.
Example: You want a circle constraint that can be both inside and outside of a pool.

Tunable.name: radial_cost_weight
Tunable.description: The importance of the radial cost function. = 0: Not used > 1: Important on surfaces > 2: Important on grass

Tunable.name: radius
Tunable.description: Circle radius

Tunable.name: require_los
Tunable.description:
If checked, the Sim will require line of sight to the actor. Positions where a Sim can't see the actor (e.g. there's a wall in the way) won't be valid.
NOTE: This will NOT work on a constraint that is not used to generate routing goals such as broadcasters and reactions, use a Line Of Sight Constraint instead. This will work on constraints used to keep Sims in an interaction.

TunableTuple.name: portal
TunableTuple.description: A constraint that is relative to the location of a portal.

TunableList.name: portals
TunableList.description: List of portal data to be used in this constraint.

TunableVariant.name: portal_direction
TunableVariant.description: Choose between the There and Back of the portal. This will not work properly if the portal is missing a Back and Back is specified here.

TunableVariant.name: portal_location
TunableVariant.description: Choose between the entry and exit of a portal direction.

Tunable.name: portal_type
Tunable.description: A reference to the type of portal to use for the constraint.

Tunable.name: require_position_los
Tunable.description: If checked, the Sim will require line of sight to the portal location for a Position constraint. Positions where a Sim can't see the portal (e.g. there's a wall in the way) won't be valid. This value won't be used for any tuned sub constraints.

TunableVariant.name: sub_constraint
TunableVariant.description:
If enabled, specify a specific type of constraint to create at the location of the portal.
If disabled then the constraint will just be a location constraint at the location of the portal.

TunableVariant.name: enabled
TunableVariant.description: The types of constraints that can be created at the location of the portal.

TunableTuple.name: circle
TunableTuple.description: A circle constraint that is created at the location of the portal.

TunableTuple.name: sub_constraint_offset
TunableTuple.description: Translation offset applied to the sub constraint, relative to the target object.

Tunable.name: x
Tunable.description: x component

Tunable.name: y
Tunable.description: y component

Tunable.name: z
Tunable.description: z component

TunableTuple.description: A circle constraint whose size is dependent on the size of the target object.

TunableVariant.name: maximum_radius
