TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Ideal radius data.

Tunable.name: radius
Tunable.description: The constraint's relative ideal radius. A value of 1 would mean the ideal location is on the outskirt of the constraint; values towards 0 approach the constraint's center.

Tunable.name: width
Tunable.description: This creates a band around the ideal_radius that also scores to 1 instead of starting to fall off to 0 in scoring. ex: If you have a circle of radius 5, with an ideal_radius of 2.5, and a ideal_radius_width of 0.5, any goals in the radius 2 to radius 3 range will all score optimially.

Tunable.name: relative_radius
Tunable.description: The constraint's radius relative to the size of the object. This is a simple multiplier applied to the area generated by the object's footprint

TunableEnum.name: spawn_point_request_reason
TunableEnum.description: The reason why we want the spawn point. Certain spawn points are only available for specific reasons, such as specific spawn points for leaving or for spawning at.

TunableVariant.name: tags
TunableVariant.description: A constraint that represents all of the spawn locations on the lot.

Tunable.name: use_lot_id
Tunable.description: If checked then we will use the current lot id to limit spawn points that are linked to lots to the current lot. Otherwise we will get spawn points of the given type that are potenially not linked to the current lot.

TunableVariant.name: backup_tags
TunableVariant.description: A constraint that represents primary spawn points with backup secondary ones.

TunableEnum.name: spawn_point_request_reason
TunableEnum.description: The reason why we want the spawn point. Certain spawn points are only available for specific reasons, such as specific spawn points for leaving or for spawning at.

TunableVariant.name: spawn_point_tags
TunableVariant.description: Tags that specify the primary spawnpoints or where to get them.

TunableTuple.name: tags
TunableTuple.description: Tags are specified straight out.

TunableTuple.name: university_based
TunableTuple.description: Tags are specified right here (on a per university basis)

TunableList.name: spawn_point_tags
TunableList.description: University specific classroom tags.

TunableTuple.name: university_course_slot_career_si
TunableTuple.description: Tags are pulled via the associated career interaction for a university course.

TunableTuple.name: university_course_slot_participant
TunableTuple.description: Tags are pulled via the specified participant holding the id of a university course.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant from which the career ID will be obtained. Typically should be PickedItemId if this interaction comes via a CareerPickerSuperInteraction.

TunableTuple.name: university_course_slot_reference
TunableTuple.description: Tags are pulled via the specified university course slot.

Tunable.name: _course_slot
Tunable.description: Course slot from which to pull the spawn point tags.

Tunable.name: use_lot_id_for_backup
Tunable.description: If checked then we will use the current lot id to limit spawn points that are linked to lots to the current lot if we fall back to the backup tags.

TunableTuple.name: terrain_material
TunableTuple.description: A water depth constraint which defines only the terrain materials required.

TunableVariant.name: terrain_tags
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, a set of allowed terrain tags. At least one tag must match the terrain under each vertex of the footprint of the supplied object.

TunableTuple.name: water_depth
TunableTuple.description: A water depth constraint which defines only the ocean water depth required.

TunableVariant.name: max_water_depth
TunableVariant.description: (float) If provided, each vertex of the test polygon along with its centroid will be tested to determine whether the ocean water at the test location is at most this deep. Values <= 0 indicate placement in ocean is invalid.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Value of the max water depth allowed.

TunableVariant.name: min_water_depth
TunableVariant.description: (float) If provided, each vertex of the test polygon along with its centroid will be tested to determine whether the ocean water at the test location is at least this deep. Values <= 0 indicate placement on land is valid.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Value of the min water depth allowed.

TunableTuple.name: water_depth_interval
TunableTuple.description: A water depth constraint which defines only the ocean water depth required.

TunableEnum.name: interval
TunableEnum.description: Test if a Sim should be walking, wading or swimming based on the water height offset at a target location and the Sim's wading interval data.

TunableEnum.name: constraints_target
TunableEnum.description: The target used to generate constraints relative to.

Tunable.name: must_be_line_of_sight
Tunable.description: If enabled, sims that succeed in the LOS test won't fail other tests when determining the test results.

TunableEnum.name: test_actor
TunableEnum.description: The actor used to test Sims in the constraint relative to.

Tunable.name: test_set
Tunable.description:
A test set instance that will be run on all Sims in the tuned constraint. If any Sims fail the test set instance, this test will fail.
Note: A DoubleSimResolver will be used to run these tests. So the Test Actor will be the Actor participant, and Target will be a Sim in the constraint.

TunableTuple.name: situation_availability
TunableTuple.description: Test whether it's possible for this Sim to host a particular Situation.

Tunable.name: situation
Tunable.description: The Situation to test against

TunableTuple.name: situation_count_test
TunableTuple.description: A tunable factory that tests how many of a specified situation are running against a tuned threshold requirement.

TunableList.name: additional_situations
TunableList.description: References to additional situations to test.

Tunable.name: situation
Tunable.description: A reference to the type of situation to test.

TunableTuple.name: test
TunableTuple.description: A Threshold test that specifies the allowed values for the count of the tuned situation.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The value of a threshold.

TunableTuple.name: situation_goal_test
TunableTuple.description: A tunable test to determine if the participant is in any situations that have one of the specified situation goals active.

TunableList.name: situation_goals
TunableList.description: One of the goals must be active in a situation that the Sim is in.

Tunable.description: A situation goal, that if active, will cause this test to return True.

TunableEnum.name: who
TunableEnum.description: The person(s) to test.

TunableTuple.name: situation_in_joinable_state_test
TunableTuple.description: Test whether it's possible for this Sim to host a particular Situation.

Tunable.name: situation
Tunable.description: The Situation to test against

TunableList.name: situation_tags
TunableList.description: Tags for arbitrary groupings of situation types.

TunableTuple.name: situation_job_test
TunableTuple.description: Require the tuned participant to have a specific situation job. If multiple participants, ALL participants must have the required job to pass.

Tunable.name: negate
Tunable.description: If checked then the test result will be reversed, so it will test to see if they are not in a job or not in role state that has matching tags.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The subject of this situation job test.

TunableList.name: role_tags
TunableList.description: The participant must have a job that matches the role_tags or have the situation_job.

TunableList.name: situation_jobs
TunableList.description: The participant must have this job in this list or a job that matches the role_tags.

TunableTuple.name: situation_object_comparison_test
TunableTuple.description: A test that checks the difference of Situations running to Objects existing.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The operator that we will use to compare the number of situations running to the number of objects that pass our criteria. Specifics: Situation Count <Operator> Object Count

TunableVariant.name: identity_test
TunableVariant.description: Which test to run on the object in order to determine if it matches or not.

Tunable.name: actual_object
Tunable.description: The object we want to test ownership of

TunableEnum.description: What tag to test for.

TunableEnum.name: test_type
TunableEnum.description: How to test the tags in the tag set against the objects on the lot.

Tunable.name: on_active_lot
Tunable.description: If checked, test whether or not the object is on the active lot. If unchecked the object can be either on the active lot or in the open streets area, we don't really care.

Tunable.name: owned
Tunable.description: If checked will test if the object is owned by the active household. If unchecked it doesn't matter who owns the object or if it is owned at all.

Tunable.name: situation
Tunable.description: The situation that we want to check for the running number of.

TunableTuple.name: situation_running_test
TunableTuple.description: A test to see if the participant is part of any situations that are running that satisfy the conditions of the test.

Tunable.name: check_for_initiating_sim
Tunable.description: If checked, the situation must be initiated by the tuned Participant.

TunableVariant.name: level
TunableVariant.description: A check for the level of the situation we are checking.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: A check for the level of the situation we are checking.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The value of a threshold.

TunableVariant.name: participant
TunableVariant.description: The subject of this situation test.

TunableEnum.name: enabled
TunableEnum.description: The subject of this situation test.

TunableVariant.name: situation_blacklist
TunableVariant.description: Blacklisted situations, specified by this set of references or by tag in Tag Blacklist, will cause this test to fail.

TunableVariant.name: situation_whitelist
TunableVariant.description: Only whitelisted situations, specified by this set of references or by tags in Tag Whitelist, can cause this test to pass. If no situations are specified in this whitelist, all situations are considered whitelisted.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: Only whitelisted situations, specified by this set of references or by tags in Tag Whitelist, can cause this test to pass. If no situations are specified in this whitelist, all situations are considered whitelisted.

TunableList.name: tag_blacklist
TunableList.description: Blacklisted situations, specified by this set of tags or by references in Situation Tag Blacklist, will cause this test to fail.

TunableVariant.name: tag_whitelist
TunableVariant.description: Only whitelisted situations, specified by this set of tags or by references in Situation Whitelist, can cause this test to pass. If this whitelist is not enabled, all situations are considered whitelisted.

TunableEnum.name: test_event
TunableEnum.description:
The test event that this test will run on when tuned within an objective or the main goal trigger of a sitaution.
If you are tuning this on an interaction then it will do nothing.

TunableTuple.name: skill_all_unlocked_maxed_out
TunableTuple.description: A test to determine if a sim has maxed out all their unlocked skills

Tunable.name: negate
Tunable.description: If this is true then it will negate the result of the test type. That means the test will return true if there is at least one unlocked skill that is not maxed out and false if all unlocked skills are maxed out.

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: The subject of this test.

TunableTuple.name: skill_dynamically_referenced_test
TunableTuple.description: A test requiring a Sim to have a dynamically referenced skill that is either above a threshold or within an interval.

TunableVariant.name: referenced_skill
TunableVariant.description:
Where to obtain the skill to test against.
Should the Sim not have the specified skill, or should the skill not be available because of pack restrictions, this Sim will be considered at level 0.

TunableTuple.name: from_career
TunableTuple.description: TunableFactory for specifying the career to get the statistic from for the TunableSkillLootData

Tunable.name: career
Tunable.description: The career to reference a statistic from.

TunableVariant.name: skill_range
TunableVariant.description: A skill range defined by either an interval or a threshold.

TunableTuple.name: interval
TunableTuple.description: A TunableThreshold that is specifically used in Skill Range Tests to determine if a skill meets the required skill level.

TunableTuple.name: skill_interval
TunableTuple.description: The range (inclusive) a skill level must be in to pass this test.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: A TunableThreshold that is specifically used in Skill Range Tests to determine if a skill meets the required skill level."

TunableTuple.name: skill_threshold
TunableTuple.description: The Threshold for the skill level to be valid.

TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The value of a threshold.

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: The subject of this test.

Tunable.name: use_effective_skill_level
Tunable.description: If checked, then instead of using the skill's actual level, the test will use the skill's effective level for the purpose of satisfying the specified criteria.

TunableTuple.name: skill_has_unlocked_all
TunableTuple.description: A test to determine if the target has unlocked all skills available to them

Tunable.name: include_unlocked_by_max
Tunable.description: If this is true, the test will also test skills which will become available when an available skill reaches max level (this is specified in 'Skill Unlocks On Max' in skill tuning.

Tunable.name: negate
Tunable.description: If this is true then it will negate the result of the test type. That means the test will return true if there is at least one skill which is not unlocked and false if all available skills are unlocked.

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: The subject of this test.

TunableTuple.name: skill_in_use
TunableTuple.description: A test requiring a participant to be actively progressing a skill.

TunableVariant.name: skill
TunableVariant.description: Specify the skill to test against.

Tunable.name: Specified_Skill
Tunable.description: "The skill to test against.

TunableEnum.name: who

TunableTuple.name: skill_tag
TunableTuple.description: A tunable test method that checks the TAGS of ALL THE PARTICIPANTS SKILLS each against a threshold.

Tunable.name: skill_quantity
Tunable.description: The minimum number of skills at or above this level required to pass.

TunableEnum.name: skill_tag

TunableTuple.name: skill_threshold
TunableTuple.description: The threshold level to test of each skill.

Tunable.description: If checked then we will only test the skill that actually changed.

The skill to test against.
Should the Sim not have the specified skill, or should the skill not be available because of pack restrictions, this Sim will be considered at level 0.

TunableTuple.name: skin_tone
TunableTuple.description: Test to see if the Sim has one of the specified skin tones.

Tunable.name: invert
Tunable.description: If true, invert the result of this test.

TunableList.name: skin_tones
TunableList.description: The Sim's skin tone must be one of the specified skin tones.

Tunable.description: A skin tone to test.

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: The subject of the test.

TunableTuple.name: slot_test
TunableTuple.description: Verify slot status. This test will only apply for single entity participants

Tunable.name: check_part_owner
Tunable.description: If enabled and target of tests is a part, the test will be run on the part owner instead.

TunableVariant.name: child_slot
TunableVariant.description: The slot on the participant to be tested.

Tunable.name: by_name
Tunable.description: The exact name of a slot on the participant to be tested.

Tunable.name: by_reference
Tunable.description: A particular slot type to be tested.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The subject of this situation data test.

Tunable.name: slot_count_required
Tunable.description: Minimum number of slots that must pass test only valid for reference slots And not if all are required to pass

TunableVariant.name: slot_test_type
TunableVariant.description: Type of slot test to run on target subject.

TunableTuple.name: has_empty_slot
TunableTuple.description: Verify the slot exists on the participant and it's unoccupied

Tunable.name: check_all_slots
Tunable.description: Check this if you want to check that all the slots of the subject are empty.

TunableTuple.name: has_used_slot
TunableTuple.description: Verify if any slot of the child slot type is currently occupied

Tunable.name: check_all_slots
Tunable.description: Check this if you want to check that all the slots of the subject are used.

TunableVariant.name: object_type
TunableVariant.description: If enabled one of the children in the used slot must be of a certain kind of object. This test can be done by definition id or object tags.

TunableVariant.name: enabled
TunableVariant.description:
If set to definition id then at least one of the child objects must pass the definition test specified.
If set to object tags then at least one of the child objects must pass the object tag test specified.

Tunable.name: actual_object
Tunable.description: The object we want to test ownership of

TunableEnum.description: What tag to test for.

TunableEnum.name: test_type
TunableEnum.description: How to test the tags in the tag set against the objects on the lot.

TunableTuple.name: slot_test_related
TunableTuple.description: A test against a single object with mulitple parts that returns True if a certain number of the parts manages to meet a set of slot tests requirements. In the case this targets a single part, it will verify that the single parts meets all the slot_tests.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The subject of this slot test.

Tunable.name: parts_required
Tunable.description: The number of parts that must pass all of the slot tests in order for this test to return True.

TunableList.name: slot_tests
TunableList.description: A list of slot tests that must all pass on a single part in order for that part to count.

TunableTuple.description: A tuple containing all the information for the slot tests.

Tunable.name: count_required
Tunable.description: Minimum number of slots that must pass the test (to either be empty or have children) before the requirement is met.

TunableVariant.name: requires_child
TunableVariant.description:
If set to has children then there must be a child in the slot to pass the test.
If not checked then the slot must be a empty in order to pass the test.

TunableTuple.name: Has_Children
TunableTuple.description: A tuple holding all of the different tuning for what matters about the child of a specified slot. For instance the test for what kind of object you are looking for in this specific slot type.

TunableVariant.name: object_type
TunableVariant.description: A test for what type of object at least one of the children of this slot must be.

TunableVariant.name: enabled
TunableVariant.description:
If set to definition id then at least one of the child objects must pass the definition test specified.
If set to object tags then at least one of the child objects must pass the object tag test specified.

Tunable.name: actual_object
Tunable.description: The object we want to test ownership of

TunableEnum.description: What tag to test for.

TunableEnum.name: test_type
TunableEnum.description: How to test the tags in the tag set against the objects on the lot.

Tunable.name: slot
Tunable.description: A particular slot type to be tested.

TunableTuple.name: social_boredom
TunableTuple.description: Test whether an affordance satisfies a tunable boredom threshold.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: The test will fail if the affordance's boredom does not satisfy this threshold.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The value of a threshold.

TunableTuple.name: social_context
TunableTuple.description: Test the Social Context of the specified participant.

TunableList.name: context_score_mappings
TunableList.description: A mapping of social contexts and their scores. If this is not empty, and all other tests passed, we will test if any context is in this mapping and include its score in a numeric test result. This won't affect True/False of the test result.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant against which to test social context.

TunableList.name: prohibited_set
TunableList.description: A set of contexts that are prohibited. The test will fail if the participant's social context is one of these entries.

TunableList.name: required_set
TunableList.description: A set of contexts that are required. If any context is specified, the test will fail if the participant's social context is not one of these entries.

TunableEnum.name: target_subject
TunableEnum.description: The participant that must be included in participant's social group in order for this test to rely solely on the participant's current STC. If target_subject is not in any of participant's social groups, then the STC test will only consider the prevailing STC between participant and target_subject.

TunableTuple.name: social_group
TunableTuple.description: Require a Sim to be part of a specified social group type, and optionally if that group's size is within a tunable threshold.

TunableVariant.name: additional_participant
TunableVariant.description: Test if this participant is or is not in the same social group as Subject.

Tunable.name: in_group
Tunable.description: If enabled, this additional participant must be in the group. If disabled, this additional participant can't be in the group.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant that must also be or not be in the social group.

TunableVariant.name: check_if_entire_group_is_active
TunableVariant.display: Check If Entire Group Is Active
TunableVariant.description: If enabled then this test will check to see if the entire group is active or not.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: If checked then the test will pass if the entire social group is active. If unchecked then the test will pass if there are sims in the social group that are not active.

TunableVariant.name: social_group_type
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the participant must have this type of group available. If this is disabled, any group will work.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The required social group type.

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: The subject of this social group test.

TunableVariant.name: threshold
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, tests the group size to ensure it's within a threshold.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: Optional social group size threshold test.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The value of a threshold.

TunableTuple.name: sound_matches_stored_audio_component
TunableTuple.description: A test that returns true if the specified sound matches the sound stored in the participant's stored audio component.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant of the interaction whose stored audio component will be compared against the sound.

Tunable.name: sound
Tunable.description: The propx to compare.

TunableTuple.name: state
TunableTuple.description: Gate availability by object state. By default, the test will use the state's linked stat as a fallback in case the target doesn't have the state involved.

TunableVariant.name: fallback_behavior
TunableVariant.description: What to do if the given object doesn't have the state in question.

TunableEnum.name: operator
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to use.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The value to compare to.

TunableEnum.name: who
TunableEnum.description: Who or what to apply this test to.

TunableTuple.name: state_white_black
TunableTuple.description: A tunable test that checks the states an object has against a WhiteBlackList.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: Who or what to apply this test to.

TunableTuple.name: states
TunableTuple.description: The target's states much conform to the white black list.

TunableVariant.name: blacklist
TunableVariant.description: When an item is tested against this white/black list, it is only allowed if it is not in the blacklist. If no blacklist is specified, no items are disallowed.

TunableTuple.name: specify
TunableTuple.description: A tunable blacklist.

TunableList.name: blacklist
TunableList.description: Blacklisted items.

Tunable.description: Allowed and disallowed states.

TunableVariant.name: threshold
TunableVariant.description: Tunable option for how many items must be in the blacklist for the blacklist to fail when testing a collection of items. By default, only one object needs to be in the list.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: When testing a collection of items, the number of items in that collection that are in the blacklist must pass this threshold test for the blacklist to disallow them all.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

TunableVariant.name: whitelist
TunableVariant.description: When an item is tested against this white/black list, it is only allowed if it is in the whitelist. If no whitelist is specified, all items are allowed.

TunableTuple.name: specify
TunableTuple.description: A tunable whitelist.

TunableVariant.name: threshold
TunableVariant.description: Tunable option for how many items must be in the whitelist for the whitelist to pass when testing a collection of items. By default, only one object needs to be in the list.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: When testing a collection of items, the number of items in that collection that are in the whitelist must pass this threshold test for the whitelist to allow them all.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

TunableList.name: whitelist
TunableList.description: Whitelisted items.

Tunable.description: Allowed and disallowed states.

TunableTuple.name: statistic
TunableTuple.description: A test that checks whether or not a statistic is at a certain threshold for a given participant. It can also test whether or not the participant has the statistic explicitly added on them.

Tunable.name: must_have_stat
Tunable.description: Setting this to True (checked) will ensure that this test only passes if the tested Sim actually has the statistic referenced. If left False (unchecked), this test will evaluate as if the Sim had the statistic at the value of 0

TunableVariant.name: score_to_use
TunableVariant.description: Depending on the choice, this decides what value to use for the threshold comparison.

TunableTuple.name: points
TunableTuple.description: Use the raw points for the comparison in the test.

TunableTuple.name: rank
TunableTuple.description: Use the rank value for the comparison in the test.

TunableTuple.name: user_value
TunableTuple.description: Use the user value for the comparison in the test.

Tunable.name: highest_level_reached_instead
Tunable.description: If checked this will test against the highest level reached. This currently only works with Ranked Statistics. Other statistics do not have a notion of highest level reached. If we are using something that doesn't support highest level reached it will test against the current level instead.

Tunable.name: stat

TunableVariant.description: The value or state threshold to test against.

TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.description: The value of a threshold.

TunableEnum.description: Who or what to apply this test to.

Tunable.name: must_have_stat

TunableVariant.name: score_to_use
TunableVariant.description: Depending on the choice, this decides what value to use for the threshold comparison.

If we are using something that doesn't support highest level reached it will test against the current level instead.

TunableVariant.name: threshold
TunableVariant.description: The value or state threshold to test against.

TunableTuple.description: Value/comparison pair used to define a Threshold.

Tunable.name: negate

TunableList.name: whitelist_topics
TunableList.description: The Sim must have any topic in this list to pass this test.

TunableTuple.name: total_event_simoleons_earned

TunableEnum.name: earned_source
TunableEnum.description: The individual source that we want to track the simoleons from.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: The simoleons threshold for this test.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The value of a threshold.

TunableTuple.name: total_time_played
TunableTuple.description: This test is specifically for account based Achievements, upon client connect testing if the players account has played the game long enough in either sim time or server time to pass a threshold of sim or server minutes, respectively. NOTE: The smallest

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: The amount of time played to pass, measured in the specified unit of time.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The value of a threshold.

TunableEnum.name: time_unit
TunableEnum.description: The unit of time used for testing

Tunable.name: use_sim_time
Tunable.description: Whether to use sim time, or server time.

TunableTuple.name: trait
TunableTuple.description: Test to require a Sim to have or not have certain specific traits.

Tunable.name: apply_thresholds_on_individual_basis
Tunable.description:
If checked then Num Whitelist Required and Num Blacklist Allowed will be applied to each individual participant from the subject. If unchecked then it will apply the values to the total whitelist and blacklist matches on the group.
IMPORTANT!!! In the case of objectives this should probably be set to false since we know that this is coming from only one sim and that we want to use the value that comes out of the test result numeric. This isn't just locked to being this value since there are valid cases within that system when you are looking at a group of sims and could want to test that one of your sims passes. Ex. Having a ghost sim in the household.

TunableList.name: blacklist_trait_types
TunableList.description: The Sim is required to not have traits of these types to pass this test. Should Num Blacklist Allowed be specified, then the Sim is allowed to have up to that amount of blacklisted traits before failing this test.

TunableList.name: blacklist_traits
TunableList.description: The is required to not have traits from this list in order to pass this test. Should num_blacklist_allowed be specified, then the Sim is allowed to have up to that amount of blacklisted traits before failing this test.

Tunable.description: A blacklist trait.

Tunable.name: num_blacklist_allowed
Tunable.description: The threshold of blacklist traits owned by the specified Sim that will trigger a test failure.

Tunable.name: num_whitelist_required
Tunable.description: The number of whitelist traits that the specified Sim is required to have in order to pass this test.

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: The participant that is to be the subject of the test.

TunableList.name: whitelist_trait_types
TunableList.description: The Sim is required to have the specified number of traits with these types in order to pass the test.

TunableList.name: whitelist_traits
TunableList.description: The Sim is required to have the specified number of traits from this list in order to pass the test.

Tunable.description: A whitelist trait. Please note: for pack-safe entries that are not loaded, the game will behave as if the entry doesn't exist. This allows you to specify a pack trait and required count of 1 and always fail the test should the appropriate pack not be installed.

TunableTuple.name: trait_comparison
TunableTuple.description: A test to check different conditions about the traits from two different Sims.

Tunable.name: invert_result
Tunable.description: If checked, invert the test result.

TunableEnum.name: sim_a
TunableEnum.description: One of the sims to check traits against another sim.

TunableEnum.name: sim_b
TunableEnum.description: The other sim to check traits against.

TunableTuple.name: conflict
TunableTuple.description: The test passes if Sim A and Sim B have any conflicting traits.

TunableList.name: trait_types
TunableList.description: This test checks for conflicts among the traits of these types from Sim A and Sim B. If no type is specified, it only checks for PERSONALITY traits.

TunableTuple.name: match
TunableTuple.description: Check if sims have matching traits of a certain type.

Tunable.name: minimum_number_of_matches
Tunable.description: Sim A and B should have at least this number of traits of the specified type in common to pass.

TunableEnum.name: trait_type
TunableEnum.description: The trait type to check.

TunableTuple.name: travel_group

Tunable.description: If checked, the travel group that any sims in the participant's household will be used in the event that the participant is not actually on vacation.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The subject whose travel group is the object of this test.

TunableVariant.name: test_type
TunableVariant.description: The type of test to determine what about this travel group's size we care about.

TunableTuple.name: can_extend
TunableTuple.description: Use this option to check whether or not a participant can extend their vacation. This test will fail if the participant is not in a travel group or their travel group does not have an end time specified.

TunableTuple.description: Use this option when you're testing for a specific number of free slots in the travel group.

TunableTuple.name: count
TunableTuple.description: The number of required free slots for the specified travel group.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The range of required free slots.

TunableTuple.description: Use this option when testing to see if the participant exists in the travel group or not.

Tunable.name: exists
Tunable.description: If checked, this test will fail if the Sim is not in a travel group. If unchecked, this test will fail if the Sim is in a travel group.

TunableTuple.description: Use this option when you're testing a specific Sim being added to the travel group.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant to be added.

TunableTuple.name: wading_interval_test
TunableTuple.description: Test if a Sim should be walking, wading or swimming based on the water height offset at a target location and the Sim's wading interval data.

Tunable.name: negate
Tunable.description: If checked, negate the result of the specified test.

TunableEnum.name: subject
TunableEnum.description: The subject to test to determine if they should walk, wade or swim based on the water height at the targets location.

TunableEnum.name: target
TunableEnum.description: The target whose location will be used to determine the water height.

TunableVariant.name: test
TunableVariant.description: The type of test to run against the subjects wading interval and the targets location.

TunableTuple.name: custom
TunableTuple.description: Test the height of the water against a custom interval. This can be used when we would like to test an interval that doesn't correspond to a specific walkstyle.

TunableTuple.name: height_range
TunableTuple.description: A tunable interval between lower_bound and upper_bound.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

TunableTuple.name: walkstyle_cost

TunableEnum.name: subject

Tunable.name: walkstyle
Tunable.description: Walkstyle that will be evaluated.

TunableTuple.name: weather
TunableTuple.description:
WeatherTest will test against the current weather.
If Seasons pack is not installed, the effective weather will be warm with everything else 0/False

TunableList.name: blacklist
TunableList.description:
If any are specified, the value of all must be <= the blacklist threshold for the test to pass.
If weather_service is not running, test will pass if partly_cloudy is in white list (or whitelist is empty) but not black list.

Tunable.name: blacklist_threshold
Tunable.description: The maximum value for each of the blacklist cloud types for the test to pass.

TunableList.name: whitelist
TunableList.description:
If any are specified, the value of one must be > the whitelist threshold for the test to pass.
If weather_service is not running, test will pass if partly_cloudy is in white list (or whitelist is empty) but not black list.

Tunable.name: whitelist_threshold
Tunable.description: The value of a whitelist cloudtype must be above this threshold to pass.

TunableTuple.name: weather_type
TunableTuple.description:
WeatherTypeTest will test against the current type of weather.
If Seasons pack is not installed, the weather type will be UNDEFINED.

Tunable.name: invert
Tunable.description: If checked must NOT be the specified weather type.

TunableList.name: weather_types
TunableList.description:
The weather types we are testing. Passes test if any current weather type matches any tuned here.
If seasons pack is not installed, weather type will be UNDEFINED. So with EP5 not installed: Test will always pass if UNDEFINED is in the set if not inverted, and fail if it isn't in the set. Test will always fail if UNDEFINED is in the set if inverted, and pass if it isn't in the set.
i.e. to test out swimming in freezing weather only and always allow it with seasons uninstalled, set would only have WeatherType.Freezing and be inverted.
To allow playing in puddles in hot weather or if weather pack isn't installed, set would have both WeatherType.Hot and UNDEFINED, and not be inverted .

TunableVariant.name: business_tests
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, test if the specified zone is a business or not.

TunableVariant.name: enabled
TunableVariant.description: Test if the zone is a business, an open business, or a closed business.

TunableTuple.name: is_business
TunableTuple.description: Test if the zone specified by the zone id is a business or not.

TunableTuple.name: is_business_open
TunableTuple.description: Test if the zone specified by the zone id is an open business.

TunableVariant.name: is_apartment
TunableVariant.description: If checked, test will pass if the zone is an apartment. If unchecked, test passes if the zone is NOT an apartment. Useful in aspiration tuning, to discriminate between property types in tests of lot value. Allows "Own a House worth X" and "Own an Apartment worth X"

TunableTuple.name: Is_or_is_not_apartment_zone
TunableTuple.display: Is Or Is Not Apartment Zone
TunableTuple.description: Test whether the zone is an apartment or not.

Tunable.name: consider_penthouse_an_apartment
Tunable.description: If enabled, we will consider penthouses to be apartments when testing them against the apartment check.

Tunable.name: is_apartment
Tunable.description: If checked, test will pass if the zone is an apartment. If unchecked, test passes if the zone is NOT an apartment.

TunableVariant.name: is_penthouse
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, test whether or not the current zone is a penthouse.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: If checked, the zone must be a penthouse. If unchecked, the zone cannot be a penthouse.

Tunable.name: use_source_venue
Tunable.description: If enabled, the test will test the source venue instead of the active venue. For example, the Community Lot instead of the active Marketplace. Testing the active venue is the default.

TunableVariant.name: venue_tier
TunableVariant.description: If checked, will verify that the zone's venue is at the tuned tier. If "no valid tier" is selected, this test will be True if either the current venue doesn't have tiers or if it does but it doesn't currently meet any of their requirements.

Tunable.name: tier_number
Tunable.description: The index of the tier to test. This test will return true if this tier is active and false otherwise. This should be the index of the tier in the tier list and not any player-facing index. For instance, if a tier list had a single tier, that tier would be 0, and if a second tier were added, that second tier would be 1.

TunableVariant.description: If checked, will verify the zone's venue type is allowed or disallowed.

TunableList.description: Whitelisted items.

Tunable.description: World to check against.

TunableVariant.name: zone_modifiers
TunableVariant.description: if enabled, we test the zone modifiers allowed or disallowed.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: The zone's modifiers must pass this whitelist and blacklist for the test to pass.

TunableVariant.name: blacklist
TunableVariant.description: When an item is tested against this white/black list, it is only allowed if it is not in the blacklist. If no blacklist is specified, no items are disallowed.

TunableTuple.name: specify
TunableTuple.description: A tunable blacklist.

TunableList.name: blacklist
TunableList.description: Blacklisted items.

Tunable.description: Allowed and disallowed zone modifiers.

TunableVariant.name: threshold
TunableVariant.description: Tunable option for how many items must be in the blacklist for the blacklist to fail when testing a collection of items. By default, only one object needs to be in the list.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: When testing a collection of items, the number of items in that collection that are in the blacklist must pass this threshold test for the blacklist to disallow them all.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

TunableVariant.name: whitelist
TunableVariant.description: When an item is tested against this white/black list, it is only allowed if it is in the whitelist. If no whitelist is specified, all items are allowed.

TunableTuple.name: specify
TunableTuple.description: A tunable whitelist.

TunableVariant.name: threshold
TunableVariant.description: Tunable option for how many items must be in the whitelist for the whitelist to pass when testing a collection of items. By default, only one object needs to be in the list.

TunableTuple.name: threshold
TunableTuple.description: When testing a collection of items, the number of items in that collection that are in the whitelist must pass this threshold test for the whitelist to allow them all.

TunableEnum.name: comparison
TunableEnum.description: The comparison to perform against the value.

TunableList.name: whitelist
TunableList.description: Whitelisted items.

Tunable.description: Allowed and disallowed zone modifiers.

TunableTuple.name: value_from_test_set_list
TunableTuple.description: Choose a new state value by going through a list of test-value pairs. The first test set to pass chooses its state value as the new value. If no test sets pass, no new value will be set at all. If you want to make sure there is a fallback value, add an additional entry with only a new value set. Since an empty test set always passes, that value will be the fallback.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description:
A list of tests groups. At least one must pass all its sub- tests to pass the TestSet.
ORs of ANDs

TunableEnum.name: state_change_target
TunableEnum.description: Who or what to change the state on.

TunableVariant.name: timing
TunableVariant.description: When to change the state's value.

TunableTuple.name: at_end
TunableTuple.description: Change the state value at the end of the sequence.

TunableEnum.name: criticality
TunableEnum.description: The criticality of making the state change.

TunableTuple.name: immediately
TunableTuple.description: Change the state value at the beginning of the sequence.

TunableTuple.name: on_xevt
TunableTuple.description: Set the new state value in sync with an animation event with a particular id. In the case no matching event occurs in the animation, the value will still be set at the end of the sequence.

TunableEnum.name: criticality
TunableEnum.description: The criticality of making the state change.

Tunable.name: xevt_id
Tunable.description: An xevt on which to change the state's value.

TunableTuple.name: university_enrollment_ui
TunableTuple.description: Basic Extra to notify the UI so the enrollment UI is displayed for the sim.

Tunable.name: is_reenrollment
Tunable.description: If checked, the enrollment UI will be considered re-enrollment where the dialog has preselected university and major.

TunableTuple.name: success_chance
TunableTuple.description: The percentage chance that this action will be applied.

Tunable.name: base_chance
Tunable.description: The basic chance of success.

TunableList.name: multipliers
TunableList.description: A list of multipliers to apply to base_chance.

Tunable.name: multiplier
Tunable.description: The multiplier to apply to base_chance if the associated tests pass.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A series of tests that must pass in order for multiplier to be applied.

TunableVariant.name: timing
TunableVariant.description: Determines the exact timing of the behavior, either at the beginning of an interaction, the end, or when an xevt occurs in an animation played as part of the interaction.

TunableTuple.name: at_beginning
TunableTuple.description: The behavior should occur at the very beginning of the interaction. It will not be tightly synchronized visually with animation. This isn't a very common use case and would most likely be used in an immediate interaction or to change hidden state that is used for bookkeeping rather than visual appearance.

TunableVariant.name: offset_time
TunableVariant.description:
If enabled, the interaction will wait this amount of time after the beginning before running the element.
Only use this if absolutely necessary. Better alternatives include using xevts, time based conditional action with loot ops, and using outcomes.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The interaction will wait this amount of time after the beginning before running the element

TunableTuple.name: at_end
TunableTuple.description: The behavior should occur at the end of the interaction. It will not be tightly synchronized visually with animation. An example might be an object that gets dirty every time a Sim uses it (so using a commodity change is overkill) but no precise synchronization with animation is desired, as might be the case with vomiting in the toilet.

TunableTuple.name: on_xevt
TunableTuple.description:
The behavior should occur synchronized visually with an xevt in an animation played as part of the interaction. If for some reason such an event doesn't occur, the behavior will occur at the end of the interaction unless supports failsafe is False.
This is by far the most common use case, as when a Sim flushes a toilet and the water level should change when the actual flush animation and effects fire.

Tunable.name: supports_failsafe
Tunable.description: If checked and the x-event does not fire, the basic extra will still run at the end of the interaction as a fail-safe.

TunableTuple.name: vfx
TunableTuple.description: An element that triggers vfx during an interaction. This is useful if we need to play vfx for interactions with no animations.

TunableVariant.name: participant
TunableVariant.description: The object or objects to play the effect on.

TunableTuple.name: from_gardening
TunableTuple.description: The generated objects are those gardening objects that are within the specified distance from the tuned participant.

Tunable.name: distance
Tunable.description: The distance used to determine which objects are generated.

TunableVariant.name: object_type
TunableVariant.description: The type of gardening object to return.

TunableTuple.name: harvestables
TunableTuple.description: Return all harvestables, i.e. all fruits/flowers parented to plants.

TunableTuple.name: plants
TunableTuple.description: Return all plants.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The object used as a center point for distance calculations.

TunableTuple.name: from_participant
TunableTuple.description: Specify a participant type to generate objects based on this interaction.

TunableVariant.name: in_slot
TunableVariant.description: slots of the participant object from which the target objects should be pulled.

Tunable.name: by_name
Tunable.description: The exact name of a slot on the parent object in which the object should be.

Tunable.name: by_reference
Tunable.description: A particular slot type in which the object should be.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant determining which objects are to be generated.

TunableTuple.name: from_stored_object_component
TunableTuple.description: Return the stored object of the specified type from the stored object component of the specified participant.S

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant from which the stored object is returned.

TunableEnum.name: stored_object_type
TunableEnum.description: The type of object to apply loot actions to.

TunableTuple.name: success_chance
TunableTuple.description: The percentage chance that this action will be applied.

Tunable.name: base_chance
Tunable.description: The basic chance of success.

TunableList.name: multipliers
TunableList.description: A list of multipliers to apply to base_chance.

Tunable.name: multiplier
Tunable.description: The multiplier to apply to base_chance if the associated tests pass.

TdescFragTag.description: A series of tests that must pass in order for multiplier to be applied.

TunableTuple.name: vfx
TunableTuple.description: The effect to play.

Tunable.name: effect_name
Tunable.description: The name of the effect to play.

TunableVariant.name: joint_name
TunableVariant.description: Specify if the visual effect is attached to a slot and, if so, which slot.

Tunable.name: Slot
Tunable.description: The name of the slot this effect is attached to.

Tunable.name: play_immediate
Tunable.description:
If checked, this effect will be triggered immediately, nothing will block.
ex. VFX will be played immediately while the Sim is routing or animating.

TunableVariant.name: vfx_lifetime
TunableVariant.description: Define how the lifetime of this visual effect is managed.

TunableTuple.name: animation_event
TunableTuple.description: The visual effects are stopped when the specified xevent is triggered by animation.

Tunable.name: event
Tunable.description: The event triggering the VFX stop.

TunableTuple.name: continuation
TunableTuple.description: The visual effect's duration is tied to this interaction's continuation chain. The effect terminates when the last continuation ends.

TunableTuple.name: interaction
TunableTuple.description: The visual effect's duration is strictly tied to this interaction.

TunableTuple.name: one_shot
TunableTuple.description: The visual effect is triggered as a one-shot. Its duration is defined in the Swarm file.

TunableVariant.name: vfx_target
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the visual effect is set to target a specific joint on another object or Sim.

Tunable.name: joint_name
Tunable.description: The name of the slot this effect is targeted to.

TunableEnum.name: participant
TunableEnum.description: The participant this visual effect targets.

TunableTuple.name: walls_up_override
TunableTuple.description:
Element that allows all walls and levels to go up if enabled to override the current setting.
If not set to enabled, it will just undo the override.

Tunable.name: enable
Tunable.description:
Set to True to enable the override. False to disable it.
A user moving the camera manually will also cancel the override.
